loans.name: Maa Tarini Group

texts.en:
Maa Tarini, a Joint Liability Group, was formed in the year 2009 by four active women of Khariar town of Nuapada district in Odisha, India. Hemalata is one of the members of this group, standing second from the right with raised hand. She is 38 years of age and lives with her husband, one son of 18 years and one daughter of 15 years. 

Hemalata is running a business of milk-selling with five milking buffaloes and her husband is running a daily needs store with items like bread, jam, soap, shampoo, toothbrushes, toothpaste, cold drinks etc. From their two businesses they earn a monthly income of 10,000 INR. The daily needs store of Hemalata’s husband in a center point of the town and for his good behavior, people like to purchase from his store. But due to financal problem he could not meet the demand of the customers. Therefore, Hemalata is helping her husband by taking loan from Mahashakti Foundation. From the previous four loans, her husband has been able to keep stock of the daily needs items and trying to fill the demand of the customers.

From the present loan Hemalata wants to purchase stock of bread, jam, soap, shampoo, toothbrushes, toothpaste, cold drinks, etc. for her husband’s business. From this investment she expects a good return for the total development of her business. With this extra income she is planning to repair and renovate her buffalo shed.

Hemalata hopes to develop her daily needs shop into a wholesale store. The other three members of this group are Pramila, Aneli and Gomati who are running a general grocery shop, a fancy store, and mobile phone repairing and selling center respectively. The group members are thankful to Mahashakti Foundation and KIVA for the continuous support.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of bread, jam, soap,  shampoo, toothbrushes, toothpaste, cold drinks, etc.

loans.name: Duch

texts.en:
Duch is 47 years old and married with six children. She permanently lives with her family in the province of Kompong Speu. Duch and her spouse help each other in managing their farmland in order to provide basic necessities for their family. Aside from farming, she is also involved in raising poultry at home. She has been in these fields for ages.

She would like to borrow a loan to help her daughter. Her daughter wants to open a wedding embellishment and beauty salon but she lacks adequate capital. With this loan support, she believes that her daughter will be able to start up a business and turn it into a viable source of income. Thanks to the lenders for their help.

loans.use: to open a wedding embellishment and beauty salon.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Nhem is 52 years old and a loving father of three children. He lives with his spouse and children in the province of Kompong Speu. For a long time, he has been dedicated to farming to make a livelihood. He is happy because he has support from his wife and children. 

He is taking out a loan through HKL to buy a motorcycle since he has no vehicle to serve for the household. This purchase will facilitate their transportation needs and reduce unnecessary traveling expenses. His dream is to have a plowing machine, and other machines with different functions, to help him in farming.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Herman

texts.en:
Herman has been working in the trucking industry for more than 25 years; he recently retired from his job in California and moved to Baton Rouge, Louisiana where he decided to start his own trucking business.

One month into his entrepreneurship, Herman knew he would need additional financial support and turned to the Small Business Development Center in Baton Rouge, who then recommended microlender Accion Texas Inc. Herman applied for a loan and received funds for trucking fees and office equipment.

Future plans include hiring one part and one full-time employee and offering services across the complete state of Louisiana and neighboring states.

The absence of paid trucking fees would have hindered Herman’s ability to the amount of business, and therefore, his potential income.

loans.use: to cover trucking fees and office expenses.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
This is Jovelyn. Her previous loan was a big help with her variety store as she was able to buy more grocery items, toiletries, and beverages. Her income from her business assisted with the education of her children and helped in their everyday expenses. She also has an electronic loading station for additional income. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their family's everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jovelyn hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
This is Jorge. His previous loan was a big help in his business. He was able to buy the sacks of rice that he needed in his business. His income from his business helped him sustain his family's everyday needs. He also rents a house for additional income. He and his partner are helping each other to provide for their family.

He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan that he will use to pay for more sacks of rice for his business. More items to sell will result in better profits. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jorge dreams of being more successful in his business and hopes that his family will always be in good health and condition. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and there, he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more sacks of rice needed in his business.

loans.name: Jay Matadi Group

texts.en:
Pinki is a married woman of 28 years old and lives in Khariar town of Nuapada district of Odisha, India. The lady standing on the extreme right with raised hand is Pinki. She hails from a Schedule Caste family. She lives with her four-member family, consisting of her husband and two sons of six and four years old. 

Pinki has been running a general store at the bus stand of the town for the last 12 years with the help of her husband. Initially she started the business in a low profile with limited items like soap, tobacco, chocolates, biscuits, mixtures, etc. Gradually, she expanded her business and added extra items like mineral water and cold drinks with refrigerator from her last four loans from Mahashakti Foundation, by forming a group called Jay Matadi with four other members. Due to her husband’s good behavior, her business grew very fast. Now she is earning 400 INR daily from her business which is not sufficient for her to manage the business. 

Pinki is planning to purchase more stock of daily needs items like biscuits, mixtures, cake, bread, cold drinks etc. in bulk from the present loan to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase another refrigerator for storing food items. She expects to increase her sales and thereby her income, which will serve to ensure the education and welfare of her children. Pinki dreams of providing better education to her two children.

The other four members of the group are Bhumisuta, Kaushalya, Sabina and Kausalya, running a mobile phone repairing and selling center, a betel nut shop,  a tiffin center and a little restaurant respectively.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of biscuits, mixtures, cakes, breads, cold drinks, etc.

loans.name: Uma Devi Group

texts.en:
The name of this Joint Liability Group is Uma Devi, located at Khariar town of Nuapada district of Odisha, India. This group was formed in the year 2009 comprising four active and able women. Amanti is one of the members of this group who is standing second from the right with raised hand in the photo. She is a very confident lady and possesses a strong determination for the development of her family. She is 37 years old; living with her husband, two daughters of 16 and 14 years and a son of 10 years old in her small village named Khudpej which is seven miles away from Khariar town. 

Amanti is running a tailoring center in her house with one sewing machine where she takes orders for stitching ladies' garments. Her husband has also been running an established tailoring center called Star Tailors at Khariar town for last ten years. He has engaged five workers for stitching. He is very popular for stitching of gents garments. Amanti and her husband earn a monthly income of 8,000 INR from the two businesses, which hardly allows them to manage both the family and educational expenses of the children. So they are planning to expand the business at Khariar to earn some extra income. This is the fifth loan for Amanti and from this loan she wants to purchase another machine and pants and shirts pieces for selling. She is very hopeful that this investment will help her. She hopes to give better education to her children. 
  
The other three members of this group are Rekha, Jashu and Sima, running a tiffin center, a general store and a fruit stall respectively.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a sewing machine and pants and shirts cloth pieces to sell

loans.name: Jay Bajarangi Group

texts.en:
Gunjalata, aged 45, is a hard-working lady from Tukla village of Nuapada district in Odisha, India. The lady standing on the extreme left with raised hand is Gunjalata. She is residing with her husband (age 55), two sons of 15 and 22 and one daughter of 18 years old. She herself has been running a general grocery store selling daily need items like potatoes, rice, oil, soap, shampoo, biscuits, tea, sugar, etc. for last 15 years and her husband is running a tailoring center in their house. All of her family members assist each other to manage the businesses. She earns a monthly income of 8000 INR from the existing business which is just hand to mouth for the family.

In the year 2009 Gunjalata, along with  three other members from her village formed a Joint Liability Group to access loans from Mahashakti foundation for developing their business.  Prior to this, Gunjalata has already accessed four loans from Mahashakti Foundation and each time she has been able to add some extra items to her shop. This is the fifth loan for her  and from one part of this loan she wants to  purchase stock of potatoes, rice, oil, soap, shampoo, biscuits, tea, sugar, etc. in bulk  from the nearest wholesale market to avoid the regular transportation cost and loss due to price variation. From the other part she will purchase some materials like thread, buttons, etc. and fabric for her husband’s tailoring center. 

Gunjalata believes she will earn more income from this investment which will help her to manage her family expenses smoothly. She hopes to construct a good house and arrange the marriage ceremony of her daughter in a decent manner.

The other three members of the groups are Bimala and Basnati with cloth vending businesses and Basumati with a general grocery shop and cloth vending business.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing potatoes, rice, oil, soap, shampoo, biscuits, tea, sugar, etc. and thread, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Faitma was offered a $ 600 loan to improve her business. Fatima opened her kiosk in 2007 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock for her store like cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, milks, noodles, water, oil, slippers, and soap. Fatima is generating a good income from selling her stock. She is living in a town with her family, she is married, and she has four children. She is happy with this loan because it was offered for poor people and will improve her business in the future

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, milks, noodles, and water

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
This is Maricar. Her previous loan was a big help, not just in her business, but also in the education of her children and the family's household expenditures. She was able to buy more products for her variety store, which resulted in higher income. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Maricar would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 10,000, for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in greater profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maricar hopes that her business will flourish even more and dreams that her family will always be complete and intact. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 41 years old and married with three children, two of whom are enrolled in school. She earns a living by farming rice and raising poultry in the Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham. Sok has been involved in agriculture for more than ten years. She is working tirelessly because she wants to provide basic needs for her family and educate her children to a higher level.

Sok is borrowing 1,000 USD through HKL to buy farming supplies needed for her farm as well as duck feed. She is thankful for the loan support, which enables her to cover operating costs and gradually improve her business.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies needed for her farm as well as duck feed.

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Soem is 29 years old and is dedicated to her family, which has four members. She is involved in the business of selling fruits. She helps her husband generate income. Her husband is recognized by their neighbors as a Tuk Tuk driver. This couple has fought for their two children to be able to get ahead and have better opportunities. 

She is now seeking a loan from HKL to buy a motorcycle for her husband, to allow him to continuously provide transportation services, as his old motorcycle was broken and it needs to be replaced. With the remaining funds, she will invest in expanding her business and buying more fruits to sell. She hopes to have better living conditions with the help from this loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband to continuously provide transportation service.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is a 52-year-old married woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari, or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her town. This is the source of her income. 

Romana is asking for a loan to buy stock to sell such as canned goods, candies, soda and other beverages, soap, and toiletries. With this, she will be able to expand the diversity of her items, thus attracting more buyers and customers. Romana dreams of making her business a success and gaining a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell, such as canned goods, candies, soda and other beverages, soap, and toiletries

loans.name: Selinda

texts.es: La Sra. Selinda  tiene 34 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de 9 y 12 años que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la localidad de Taruma,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces y refrescos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la mucha demanda que tiene y es ahí donde incrementa sus ventas, y necesita surtir su mercadería, Sra. Selinda  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su tienda y seguir creciendo más cada día, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una tienda surtida, así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Selinda is 34 years old and has two children, age 9 and 12, who are of school age. She sells basic necessity products at her neighborhood store in the town of Taruma. This loan is her first transaction with Emprender. She will use the loan to buy merchandise to restock her business, such as groceries, sweets, and soft drinks. Her reason for requesting this loan is to satisfy the great demand with needed inventory, which will increase her sales.

Sra. Selinda faces challenges in her business, including competition from the different stores in the area. By utilizing the benefits of this loan, she will be able to buy more merchandise and restock her store, which will help her keep growing each day. Her wish for her business is to continue selling and having a store that is stocked. As a result, she will grow her business, increase her earnings, and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to restock her store.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana nació en la Provincia de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en la provincia antes mencionada, ella tiene 38 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la venta de comida por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo verduras, carne, arroz, fideos, aceite, papa y otras cosas, ella agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

Ella pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en:
Juliana was born in the province of Paucartambo and still lives there with her family. She is 38 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has six children. Juliana is a hardworking and enterprising mother who is able to move her family forward through the effort of her work. She has a business of selling food, so she is taking this opportunity to request a loan for buying supplies such as vegetables, meat, rice, noodles, oil, potatoes, and other items. She is grateful to those who have helped her fulfill her dream in this manner.

Juliana values this loan and promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility. She is a member of the Communal Bank “San Martincito”, which is affiliated with Asociación Arariwa in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, rice, noodles, oil, potatoes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Dulia

texts.en:
This is Ma. Dulia, 47, resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Beato, her business partner, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Ma. Dulia sells corn. She buys huge quantities of corn, cooks the corn, and sell it. She has a cart and a drum where she cooks the corn. Her regular customers are the local tourists in her community.  She earns a minimum of 800 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more corn to expand her product inventory. 

Ma. Dulia dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her family will have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay back micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for corn, needed in her business

loans.name: Dianora Del Socorro

texts.es: Dianora es una señora bien Optimista en cuanto al desarrollo académico ,actualmente está estudiando licenciatura en maestra de educación primaria, es Casada con 1 hijo a su cargo, al  que tiene que proporcionarle  las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrolle, estudia en el colegio del municipio, Una de las necesidades que la señora  Dianora  atraviesa hoy en día es de graduarse como licenciada en educación primaria, producto del gran esfuerzo realizado para alcanzar tan deseado sueño, ya que debido a esta necesidad, le `permitió tomar la decisión sabia de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para realizar los estudios de sus sueños,  el que le beneficiara aun mas en su centro laborar, por el nivel académico que presentaría, lo que de paso le vendría mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Dianora's a very optimistic woman in terms of her academic development.  Currently she's studying for her degree to be an elementary school teacher.

She's married with one child in her care for whom she has to provide the necessary conditions for growth.  He studies in the town school.

One thing Dianora needs currently is to graduate with her degree in elementary education, the product of the great effort she has made to realize the dream she wants so much.  This allowed her to make the wise decision of going to CEPRODEL to request a loan to carry out the studies of her dreams.  This will benefit her even more at work because of the academic level she would have, which then would improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition and fees

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is married with seven children. Angelina is 62 years old and lives in Gata Daku, Clarin, Philippines.

Angelina sells snacks in the community to earn a living and has had this business for seven years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, butter, etc.

Angelina has been a member of PMPC for four months. In the future, Angelina hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, butter, etc.

location.town: Tudela-Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is married with one child. Divina is twenty-six years old and live in Balamban, Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur. Divina sells dry goods in a small department store is called a sari-sari store to earn a living and has had this business for three months. Each month she earns Php 15,000 per month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan for fifty thousand pesos only to allow her to buy additional capital for her sari-sari store such as eggs, soft drinks, oil, soap, sugar, bread, etc.

Divina has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Divina hopes to have more projects to gain more profit and to improve her sari-sari store.

loans.use: to buy groceries for the store.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion has been a member of PMPC for a year. Being divorced with five children, she earns a living through farming and has raised pigs for eight years. She is 68 years old and lives in San Vicente, Sinacaban, Philippines.

She has requested a loan to purchase additional feed and other animal supplies. In the future, Concepcion hopes to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and other animal supplies

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is married with one child. Andresa is 50 years old and lives in Señor, Sinacaban, Philippines.
Andresa is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for seven years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional feed and other animal supplies.

Andresa has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Andresa hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and other animal supplies

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma lives in Balamban Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur, is married, and has three children. Norma has a small food house where she sells banana cake, fruit salad, puto cheese, cake, halo-halo, etc. Her husband is a farmer and she has had a business for two years. She earn one thousand PHP per week. 

She requested a loan to buy raw materials and additional ingredients for her business.

Norma has been a member for two years in the Paglaum Molave Branch. In the future, Norma wants to earn more for the future of her children and the entire family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and raw materials for their snack business

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
La señora Lilian es una persona luchadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a sus padres quienes la apoyan en su negocio. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración  tortillas desde hace 3 años, las cuales entrega a sus clientes ubicados en los  puestos del mercado de  la ciudad.  
Doña Lilian necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y cal producto que necesita para la elaboración de sus tortillas. Espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucha ayuda ya que gracias a el contara con los insumos necesarios para seguir elaborando su producto.
Doña Lilian también desea que  sus ventas aumenten y gracias a esto mejorar un poco su estilo de vida y el de su familia con el aumento de los ingresos. 
Doña Lilian espera que su negocio crezca para de esta forma seguir apoyando a sus padres y que su familia pueda seguir gozando de una buena vida.




Choluteca, Honduras – Julio 2013
texts.en:
Doña Lilian is a tenacious and responsible person who lives in a community in southern Honduras with her parents. Lilian has for three years prepared tortillas that she sells to her customers in stalls in the city market. Her parents help support the business. 
 
Doña Lilian is applying for a loan to purchase supplies she needs for making tortillas: corn, wood, and lime. She hopes the loan will be of great benefit as it will provide her with the supplies she requires to keep preparing tortillas. 

Doña Lilian also hopes to increase her sales, which would improve her quality of life and her family's

Doña Lilian hopes her business will grow so she can continue to support her parents and her family can keep enjoying a good life.  

Choluteca, Honduras – July 2013

loans.use: to purchase corn, wood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en: Sreytouch, a mother of two schoolchildren, is a resident from the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham Province. She tackles her family hardships via cassava and rice cropping with her husband. Besides this agribusiness, the couple also works for others for a fee for extra income. She has been rice farming for 12 years and cassava farming for one year, and she is able to earn up to 21,000 KHR per day. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Sreytouch is a first cycle client. She is seeking a new loan of 3,500,000 kHR in order to support her cash crop farming and to renovate her kitchen. She hopes to get  a good yield and double her income.

loans.use: to support her cash crop farming and to renovate her kitchen

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
This is Elvie, 38, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Leo, a fruit vendor, and they have six children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Elvie operates a piggery. She earns money by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market.  Aside from this, she also cooks breakfast meals for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 6,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy feed and additional hogs. 

Elvie dreams that her business will expand and hopes that her six children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and additional hogs

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Elisabeth is a 35-year-old woman who is married to Martinus, 36 years old. They have three children: Roger, 10 years old; Icho, 8 years old, both are elementary school students; and the last one is Chali, 3 years old. 

Elisabeth supports her husband to generate additional income by working at a drug store. Two years ago, she initiated a kiosk business, but then failed due to her high working hours and there was no assistant to handle the business. Recently, Elisabeth had difficulty in providing money to cover the educational cost of the children in the new school year. To help her solve the problem, she went to TLM and proposed an individual loan amounting to IDR 4,500,000. This loan would help her to pay for the registration fees of Roger and Icho and she will save the other half for their future needs.

loans.use: to pay for the registration fees of Roger and Icho and to save the other half for their future needs.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en: Celsa is 70 years old and lives in Doña Consuelo, Ozamiz City. She has been with her family for many years. Celsa has a piggery. She has a new business and now she is requesting a loan to buy pigs. Celsa has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future Celsa hopes to improve her living conditions to sustain the financial status of their needs and to also improve her piggery

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is married with two children who are in school. Gemma is 31 years old and lives in Cantabon, Siquijor, Siquijor.

Gemma is engaged in a charcoal making activity to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to be used to purchase additional charcoal and charcoal making supplies. 

Gemma is a new member of PMPC and shows a good credit record. In the future, Gemma hopes to expand and improve her business with this institution.

loans.use: To buy and make charcoal

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es: Don Jaime, tiene 36 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio del Negrito, Yoro. El siempre se ha dedicado  a la agricultura y ganadería. Hace un año que don Jaime  estableció su propio  negocio de venta de repuestos para reparar motocicletas y mototaxis. En su negocio ofrece repuestos como llantas, empaques, anillos, pistones, pastillas, culatas, cilindros y otros. El préstamo que ha solicitado  es por 25,000 lempiras, con el cual va surtir de repuestos para mototaxis, como llantas, cilindros, pastillas, tornillos, frenos, cables, y otros. Tiene como meta hacer que su negocio genere ingresos para mejorar su nivel económico.
texts.en:
Jaime is 36 years old, single and has three children. He lives in the municipality of Negrito, Yoro. He has always worked in farming and with livestock. One year ago Jaime set up his own business selling spare parts to repair motorcycles and mototaxis. His business stocks spare parts including tyres, seals, rings, pistons, brake pads, cylinder heads, cylinders, and other parts. 

He is applying for a loan of 25,000 lempiras which he will use to restock spare parts for mototaxis such as tyres, cylinders, brake pads, bolts, brakes, cables, and other parts. His goal is to generate an income from his business to improve his finances.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for mototaxis such as tyres, clutches, cables, pistons, seals, rings, etc. which he can resell

loans.name: Nora Lee

texts.en:
Nora Lee, a 29-year-old single mother of three school-aged children, lives in Cantabon, Siquijor, Siquijor. She has been engaged in food vending to earn a living for five years, earning PHP 2,000.00 each month.

A member of PMPC for one year with a good credit record, Nora Lee has requested a loan for PHP 3,000.00 to purchase additional fertilizers, vegetables and fruits such as potatoes, carrots, etc. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business with this institution.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables, fruits and fertilizers

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a 39-year-old, married woman. She has four children: Cicilia, 16, a high school student; Johanes, 12, a middle school student; Maria, 10, an elementary school student; and the last one is Angelino, 3.

Magdalena works as a part-time teacher at an elementary school. At the moment, she is taking her bachelor's degree at a university. To support her educational fees and the family needs of her household, she also initiated a kiosk business. In several months, Magdalena will finish her degree, and she needs money to pay for the registration fees. This situation led her to go to TLM and ask for an individual loan of 12,500,000 Indonesian rupiahs. The loan assistance provided will enable her to get her bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to pay the registration fees to get her bachelor's degree.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
This is Fe. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the feed that she needed and additional hogs for her business. Her income from her business helped her in sending her children to school and in providing for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional hogs and feed needed for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Fe dreams of having more piglets in her piggery and hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. At these meetings, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies of feed and hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is a 32-year-old woman who lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her husband, two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a painter by profession. He owns a small shop in the market which is the only source of income for his family. 

He needs to purchase paint brushes and a variety of paints in various colours so that he can continue his work. For that his wife Nazia, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase the needed things for his shop. 

As they have no other source of income, with the help of loan amount, her husband will be able to continue his business, and with the net profit he will open a new shop for his son. Nazia is feeling satisfied after getting the loan.

She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase paint brushes and a variety of paints in various colours.

loans.name: Marselina

texts.en:
Marselina is 56 and a widow. Her husband died a long time ago. They had eight children. Marselina lives with her two youngest, who are not yet married and still in school. Grace, 12, is a junior high student and Pascal, 7, an elementary student. The other six children live with their own families.

A farmer, Marselina works on her own land to grow paddy (rice), corn and vegetables. In the summer, her farm is difficult to manage due to a lack of water. The solution is to build wells and pump the water by machine. 

Marselina is applying for a loan of 10,000,000 Indonesian rupiah from Tanaoba Lais Manekat. The loan will help her build two wells on the farm and purchase a water pump. When the wells are built, Marselina hopes that the paddy field will produce in any season.

loans.use: to purchase two wells and a water pump

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is a 33-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four daughters. She has made handmade embroidery at her home for six years. One daughter also helps her to complete her tasks. Her husband is doing a job in a firm. He is an irresponsible person and does not care about his children. She has to prove herself a responsible and brave mother. During the six years she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, Samina requested a loan of 30,000 PKR from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, to purchase thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors. She is representing herself as the group leader and is taking the responsibility for her group members.

She does not want to lose heart and wants to afford all household expenses with courage. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Samina is raising her hand in the given picture.

loans.use: To buy thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors

loans.name: Yadira Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Yadira es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en es una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tamales y tortillas desde hace 5 años.
Doña Yadira sale a vender los viernes en su comunidad y en los barrios cercanos a la misma.  Ella está pidiendo el préstamo para la compra de más materia prima como ser: hojas para tamal, manteca, arroz, frijoles, gallinas, papas, maíz, entre otras cosas que necesita para la elaboración de su producto.
Doña Yadira espera que el préstamo la ayude mucho ya que no cuenta con los insumos necesarios para seguir elaborando su producto, además desea que sus un ventas aumenten y con esto ganar más ingresos que beneficien su estilo de vida y el de su familia.
Doña Yadira espera poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Julio 2013
texts.en:
Yadira is a very hardworking and responsible woman. She lives in a community in southern Honduras with her husband and their 3 children. For 5 years, her business has been selling and making tamales and tortillas. Yadira makes her sales on Fridays in her community and the surrounding neighborhoods. 

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of more basic ingredients such as: tamale wrappers, lard, rice, beans, chicken, potatoes, and corn, among other things that she needs to prepare her products.

Yadira hopes that the loan will help her a lot, as she doesn’t have the necessary supplies to continue making her products. In addition, she hopes that her sales will increase, and with this, she will earn more income that will improve her lifestyle and that of her family.

Yadira hopes to be able to continue supporting her children in their schooling so that they can have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – July 2013

loans.use: to purchase tamale wrappers, lard, rice, beans, chicken, potatoes, and corn for her business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is married and runs a kiosk to help generate income for her family. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200.

Aida is taking a loan of $600 (US) to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy stock for her store, such as eggs, noodles, salt, sugar, coffee, books, slippers, cigarettes and biscuits. 

A hardworking woman, Aida hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy eggs, noodles, salt, sugar, coffee, books and other products to sell in her store

loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en: Ran, 40, is a married mother residing in Thbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. For her, a two-and-a-half-hectare area of rice cropping is her primary source of income. Ran has been involved in her business for ages, earning about 26,000 KHR per day. Ran is a fourth-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) who has repaid her past three cycles of loans completely. These past loans have improved her lifestyle better than before. Now, she is in a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She highly believes that she can produce a good yield and make more income to keep improving her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ray's Group

texts.en: A young mother of one little kid residing in Kampong Cham province, Ray is 24 years old and a farmer who grows rice on one hectare of rice farming land. She has been involved in her current business for five years. Ray is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she has formed a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash and to pay the plowing fee. She hopes to earn more income from her business to relieve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy potash and to pay the plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov is 41 years old and married. She is a resident from Sa Ang district of Kandal province where her agribusiness is run. She has five children; three kids are students and the other two are working at a factory. She has been involved in her current business for ages. This is not the first loan for Pov with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has fully repaid, has enabled her to improve her lifestyle better than before. For this cycle, she is seeking a new loan to pay for vocational training for her son as a sewing machine repairer. She hopes her son can have a specific skill to make a living.

loans.use: To pay for vocational training for her son

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is applying for a loan of $1,000 (US) to improve her business. She runs her business in her house, selling noodles, salt, coffee, sugar, milk, soap, hard drinks (beer ) and soft drinks (Fanta, Coca Cola and Sprite). She opened her kiosk a year ago with her working capital of $250.

She lives in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy, and she sells every day. She makes a good income from her business and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. 

Maria is happy about this loan because it’s intended to help poor people improve their living conditions and then their futures.

loans.use: To buy noodles, salt, coffee, sugar, milk, soap, hard drinks (beer) and soft drinks

loans.name: Helen Grace

texts.en:
As the parent of two children, Helen Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling grains of rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Helen Grace is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional grains of rice to sell for her business buying and selling grains of rice.

Helen Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grains of rice to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like coffee, milk, sugar, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Vilma has been in this business for seven years. Vilma earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and her business buying and selling charcoal.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like coffee, milk, sugar, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es: Edwin a sus 26 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Debido a la falta de oportunidades laborales, decidió iniciar su propio negocio y conseguir los recursos por cuenta propia. Montó una pizzería desde hace 2 años, aprovechando la oportunidad de no contar con competencia cercana en el sector, logrando excelentes resultados que hoy en día se ven reflejados en el montaje de otras 2 pizzerías ubicadas en diferentes municipios de Antioquia. El titular es un hombre organizado, emprendedor, juicioso y muy activo, siempre está buscando oportunidades que le permitan avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de sus metas, por esta razón solicita el crédito que desea invertir en la realización de mejoras locativas (cambiar el piso de cemento, por cerámica) y comprar  activo fijo (nevera) para uno de sus locales, con lo que podrá darle una mejor imagen a su negocio y mejorar la percepción de los clientes, y así podrá atraer a nuevos comensales y aumentar sus ventas e ingresos. Edwin, sueña con hacer crecer su negocio hasta convertirlo en una cadena de pizzerías, que sea rentable y perdurable en el tiempo, con esto podrá tener una estabilidad económica y garantizar un mejor futuro para su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin, 26 years old, is single and doesn't have children. Due to a lack of work opportunities, he decided to start his own business and find resources on his own. He put together the pizzeria two years ago, taking advantage of the opportunity of not having nearby competition, achieving excellent results that are now reflected in the opening of two other pizzerias, which are located in other municipalities of Antioquia. Edwin is an organized, enterprising, sensible, and active man. He is always looking for opportunities to move toward completing his goals. 

For this reason, he is requesting a loan, which he wants to invest in improving his locations (change the cement floor to ceramic) and buy fixed assets (refrigerator) for one of his locations. This will give his business a better image and improve his customers' perceptions. This will allow him to attract new guests and increase sales and income. Edwin dreams growing his business into a pizzeria chain, which would be profitable and long-lasting. With this, he hopes to have economic stability to guarantee a better future for his family.

loans.use: to complete renovations (change the cement floor to ceramic) and buy fixed assets (refrigerator)

loans.name: Jenni Roxana

texts.es:
Jenni es una mujer muy feliz muy contenta porque con el primer financiamiento brindado por la cooperativa COMIXMUL ella pudo comprar 3 litros de foliar balforan, 4 litros de insecticida, 3 bolsas de abono 12-24-12 y 3 bolsas de urea con los cuales pudo darles el mantenimiento a sus cultivos de maíz, frijol y arroz. Ella logro proteger sus cosechas y sacar una buena producción la cual ayudo a que ella pudiese pagar por el alquiler de la tierra en la que siembra y salir con el compromiso con la cooperativa COMIXMUL para poder seguir trabajando en el proceso de sus siembras.

Ella es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que cada día se esmera y se esfuerza más y más por salir adelante en compañía de su familia y sacar adelante a su hijo por lo tanto ella solicita un segundo financiamiento para poder comprar más insumos agrícolas con los cuales pretende abarcar una mayor parte de sus cultivos los cuales son nuevos y dar mantenimiento a los existentes protegiéndolos y abonarlos desde la tierra en la que está sembrada hasta el grano al final de la cosecha. De esa forma ella podrá generar mayores ingresos y seguir cultivando más cada vez que tenga la oportunidad de aprovechar el capital que le queda libre para la compra de granos más la limpieza y preparación de la tierra.
texts.en:
Jenni is very happy because she was able to use the first loan she received from COMIXMUL to buy 3 liters of plant food, 4 liters of insecticide, 3 bags of 12-24-12 fertilizer, and 3 bags of urea to take care of her crops of corn, beans, and rice. She was able to protect her harvests and produced a good yield, which helped her pay the rent on her farmland and fulfill her commitment to COMIXMUL so she can keep working on cultivating her crops.

She is a hardworking woman with a lot of initiative, and she every day she pushes to offer her family a better life and help her son get ahead. She is requesting a second loan to buy more agricultural supplies to plant new crops and take care of the ones she has, protecting and fertilizing everything from the soil in which she sows to the grain at the end of each harvest. That way she will be able to increase her income and keep growing more whenever she has the chance to take advantage of the money available to buy seed and to clean and prepare the soil.

loans.use: para la compra de insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos de maíz, frijol y arroz

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her business buying and selling fish.

Letecia has been in this business for 28 years. She earns more income from a general store.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a hardworking 33-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her husband, son and daughter. Both of her children are studying in school.  Her husband delivers grinding services which is the only source of income for their family. His monthly net income is insufficient to meet the family's needs. Presently, he needs additional capital to buy a grinding machine for his work.

For that purpose, his wife Asia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. As their family expenditures are too much higher than their monthly income and savings, she wants her husband to grow his business with the profit amount. As a result, they could increase their monthly income as well as savings. Her dreams are for the higher education of her children. She is very thankful to Kiva for such a great help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy a grinding machine

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 38-year-old hardworking woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her husband, two sons and three daughters. All of her children are studying in school. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the main market which is the only source of income for their family. His monthly net income is insufficient to meet the family needs. Presently, he needs additional capital to purchase a variety of embroidery material for the shop, including thread, embroidered lace, needles and colourful buttons. 

For that his wife Shakeela has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. She dreams of higher education for her children. And she is very much thankful to Kiva for such great help and kindness.

loans.use: To purchase thread, embroidered lace, needles and colourful buttons.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
This is Marieta. She previously accessed a loan of PHP 50,000 that she used to buy additional supplies and products such as charcoal, cigarettes, candies and bananas needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan of PHP 30,000 PHP to buy additional stock, such as charcoal, cigarettes, candies and bananas, which are again needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marieta hopes that she will be successful in her business and dreams to have a peaceful and happy life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock, such as charcoal, cigarettes, candies and bananas needed in her business.

loans.name: Imaculada

texts.en:
Imaculada is applying for a loan of $1.000 to improve her business. 

She is married and has two children. She is running a business in her house, selling noodles, coffee, sugar, books, pans, breads and water. She is making a good income, and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. 

Imaculada lives in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy her products, and she is selling every day. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her working capital of $600.

loans.use: to buy noodles, coffee, sugar, books, pans, breads and water to re-sell.

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya is a hardworking 35-years-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her husband, two sons and daughter. All of her children are studying in school. Her husband owns a butcher shop in the main market which is the only source of income for their family. His monthly net income is insufficient to meet the family's needs. Presently, he needs additional capital to purchase a cow to get meat. 

For that purpose, his wife Asiya has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. As their family expenditures are too much  compared to their monthly income and savings, she wants to open a new shop for her husband with the profit amount. As a result, of which they could increase their monthly income as well as savings. Her dreams are for the higher education of her children. She is very thankful to Kiva for such a great help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to get meat for selling purposes.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Alona works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Alona is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase wood, bamboo and paint for the repair of her fishing boat.

Alona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that her children can finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase wood, bamboo and paints for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Kael Fatu Group

texts.en:
Emerenciana is one the members from Kael Fatu Group. The word "Kael fatu" means "hope" in one of the local languages. 
 
She is taking the loan to add to her working capital, in order to buy some additional supplies such as coffee, sugar, books, pans, breads and oils. Emerenciana is a hard working woman. She started her business in 2009 with her own working capital of $70.00. She is happy with the loan she has been offered to help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, books, pans, breads and oils for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cellphones, batteries, chargers, cases and hats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more animals and later sell them at a better price. Another part will be used to buy corn seeds, fertilizer, pesticide, and herbicide to plant corn.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 53-year-old, married woman, and lives in the town of Lahore, Pakistan. She has a husband, four daughters and six sons. 

One of her daughters is involved in a tailoring business in which she provides services of stitching clothes to her customers. She is an expert in her profession and people like her stitched clothes a lot. Due to a large amount of work, she is unable to complete her tasks alone, so she teaches the techniques of tailoring to her younger sister; now she has become an expert and can easily sew clothes, however she does not have a spare machine for her sister.

Shamim requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she could buy a sewing machine for her younger daughter.

Shamim has a huge family and each member participates earning money according to their skills and power. She hopes that her daughter will work efficiently which will help increase their income and savings as well. Shamim is very happy after taking this loan and is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine for her daughter for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Erika Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra. Erika tiene 24 años, tiene un hijo que tiene la edad de 2, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano,  en su puesto de venta que se encuentran ubicado en la zona de  San Basilio  de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la  Sra. Erika va a usar este préstamo para la compra de fardos de ropa de segunda mano para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la  Sra. Erika enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay muchas personas que se dedican a esta actividad por la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su puesto de venta, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la  Sra. Erika es una persona trabajadora, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Erika is 24 years old. She has a 2 year old son. She sells second hand clothing in her spot located in the San Basilio area in the city of Santa Cruz. THis loan is her first cycle with the institution. Erika is going to use this loan to buy bundles of second hand clothing for her business. Her reason for asking for this loan is a lack of capital. Erika faces challenges in her business, such as competition, since a lot of people work in this activity in the area. She is going to use the profits to keep improving in her sales spot. She wants for her business to have merchandise stocked to offer a variety of products to her customers. Erika i  a hardworking person. She is happy and grateful to the institution for the support it has offered, since this is the only activity that allows her to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise by the bundle to stock her business.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha, a young mother of four children, is 28 years old.  She resides in Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. To struggle for a living, she does rice cropping on seven hectares area of farmland. After 10 years of being engaged in her current business, she is able to earn up to 25,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Chantha with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In her group of two, she is the leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy gasoline for her hand-tractor, and to buy potash and rice seed for her crops. She hopes to gain a good yield and make a good income.

loans.use: To buy gasoline for her hand-tractor, potash, and rice seed for her crops

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sokhoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhoeurn is 33 years old and a mother of two little children. She lives in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, where cassava is one famous crop among her neighbors as a main source of income. For five years she has engaged in her current business, and she is able to earn up to 18,000 KHR per day. 

Sokhoeurn is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She now leads a group of two in applying for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion on fertilizer, seeds and seedlings, and to pay for plowing fees for her farm. She hopes this purchase will help her to grow her crops in a timely manner and with a good yield in return.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and seedlings, and to pay for plowing fees for her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 26 years, and also earns income from raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Nena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 52 years old, and is married with six children, one of whom is in school.

Charito works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling Avon products in the Philippines. She has been running her business selling Avon products for ten years, and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional Avon products to sell. Prior to this loan, Charito has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF. 

Charito aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 30 years old and has five children, four of whom go to school. 

Alice looks after livestock for a living. She raises both goats and cattle. She started this business in 2009 with the intention of getting school fees for her children. She would like to earn enough money for constructing a house. Her dream is also to get more land for her animals to graze on.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
This is Marites. She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories, and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the education of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marites hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams to have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish making and selling business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years, and earns additional income from raising pigs.  

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to process for her business.

Eleanor has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough so she can send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to process.

loans.name: Ilia

texts.en:
Ilia is a 56-year-old farmer from the village of Koktauri. He lives with his wife and three children who go to the local school. Ilia has been involved in the agricultural business from early childhood, as his parents were farmers and this is a traditional activity for the family.
 
He works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing a variety of fruit and vegetables. In addition, he runs a small dairy farm, milking a cow and producing cheese, which is sold locally. In addition to his agricultural activities, Ilia works as a senior mechanic on marine ships and gets a small monthly salary (approximately 150 USD). 

As the family's income is not enough for food and everyday expenses, Ilia decided to start a business breeding fish, for which we sought credit from local financial institutions, however his attempts was unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1000 GEL for purchasing young fish. 

Ilia will grow the fish in a dam, which he created in his yard, and after a couple of months he will start selling fish. The new business initiative will give Ilia chance to have financial stability and monthly income. Part of the profits will be reinvested in the same business and the other part will be used for his family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase young fish and start a fish farm.

loans.name: Leyla Marina

texts.es: Leyla, a sus 45 años de edad es madre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Su vida productiva la ha dedicado a trabajar como vendedora en diferentes almacenes, donde adquirió experiencia y conocimientos en el área comercial; gracias a esto, inició su propio negocio vendiendo mercancía y productos por catálogo, con lo cual ha generado ingresos para apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia. La prestataria es una mujer organizada, emprendedora, activa y pujante, dedicada a su familia por quien lucha incansablemente. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (cremas corporales, vitaminas, suplementos dietarios, y productos naturales, entre otros) con el fin de aprovechar los descuentos y poder incrementar su margen de ganancia al momento de la venta, esto le ayudará para avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal meta que es convertirse en una gran empresaria, tener una estabilidad económica que le permita ofrecer una excelente educación a sus hijos y verlos realizados profesionalmente, además de mejorar la calidad de vida en su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Leyla, is 45 years old and the mother of two children. She lives in a common-law relationship. During her working life she has been a salesperson in different stores where she acquired experience and knowledge in business. Thanks to this she started her own business selling merchandise and products from catalogs. She has made money to help support her family by doing this. This borrower is very organized, entrepreneurial, active and strong, dedicated to her family whom she constantly fights for. 

Leyla is requesting this loan in order to buy merchandise wholesale (body creams, vitamins, dietary supplements and natural products, etc.), taking advantage of the discounts and increasing her margin of profit when selling. This will help her advance in achieving her main goal, which is to become a big businesswoman and have economic stability. This would allow her to offer an excellent education to her children and raise the living standard of her nuclear family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (body creams, vitamins, dietary supplements and natural products, etc.)

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Svay is 60 years old and a farmer from Baray district. To generate income, she is dedicated to a farming business and also raises ducks for meat and eggs. She is an industrious woman who has tried hard to meet the needs for her family members. She has been engaged in agricultural activities for almost 30 years.

She is asking for a loan to buy ducks to raise for meat and eggs, which she can sell. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her business, and thereby increase her income. In the future, she hopes to make her business a success and become a viable source of income.

loans.use: buy ducks to raise for meat and eggs, which she can sell.

loans.name: Jerilyn

texts.en:
Jerilyn is 45 years old and is married with ten children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods,  spices, milk, coffee and noodles etc. Jerilyn works hard to provide for her family. 

Prior to this loan, Jerilyn has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from loading pre-paid mobiles and raising pigs.

Jerilyn aspires to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, spices, milk, coffee and noodles.

loans.name: Janita

texts.en:
Janita is 39 years old and is married with eight children. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for ten years, and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal. 

Janita has requested a loan of PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, such as coffee, bread, canned goods, soap and shampoo. Janita has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She works hard to provide for her family, and aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, such as coffee, bread, canned goods, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 45-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son owns an enterprise of stitching and selling embroidery by machine in his nearby town. He has had this business since 2005. He has been recruiting workers for embroidery work on daily wages; he also brings some material to home for his sister because his sister helps him with embroidery work. He is an expert in his profession, and he is especially famous for bridal dresses; people like him for his arts and appreciate his efforts.
 
Now, the marriage season is going to start, and there is a lot of demand for his art. He wants to cope with the demand for bridal dresses, which is why he wants to buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance.

Razia requires some capital to buy the desired items for her son but she does not have a sufficient amount. So she humbly requested a loan of 35,000 PKR from BRAC Pakistan. With this loan, her son will be able to buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

Razia is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors for her son's business.

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en:
Muhamed is 27 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in Iraq. Muhamed owns a small shop where he sells mobile phones and their accessories. He established his business in 2012 and has gained good experience in this field. Muhamed has hired one employee now. He is becoming well-known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation, since he not only sells mobile phones but also provides maintenance services for his customers.

Muhamed is requesting a loan of $2,100 US. He will use this loan to purchase mobile devices and accessories and renovate his workplace. Muhamed aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide a better life for his family.

The story of Muhamed and his business is just one of many examples of IED’s clients who have been able to improve their businesses with a small business loan product specifically designed to meet the needs of small businesses, where relatively small capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to purchase mobile devices and accessories and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Qaisra

texts.en:
Qaisra, a 38-year-old woman, lives in Lahore, Pakistan, with her husband, two sons and a daughter. Her husband is a painter by profession. He owns a small shop in the market, which is the only source of income for his family. He needs to purchase a paint shower machine, so that he can continue his work. For that, his wife, Qaisra, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband.

Qaisra wants to purchase a refrigerator for personal use with the help of the profit. Qaisra is feeling satisfied after getting this loan. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a paint shower machine.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una joven emprendedora, luchadoras con 23 años de edad la cual es agricultora y madre de 2 hijos los cuales estudia en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación. En compañía de su esposo trabajan diariamente en la siembra, limpieza, recolección, abono y riego de hortalizas tales como repoyo, brócoli, tomate, Chile dulce, etc. ya que desde hace algún tiempo por disposición propia decidió aprender a trabajar la tierra. Su producto es comercializado y vendido por las bodegas de la localidad, intermediarios y principalmente en el mercado de la zona.

Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual dará mantenimiento a sus cultivos de hortaliza por medio de la compra de fertilizantes, abono, insecticida, entre otros productos que mantienen sanos sus cultivos de plagas en general.

Su sueño es poder construir su casa algún día creyendo en DIOS  que así será ya que la economía del país no está en sus mejores condiciones y los materiales para construir no son baratos. Como madre su anhelo es poder dar a sus hijos una educación de calidad, satisfactoria para que ellos logren sobre salir el día de mañana que disidan formar sus hogares, tener un empleo, manejar sus propios negocios con humildad.
texts.en:
Francisca is a young, striving entrepreneur who is 23 years old. She works in agriculture and is the mother of two children, who are in primary school, in different grades. Along with her husband, she works every day in the planting, cleaning, harvesting, fertilizing, and irrigation of vegetables such as cabbage, broccoli, tomatoes, sweet chiles, etc., since some time ago, on her own initiative, she decided to learn to work the land. Her products are commercialized and sold in the local shops, through intermediaries, and principally in the market of her zone.

She has applied to the COMIXMUL cooperative for a loan with which she will maintain her vegetable plantings through the purchase of fertilizers, compost, and insecticides, among other products that will keep her plantings free of pests in general.  

Her dream is to be able to construct her house someday, believing in God that it will be, since the economy of the country is not in the best condition, and construction materials are not cheap. As a mother, her desire is to be able to give her children a quality education so that they can excel in the future, decide to form their own households, have jobs, and manage their own dealings with humility.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her vegetable crops

loans.name: Ofelia Del Socorro

texts.es: Ofelia, a sus 64 años de edad, se dedica a la fabricación y venta de arepas de maíz, actividad que realiza desde hace aproximadamente 12 años y que inició gracias a créditos anteriores, con esto ha logrado apoyar al sostenimiento de su hogar. “Mi edad no me impide que trabaje, pues me gusta sentirme útil y todavía puedo hacer muchas cosas, me gusta que la gente compre mis productos diariamente y eso me anima para seguir luchando”; con estas palabras Ofelia expresa su motivación para seguir siempre adelante, por esta razón solicita otro crédito, para invertirlo  en la compra de materia prima al por mayor (maíz) con lo que podrá tener disponibilidad de producto para cumplir con la producción diaria y entregar los pedidos a tiempo, así podrá incrementar sus ventas y fidelizar los clientes actuales, además tendrá la oportunidad de  generar más ingresos para llegar a cumplir el sueño de montar otro negocio de comidas, que le permita seguir aportando a la economía de su hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ofelia is 64 years old. She makes and sell arepas (a traditional Colombian street food) from corn. She started doing this about twelve years ago, thanks to some previous loans. She manages to help pay the household expenses with her efforts. "My age does not stop me from working and this makes me feel useful. I can still do a lot of things. I like that people buy from me daily and this motivates me to continue struggling". With these words Ofelia explains her reason to always move ahead.
