For this reason she is requesting another loan in order to buy raw material wholesale. Thus she can have product on hand to make her daily production and deliver her orders on time. Also she can increase her sales, build her customer loyalty and have the opportunity to make more money. Her dream is to start another food business which would continue to support her household and raise the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy raw material wholesale (corn).

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: El Sr. Gabriel tiene 44 años y es casado con 5 hijos que son de las edades de  18, 15, 10, 8  y 1 años, el se dedica a la producción y venta de ladrillos, el vive en la localidad de Quebrada de Horno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Gabriel va a utilizar este préstamo para compra de material  para la fabricación de ladrillos como Arcilla, ya que este material el lo compra por mayor, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es pedido de ladrillos que tiene que entregar y que por falta de materiales  no lo puede realizar, El Sr. Gabriel  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que por la zona existe varias ladrilleras, por ser una zona de fábricas de ladrillos, El Sr. Gabriel va a utilizar los beneficios en la fabricación de ladrillos por mayor, El Sr. Gabriel se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señor Gabriel is 44 years old and is married, with five children ages 18, 15, 10, 8, and 1. He works in the production and sale of bricks. He lives in the area of Quebrada de Horno. This loan is his first with this institution. Señor Gabriel is going to use this loan for the purchase of material such as clay for making bricks, since he buys this material wholesale. His reason for applying for this loan is an order for bricks that he needs to deliver and that he can't complete for lack of material. In his business Señor Gabriel faces challenges, namely, competition, since there are a number of brickmakers in this zone, because it is a zone of brick factories. Señor Gabriel is going to use the earnings to make bricks in bulk. Señor Gabriel feels pleased and grateful to this institution for the support offered to him.

loans.use: to buy clay to make bricks

loans.name: Mirco Efrain

texts.es: El Sr. Mirco tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero, actualmente trabaja en el rubro de transporte público como taxista, vive en una casa de su padre conjuntamente con sus hermanos, el Sr. Mirco de condición humilde solicita hoy el crédito con el fin de poder refaccionar el techo del ambiente que habita junto a su familia. Se pudo conocer además que el sr. Mirco es una persona trabajadora que desde muy pequeño supo trabajar para poder sobrellevar su situación económica que atravesaba, es así que tan solo curso hasta la primaria dejando de lado sus estudios, hoy pide un crédito para poder vivir mejor y darle a su familia mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Señor Mirco is 32 years old. He is single. He now works in public transportation as a taxi driver. He lives in a house of his father's, along with his brothers. Señor Mirco, who is of humble circumstances, is now applying for a loan with the goal of being able to redo the roof of the place that he lives in with his family. It is further known that Señor Mirco is a hard-working person who from a very early age knew how to work to be able to survive the economic situation that he was going through. This is why he attended only primary school, leaving his studies aside. Today he is requesting a loan to be able to live better and to give his family better conditions.

loans.use: to redo the roof of his home

loans.name: Warda

texts.en:
Warda is a married woman with three school-going children.  They live in their own house that has electricity but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.  For the past four years, Warda has operated a cosmetics shop.  She operates from the market where neighbors and passersby are potential customers.  She faces a major challenge that her customers take a long time to pay.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase cosmetics, such as jewelries, body lotion, combs, hair products, creams, etc.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, such as jewelries, body lotion, combs, hair products, cream, etc.

loans.name: Femie

texts.en:
Femie is a married parent of four children, three of whom are in school.  She works hard to support her family.

Femie has a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Femie is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy more items to sell, such as soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, and noodles.

Femie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy soap, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Christy Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Christy Ann works hard to support her family.  She has a motorcycle shop in the Philippines.  She also earns additional income from raising pigs and goats and from a general store.  Christy Ann is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her motorcycle shop.

Christy Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her shop.

loans.name: Wenifreda

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Wenifreda works hard to support her family.  She has a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from motorcycle transportation.  Wenifreda is borrowing 27,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as eggs, sugar, coffee, canned goods, and soap.

Wenifreda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving money to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items for her general store (i.e. eggs, sugar, coffee, canned goods, soap, etc.).

loans.name: Fernandita

texts.en:
Fernandita is 53 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school.  She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines.  Fernandita requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as soap, bread, milk, noodles, and canned goods.

Fernandita has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  She aspires to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, such as soap, bread, milk, noodles, and canned goods.

loans.name: José Manuel Orlando

texts.es:
Don José tiene 39 años de edad, vive con sus 3 hijos entre las edades de los 6 y 14 años, 2 le ayudan a trabajar en la milpa; ya que el otro esta pequeño, actualmente no estudian porque les queda demasiado lejos ir hasta la escuela y su compañera de vida que se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Es un hombre trabajador y dedicado totalmente a su familia se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 10 años trabajando al lado de su padre que fue quien le enseño a cultivar la tierra, aparte de cultivar la tierra  sabe trabajar de electricista y eso le ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos para darle una buena alimentación a su familia. Los insumos agrícolas los cotiza en varios agroservicios de la ciudad y los traslada en carro hasta la entrada del caserío y de allí le toca cargar por la montaña hasta su casa haciendo un tiempo aproximado de 30 minutos caminando. 


Al cliente se le estará apoyando para que pueda comprar sus insumos agrícolas para la siembre de frijol, con el préstamo expreso que comprara de 2 quintales de urea, 18 quintales de abono, para fertilizar el frijol, con esta técnica podrá darle un buen manejo al cultivo mejorando su producción y así poder tener más ingresos y también poder sacar sus granos básicos para darles una buena alimentación a sus hijos.  

En un futuro quiere construir una casa nueva, para que sus hijos tengan un lugar más sano donde divertirse y sus futuras generaciones tengan mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Don José is 39 years old. He lives with his life companion, who takes care of the domestic tasks, and their three children, who are between the ages of 6 and 14 years. Two of them help him work in the fields, since the other one is little. They are not in school now because it is too far for them to go to the school. 

He is a hard-working man who is completely dedicated to his family. He has worked in agriculture since he was 10 years old, working at the side of his father, who was the one who taught him to cultivate the land. Besides cultivating the land, he knows how to work as an electrician, and this helps him to improve his income to feed his family well. He obtains his agricultural supplies from various agricultural service centers in the city, and he transports them by car to the entrance of the village, and from there he has to carry them through the mountains to his house, a walk of approximately 30 minutes. 

The loan will help this borrower so that he can buy his agricultural supplies for planting beans. With the loan, he states that he will buy 200 lbs of urea and 1800 lbs of compost to fertilizer the beans. With this method, he will be able to give good management to the crop, improving his production and thus being able to have more income and also being able to take out his basic grains to feed his children well.

In the future he wants to build a new house, so that his children can have a healthier place to play and his future generations can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy 200 lbs of urea and 1800 lbs of compost to fertilize his planting of beans

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es un hombre soltero de 24  años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el Caserío Xolbé, El Tablón Sololá, Sololá.
El es un hombre agricultor que trabaja fuerte para mantener  a su familia. Se dedica a cultivar papa en el lugar donde vive. Este trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres hace muchos años,  el cual fue el primer trabajo de su vida. En esta labor obtiene ingresos aceptables que le ayudan a cubrir las diferentes necesidades de su familia.
El ahora tiene 10 años de  experiencia en esta área, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 7,000.00 para comprar semillas de papa y abono orgánico para su cultivo y de esta manera incrementar sus ganancias.
El comenta que su mayor sueño es incrementar sus ganancias para poder amueblar su vivienda y apoyar  a sus hermanos en sus estudios para que tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Antonio is a 24-year-old single man. He lives with his parents and siblings in Caserío Xolbé, El Tablón Sololá, Sololá.

He is a farmer who works hard to sustain his family. He works by farming potatoes where he lives. He learned this work from his parents many years ago, and it was his first job. He earns a decent living from this work, which helps him cover his family's needs.

Now, he has 10 years of experience in this area. He is requesting a loan of 7,000.00 Q to buy potato seeds and organic fertilizer for farming. This will help him increase earnings.

He mentions that his greatest dream is to furnish his home and help his siblings with their education so they have opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and organic fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Avanza Ayahuayco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AVANZA AYAHUAYCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rocio ella es conviviente y tiene 18 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras, la socia vende verduras como cebollas,tomates,zanahorias y zapallos, la socia vende en el mercado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia y atiene 3 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapallos, zanahorias, cebollas y tomates.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de pinturas, negocio de venta de jugos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de ropa.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Avanza Ayacucho" communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cuzco, which is part of Cuzco province and Cusco department.

Rocio is 18 years old, lives with her partner, and has one son. She works in her business selling vegetables, such as onions, tomatoes, carrots and squash. She sells at the market from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. She has been in this business for three years already and it is going very well. 

Through this small business she is raising her son. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell the vegetables. She is requesting the loan to buy squash, carrots, onions and tomatoes. 

The other members have businesses such as selling paint, selling juices, grocery store and selling clothing. She is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this means, and promises to make her installment payments on time.

loans.use: To buy squash, carrots, onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lorenzo works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  Lorenzo is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Lorenzo has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Emelinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a boarding house and poultry. Emelinda is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her buying and selling of charcoal business.

Emelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with three children, all of whom still attend school and are still under her care. They live at their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children.

Gloria owns a rental house that is unfinished, and she has been in this business for over two years. Her greatest challenge is the mode of payment of her tenants, who sometimes take too long to pay. 

With the loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase building materials such as cement, iron sheets and sand for her unfinished rental house. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as cement, iron sheets and sand for her unfinished rental house.

loans.name: Ebonie

texts.en:
Ebonie is 23 years old and married with two children.

Ebonie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ebonie has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buying and selling of charcoal business for four years and also earns an income from farming/selling vegetables.

Ebonie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Tinatin

texts.en:
Tinatin is 44 years old, widowed and living in the village of Zeghduleti with her retired mother and two children (20 and 8 years old). Tinatin owns an apple garden and sells the fruit seasonally. Besides that, she produces hay for selling. Her young child gets monthly orphanage assistance from the local government (approximately $33 USD).

As their existing income is very small and is not enough to cover everyday expenses, Tinatin decided to re-start a clothing sales business, which was stopped due to financial problems. She requested a loan from the local credit providers, but they usually demand some stable income from the borrowers. Tinatin’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she didn’t satisfy their requirements. 

She received this credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the so-called Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With this loan of 2000 GEL (Georgia Lari) she will purchase clothing and household items at wholesale prices in Turkey and resell them in her community door-to-door. She plans to sell a wide assortment of well-priced clothing for men, women and children and bedclothes as well. It is obvious that the job is hard for Tinatin, but she is ready to deal with the vital difficulties and develop her business gradually. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to restart trading in clothing.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of peanuts and cashew business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables and raising pigs. Erlinda is borrowing 10,000  PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy peanuts and cashews to sell.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and cashews to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000  PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell.

Norma has been in this business for three years. Norma earns more income from a general store.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.en:
Fazilat is a 51-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Her elder daughter has been grown young and reached the age of marriage but she does not have the amount to collect for the dowry for her marriage. Her husband owns a clothing business. His practice is to buy fabrics from wholesalers and sell them to retailers. He has a lot of customers who like to buy fabrics from him; sometimes he purchases fabrics from out of the city at low cost and sells them to the retailers. He has a good reputation in the market and his current customers refer his fabrics to the other retailers, which becomes the cause of his advertisement. One of her sons also helps her husband in the clothing business; both are partially giving their time to the shop. 

Fazilat requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy more fabrics to fulfill the demand. She is in her seventh loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She has already been taking a loan from BRAC and investing in the business. Fazilat hopes that the savings will increase a lot and she will arrange the marriage ceremony for her daughter. 

Fazilat dreams of a bright future for her children, business establishment and for a better living standard for her family.

loans.use: To buy new fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business.

She is married and she has three children.

She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), hard drinks (beer), noodles, cigarettes, breads, eggs, coffee, sugar and slippers. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.  

She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), hard drinks (beer), noodles, cigarettes, breads, eggs, coffee, sugar and slippers.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a 49-year-old hardworking woman. She is living in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband and four children. All of her children are studying in school.  


Her husband is a milk and yogurt seller. For the past many years, he has been selling milk and yogurt in the main market. This is the only source of income for his family.

Razia, as a member of two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase milk for making yogurt and to resell both at a profitable price. The loan amount is very important for her husband to continue his business.

Her dream is for the higher education of her children. And she is very much thankful to Kiva for such a great help and kindness.

Note: Razia raises her hand in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase milk for making yougurt and for resale.

loans.name: Mayasa

texts.en:
Mayasa is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school and the other is underage. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

Mayasa has operated a beauty salon business for the past one year, operating at the market where passersby and town dwellers are her customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to add stock of cosmetics such as hair products, combs and hair oil in her beauty salon business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to add stock of cosmetics such as hair products, combs and hair oil in her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit with his mother and father lives in Kapan city. He has graduated from Yerevan State Polytechnic Institute's Faculty of Electrical and for many years since then he has worked in his specialty. He is not married, and he thinks that first of all, he must earn enough money and be able to provide both his parents and his family with good living conditions; only having all of this can he then get married. That is why Davit is seriously engaged in farming and agriculture. 

Of course, he is still too young to rule the entire farm alone and cleverly, and his best helpers are his parents. His father works at the school as a teacher of physical education, and his mother works in a mental hospital as a nurse. They both in their free time are greatly helping their son in land cultivation. They cultivate vegetables and fruits, such as tomatoes, cucumbers, beans, carrots and greens, apples, peaches, pears and plums. Farming they also do all together: they breed cows, piglets and chickens and manage beekeeping as well. All the farm products Davit’s mother manages to sell at Kapan food market. 

Davit has decided to become a prosperous farmer, and he needs a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to buy hay for cows and some frames and beehives for his beekeeping activities.

loans.use: to buy hay for cows and some frames and beehives for his beekeeping activities

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a 40-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Her husband owns a garment shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He stitches garments and sells the ready-made garments in his shop. 

Presently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of finances, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife, Shazia, as a member of a three-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase clothes to prepare ready-made dresses to sell. With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

Note: In the picture, Shazia is raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to prepare ready-made dresses to sell.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is a 38-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. Her husband is a welder and provides welding services in his community. Fouzia owns a small business selling ladies ready-made garments at home. She purchases cloth from the market at a low price, sews it and sells it at a high price in her community. The ladies of town like her garment collection and selection a lot and demand more variety because Eid festival is about to come. Her husband pays for all the expenses from his earnings and she contributes her earnings only for savings. She requested a loan so that she could buy more variety of cloth to fulfill the demand.

Fouzia wishes for the bright future of her children and her dream is to provide better education for her children.

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy cloth to stitch garments to sell.

loans.name: Gladys Severina

texts.es: La señora Gladys, es una persona de 18 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, cuenta con un dependiente económico a cargo el cual es su pequeño hijo, vive en su propio domicilio de tipo rustico construido con material local, su domicilio está ubicado en la comunidad de Tíraque; su actividad principal de la señora Gladys es la agricultura, en tal sentido produce los siguientes productos; papa, haba y avena; los cuales le generan sus ingresos, pero actualmente la señora Gladys se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de operación para poder comprar insumos agrícolas, de tal forma podrá incrementar la producción e ingresos económicos por lo tanto con la venta de los productos mejorara las condición de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladys is 18 years old, single, and completed her primary school education. She has a small child who is dependent on her. Gladys lives in her own home made of local rustic materials. Her house is located in the community of Tíraque. Gladys’ main business activity is farming and she produces the following income-generating crops: potatoes, beans, and oats.

She is currently in need of operating capital, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies. This would enable her to increase her production and her income. As a result of selling her products, Gladys will be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala nació en la Provincia de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en la provincia antes mencionada, ella tiene 27 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces sus actividades económicas es la agricultura y la ganadería por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar un torito para hacerlo engordar y hacerlo crecer para luego venderlo en alguna feria, ella agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

Ella pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en:
Pascuala was born in the province of Paucartambo and still lives there with her family. She is 27 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children. Pascuala is a hardworking and enterprising mother who is able to move her family forward through the effort of her work. Her business activities include farming and raising livestock, so she is taking this opportunity to request a loan for purchasing a young bull that she will fatten. Later on, she will sell the animal at a fair. She is grateful to those who have helped her fulfill her dream in this manner.

Pascuala values this loan and promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility. She is a member of the Communal Bank “San Martincito”, which is affiliated with Asociación Arariwa in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to purchase a young bull.

loans.name: Shierly

texts.en:
Shierly is very thankful for the loan lent to her. She used her loan as additional capital for her gardening business. She has been in this business for more than 10 years now, and her income from her business has been a great help with her family's everyday needs as well as in sending all of her four children to school. As of now, she and her husband are helping each other to support their family.

She would like to apply for a new 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and basket and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from his business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Shierly hopes that her business will continue to grow and flourish. She dreams to give her family a good future. As a CCT community partner, she attends the group's weekly fellowship* meetings, where she can draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials like wire and baskets, and supplies such as seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 31-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) for her husband’s fruit-selling business. Her husband owns a fruit-selling business in a nearby fruit market. Ramadan is going on, and in this month, the demand for fruits is increased. To fulfill the demand, he wants to buy more fruits such as mangoes, bananas, apples, etc. 

With the increase in the household expenses, she wants to grow the business also. She is the mother of five children. Her children are students, and none of them are able to get an income and are fully dependent upon their father. 

She wants to save the profit amount so that she could arrange the marriage of both her daughters in the future. Najma hopes that this loan will prove productive for her, and that she will save a reasonable amount soon.

Najma is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Rasoolan

texts.en: Rasoolan is a 36-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not worked properly because of which, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Rasoolan has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Rasoolan is so much thankful to kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing a rickshaw.

loans.name: Arut

texts.en:
Arut is 56 years old and lives in the capital city of Georgia with his family; his wife and daughter, who is a university entrant. The source of income for the family is the monthly salary earned by Arut’s wife, working as a teacher at the public school. Unfortunately, a teacher’s salary is not enough to make ends meet for a family of three. 

Arut purchased a car a month ago, but the family savings was not enough to pay the toll and change the fuel system. He plans to serve the locals as a taxi driver but he would have to charge higher prices for his service because the price of benzene is high. Not many citizens could afford to use the taxi service at a higher price. Because of the above mentioned problem, Arut will change his car's fuel system from benzene to gas, which is cheaper than benzene and will reduce the cost of transportation by 40 to 45 percent. It will allow Arut to offer cheap service to his customers. 

With this startup loan, he will pay the toll and a local auto service center to change the fuel system. Arut will start his taxi business and help the family in covering food and everyday expenses. The increased income will be used for the family's well being.

loans.use: to pay for the toll and fuel system change for his taxi

loans.name: Nuriya

texts.ru: Нурие 29 лет, замужем и имеет 3 детей школьного и дошкольного возраста. Нурия имеет высшее педагогическое образование, но к сожалению не работала по своей специальности. В поисках  источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2002 году Нурия начала свой бизнес в откорме скота и полеводстве, стартовав с 20,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день её хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 8,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве у Нурии имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 1 овца, 1 коза. Также имеет земельный надел размером 3,0 ГА, где в основном выращивают фасоль, картофель и многолетнюю траву. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нурия обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Нурия планирует использовать для увеличения поголовья скота и хочет построить дополнительный сарай для содержания скота.
texts.en:
Nuriya is 29 years old, married, and the mother of three school-aged and pre-school aged children.  Although she has a degree in education, she has unfortunately never worked in her field of specialty.

In order to provide a source of income for her family, Nuriya started her own farming and livestock fattening business in 2002, starting with an initial capital of 20,000 som (KGS).  Her business currently brings a monthly profit of 8,000 som (KGS) and she owns one dairy cow, one horse, one sheep and one goat.  She also owns three hectares (7.4 acres) of land on which she essentially grows beans, potatoes and perennial grass.

In order to further develop her activity, she has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS), which will be used for the purchase of sheep.

Nuriya plans to use the earnings from her loan to increase her livestock headcount and to build an additional barn to keep her farm animals.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
This is Alma. She previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education and with their personal, household and business expenditures. Aside from her farm, she also has a direct selling business for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy  fertilizer and farm inputs. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain her children's education and her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alma dreams of being more successful in life and business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 27-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Abida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Abida is so thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

loans.name: Nadi

texts.en: Nadi works as a scavenger. He came from Java to Bali with his parents. He is married and has a four-year-old child. Every day Nadi rides his motorcycle around the city to buy junk. He already has customers who sell junk to him. To improve his business, he requires additional capital. With a loan of 5M IDR, he hopes to buy more junk and earn more profit. He will sell the junk to the big buyers. He has many rivals, but with the additional capital he can pay his customers more quickly and make the customers satisfied. He has a dream of buying a house for his family. Now he still rents a house. He will save all the profit to make his dream come true.

loans.use: To purchase more junk

loans.name: Yrysbubu

texts.ru: Ырысбубу 54 года, замужем, многодетная мать имеет 5 детей (2 сына и 3 дочери). Образование среднее. Семья у Ырысбубу очень дружная и трудолюбивая. Более 20 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 8,000 сом KGS, благодаря ее терпению и трудолюбию на сегодняшний день она получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 6000 сом KGS. В хозяйстве имеет 4 дойные коровы, 2 нетели, 4 овцы, 1 лошадь и 14 коз. Супруг и дети помогают по бизнесу. В целях увеличения поголовья скота Ырысбубу обратилась в  микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 120 000 сом(KGS)  на покупку  коров для дальнейшего разведения. На доходы от кредита Ырысбубу планирует увеличить поголовье скота, а также мечтает построить дом для своих сыновей.
texts.en:
Yrysbubu is 54 years old, married, and the mother of a large family (she has five children: two sons and three daughters).  She has a high school education.  Her family is very united and hardworking.

Yrysbubu has been involved in animal husbandry and crop farming for more than twenty years, and she started in this business with 8,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her patience and hard work, she currently makes a monthly profit of  6,000 som (KGS) and owns four dairy cows, two heifers, four sheep, one horse and 14 goats.  Her husband and her children help her run her business.

In order to increase her livestock headcount, she has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of cows for further breeding. 

Yrysbubu plans to use the earnings from her loan to increase her livestock headcount.  She is also dreaming about building a house for her sons.

loans.use: to buy some cows.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik and his family live in the village of Shishkert in Syunik region. He is married and has three sons; the elder son is serving in the army and the two others are still school-aged. Andranik has higher education and he has a specialty as a biologist teacher, but now he is engaged in farming and agriculture. His wife works as a teacher in their local school and at the same time she greatly helps her husband in his occupation. On their farm they are raising two cows, four heifers, two calves, fifteen bee families and ten chickens. They also cultivate tomatoes, cucumbers, beans, greens and corn. The work is a lot and very hard, but together they do all the work and do not get tired.

Andranik is asking for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams since he needs to buy wax paper for beekeeping, fodder for chickens and diesel fuel to organize harvest gathering activities.

loans.use: to buy wax paper for beekeeping, fodder for chickens and diesel fuel to organize harvest gathering activities

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es: María Lucrecia, habitante del barrio Milagro de Dios, un lugar donde sus habitantes son de muy escasos recursos, es casada y su esposo labora junto a ella vendiendo productos lácteos, negocio con el que sobreviven  con la venta del día, sus hijos ya son  mayores de edad e independientes. Solicita el crédito para invertir en variedades de quesos, crema para comer, leche, cuajadas, para mantener sus ingresos y así poder cumplir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
María Lucrecia lives in the Milagro de Dios neighborhood, a place where the residents have very few resources. She is married and works with her husband by selling dairy products. They survive off of the daily sales from their business. Their children are already grown and independent.

María Lucrecia is requesting a loan in order to invest in a variety of cheeses, cream for consumption, milk, and curds so that she can maintain her earnings and cover the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy cheeses, milk, curds, and cream for consumption.

loans.name: Nchalika

texts.en:
Nchalika is married and has been blessed with five children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling coconuts and cassava to passersby and her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase more coconuts and cassava for resale in her business and also pay for transportation costs. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts and cassava for resale and to pay for transportation costs

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El señor Roberto, es una persona de 33 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, alcanzo estudiar hasta la primaria, vive con su conyugue y su pequeño hijo en su casa propia que se halla situado en la comunidad de Toko, la actividad principal a la que se dedica es la agricultura, el señor Roberto produce;  Papa 120 cargas, Haba (verde) 20 cargas, Arveja (verde) 50 cargas, trigo 35 arrobas, cebada 25 arrobas. La siembra de estos cultivos los realiza en sus terrenos propios y en los terrenos de sus padres que están ubicados en la misma localidad, los trabajos agrícolas los realiza con la colaboración  de sus vecinos, vive en una casa rustica de adobe, con este préstamo comprara abono de gallinaza y semilla de papa, esta inversión le permitirá mejorar sus condiciones económicos y por tanto también la calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Roberto is 33 years old, single, and completed his primary school education. He lives with his partner and their young child in a house that they own in the community of Toko. Roberto’s main business activity is farming. He produces 120 loads of potatoes, 20 loads of beans, 50 loads of green peas, 875 pounds of wheat, and 625 pounds of barley. Roberto grows these crops on his own land and also on his parents’ property, both of which are located in the same town. He completes the farm duties with the help of his neighbors. Roberto lives in a rustic house made of adobe.

With this loan, he will buy chicken manure and potato seeds. This investment will enable him to improve his financial condition and also the quality of life for his dependents.

loans.use: to buy chicken manure and potato seeds.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina nació en la Provincia de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en la provincia antes mencionada, ella tiene 38 años de edad y  es casada  y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la venta de accesorios eléctricos por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo focos, alambres, lámparas, enchufes, estabilizadores y otras cosas más, ella agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

Ella pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en:
Paulina was born in the province of Paucartambo and still lives there with her family. She is 38 years old, married, and has two children. Paulina is a hardworking and enterprising mother who is able to move her family forward through the effort of her work. She has a business of selling electrical accessories, so she is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy merchandise such as light bulbs, wires, lamps, plugs, stabilizers, and other items. She is grateful to those who have helped her fulfill her dream in this manner.

Paulina values this loan and promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility. She is a member of the Communal Bank “San Martincito”, which is affiliated with Asociación Arariwa in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy light bulbs, wires, lamps, plugs, stabilizers, and other items.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana de 46 años, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Juana se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años, siembra papas, arvejas y maíz, también cria ganado aunque al principio fue díficil ahora cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos , quienes están grandes, a la vez cuenta que le gusta ver siempre limpio sus terrenos por eso trabaja ardúamente en sus cultivos, además considera que su actividad es rentable por las satisfacciones y logros que le brinda, por lo que quiere seguir sembrando, además de ser la única actividad que conoce. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA, y se siente agradecida de recibir el apoyo financiero necesario para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Juana, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Juana is a 46-year-old single mother who lives in her own home with her three children. She has been farming for 20 years and grows potatoes, peas, and corn. Juana also raises cattle, which was difficult at first, but now she has the help of her children who are grown. She always likes seeing her land cleared so that she can work hard at her crops. Juana considers farming to be profitable and it gives her satisfaction and a sense of achievement, which is why she continues to plant crops. In addition, this is the only type of work that she knows.

This is her fourth Kiva loan and she is grateful to have the financial support that she needs to continue forward. Juana also promises to complete her loan payments in a punctual manner. She will invest 3,000 PEN in the purchase of organic fertilizer for nourishing her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: El señor Esteban es una persona humilde,  de escasos recursos económicos, la principal actividad económica del señor Esteban es la producción de papa,  en la región que cultiva no tuvo problemas climatológicos sin embargo este año ha sufrido un daño por  las intensas heladas presentados a principios del mes de junio, donde la producción de papa que se encontraba en desarrollo vegetativo a quedado totalmente seca sin opción a producir por lo menos  para recuperar la inversión, por las razones descritas don esteban ha recurrido a solicitar un préstamo que le servirá de gran ayuda mitigando los problemas económico que ocasiono el desastre natural en esta zona, el préstamo será utilizado exclusivamente para semilla de: papa, quinua y agroquímicos que garanticen una buena producción. Con los ingresos obtenidos mejorará la economía y retomará el camino de la prosperidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Esteban is a humble person who has limited financial resources. His main business activity is growing potatoes. The region where he farms has not had any weather-related problems, but this year there was a lot of damage that was suffered as a result of a heavy frost that hit during the first part of June. His crops were in the development stage, so they were totally dried out, which left him with no options to recover his investment. For these reasons, Don Esteban is requesting a loan which will be of great help in mitigating the financial problems that resulted from this local natural disaster.

The loan will be used exclusively to buy potato seeds, quinoa seeds, and agrochemicals which will guarantee a good production. With the revenue he generates, Esteban will be able to improve financially and get back on the road to prosperity.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, quinoa seeds, and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia nació en la Provincia de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en la provincia antes mencionada, ella tiene 39 años de edad y  es casada  y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la compra y venta de frutas por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo manzanas, duraznos, membrillos, plátanos y otras cosas más, ella agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

Ella pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en:
Eulalia was born in the province of Paucartambo and still lives there with her family. She is 39 years old, married, and has four children. Eulalia is a hardworking and enterprising mother who is able to move her family forward through the effort of her work. She has a business of selling fruit, so she is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy merchandise such as oranges, peaches, quinces, bananas, and other products. She is grateful to those who have helped her fulfill her dream in this manner.

Eulalia values this loan and promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility. She is a member of the Communal Bank “San Martincito”, which is affiliated with Asociación Arariwa in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy oranges, peaches, quinces, bananas, and other products.

loans.name: Aida

texts.ru: Аида, 33 года, замужем, имеет трех детей (3 дочери). Образование среднее. Семья у Аиды очень дружная и трудолюбивая. Более 4 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 35,000 сом KGS, благодаря ее терпению и трудолюбию на сегодняшний день она получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 6,000 сом KGS. Супруг работает в милиции. В хозяйстве имеет 2 дойные коровы, 2 лошади, 1 бычка и 1 теленка. Аиду характеризуют как: примерного, трудолюбивого, старательного и умеющего вести своё хозяйство человека. В целях увеличения поголовья скота Аида обратилась в  микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 70 000 сом(KGS)  на покупку  овец для дальнейшего разведения. На доходы от кредита Аида планирует увеличить поголовье скота, а также планирует сделать ремонт в своем доме.
texts.en:
Aida is 33 years old, married, and the mother of three children (three daughters).  She has a high school education.  Her family is very friendly and hardworking.

Aida has been involved in animal husbandry for more than four years and started in this business with 35,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her patience and hard work, she now makes a monthly profit of 6,000 som (KGS).  Her husband works for the police.

Aida currently owns two dairy cows, two horses, one young bull and one calf.  She is cited as an exemplary, hardworking, dedicated farmer, fully capable of running her own business.

In order to increase her livestock headcount, she has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy some sheep for further breeding.

She plans to use the earnings from her loan to increase her livestock headcount.  She also plans to perform some repairs on her house.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en: Shazia is a 30-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan and she has no children.  Her husband drives a van. From many days, his van has not been working properly so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible, however due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the van. Therefore Shazia, as a member of a two person lending group, has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the van. This will help him to continue his business. Shazia is very thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing van

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is very grateful for the previous Kiva loan that she received that enabled her make profits that she used to pay her children's school fees.
She is requesting for a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase a sewing machine, thread and rolls of cloth for her tailoring business.
She joined Yehu to access this fund.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine,thread, and rolls of cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Uy

texts.en:
Uy is 35 years old and a mother of two children. She is a resident from the Baray district where she operates a farming business to supplement her husband’s income from the fishing and construction industry. Together, they are able to produce a good profit to cover their daily costs making a net income of KHR 70,000 per day.

Uy is in need of a new loan because her house is still under construction. This will allow her to purchase wood to complete the unfinished parts of her house. She has received two loans in the past, and she paid off her loans successfully. In the future, she will work toward the attainment of her dream of expanding her farming business and make it into a commercial farm.

loans.use: to purchase wood to complete the unfinished parts of her house.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia, aged 36, is a harworking housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good, respectable life. Her husband offers tailoring services which is the only source of income for his family. Currently, his machine has stopped working so he is unable continue his work and generate income. Parveen can't see her husband worried. That is why she has requested a loan from Kiva's Partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of purchasing a tailoring machine.

Nazia hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing a tailoring machine.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 44-year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of 5 children: 2 daughters and 3 sons. Her whole family is fully dependent on her husband.  

Her husband has only a single source of income. Her husband owns a paint workshop in which he provides the services to paint the bodies of auto rickshaws. He paints old and damaged bodies using paint spray guns.  The paint gun works through the air pressure. He has been providing these services for many years and has a good reputation in the market.  A few days ago, his spray gun broke and he is low on his stock of paint. He does not have money to buy spray guns and paint because he already spent his savings on the maintenance of his workshop.  Therefore, Rukhsana requested a loan for her husband so that her husband would be able to buy a new spray gun and paint to carry on his business.

Rukhsana says thank you to all of our field officers.

loans.use: To buy a paint gun to paint bicycle frames.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en: Lydiah is 46 years old, married to Joseph and has two children, whom are aged 16 and 10 years old.She has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the past 23 years. Lydia has applied for her sixth loan from KADET ltd to enable her buy seeds, fertilizer and spraying chemicals.She has paid her previous loans on time. She plans to pay school-fees with her anticipated profits. In the near future, Lydiah hopes to have more output from her farming business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and spraying chemicals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 57-years-old woman from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with small children. Agnes has a farming business that she has been doing for the past 23 years and has applied for her second loan from KADET Ltd. She will use the money to buy fertilizers and seedlings. She is optimistic that her business will do better after this loan. She hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertlizers

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is a group leader of this three persons lending group. She is a 54-years-old housewife. Her husband purchasea cattle and sells them at a profitable price to meet the family needs. Her family is currently living in very miserable conditions. His income is insufficient to fullfil even the very basic needs of his family. Safia has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will purchase cattle with the purpose of reselling them. She hopes that one day she will be able to provide a good education for her children. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

Note: In the picture Safia is sitting in the middle, with her hand raised

loans.use: to purchase cattle with the purpose of reselling them

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma, de 29 años vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Vilma se dedica a la agricultuta y ganadería por eso gracias a los extensos pastos que posee logró comprar 3 vacas lecheras de las que obtiene 30 litros de leche por día, los cuales comercializa a los lecheros de la zona. Su madre le ayudó a comenzar en esta actividad, ya que tiene mucha experiencia en ello recién tiene 2 años dedicándose a este negocio, durante este tiempo aprendió mucho sobre la alimentación de su ganado por lo que desea para el futuro poder ahorrar lo necesario y así comprar más ganados de raza. Mientras tanto también dedica sus esfuerzos a la siembra de maíz y habas en terrenos que heredó de sus padres. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Vilma, invertirá los S/.1000 en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir los pastos naturales que sembró.
texts.en:
Vilma, 29, lives with her 3 children in a house of her own and works as a farmer and cattle breeder. Thanks to the extensive pasture land she owns, she was able to buy 3 milking cows which provide 30 litres of milk per day. She sells the milk to the milkmen in the area. Vilma's mother helped her start this activity because she has a lot of experience in it. Vilma has been working as a farmer for two years. During this time, she has learned a lot about cattle feeding and in the future she wants to save money to buy more breed cattle.
In the meantime, Vilma dedicates her efforts to growing corn and beans in the land she inherited from her parents. This is her second loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she receives to keep going. She also promises to pay her fees in time. Vilma will invest the 1,000 soles in the purchase of organic compost to nourish the natural pastures she sowed.

loans.use: to buy compost

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
Annalie is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has three children. Annalie helps her husband in tilling their farm.
Annalie is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm thus augmenting their yield and profit. Annalie hopes to expand her farming venture so that it will continue to generate revenue, which will enable her to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
This is Rosalinda. She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, as well as in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing this loan to buy gardening materials like wires, baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Rosalinda dreams that her business will last for a long time and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 43 years old from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with four children whom are aged between 17 years and 8 years old. Peter is a farmer and has been in it for the past 13 years. He has applied for his fifth loan from KADET Ltd to enable him buy farm inputs like seedlings and fertilizers to use on his farm. He hopes to expand his business in the near future and uplift his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 38 years of age, married to Andrew and blessed with children. She has been selling used motor vehicle tyres for the past four years and also owns a piece of land which she intends to construct rental houses for additional income. Alice earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 in her business and has requested for a third loan of KES 25,000 to purchase building materials for constructing rental houses. The profit she earns will see to it that the construction work progresses well. Alice hopes to continue with this business so as to educate her children and sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for constructing rental houses.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 54 years old and married with 4 children. He rears livestock and also plants cash crops for selling. These include maize, beans and also vegetables. He has been in this business for the past 14 years and it has been profitable. He currently makes a monthly income of 8,000 Kenya Shillings. This is Joseph's first loan term and he plans to buy seeds and fertilizers for planting in his farm. He also plans to buy cow feeds for his cattle. He will use the anticipated profits from the sales of his farm produce to pay for his children's school fees. Joseph hopes to expand his farming by planting more cash crops hence, making more income and being able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and cow feeds.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah sells clothes in Kangundo and has been in this business for five years. She is 33 years old and married with four children.

This is her second loan, and she plans to use it to buy more clothes to sell. These include blouses, skirts and dresses. She will use the profits to pay the school fees for her children.

Peninah hopes to grow her business, open a boutique, and thereby sell more types of clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Wanjiru, 49 years old, is from Nyandarua South and is married with six children between 15 and 2 years old.

Mary has been a farmer for the past 13 years. She has applied for her fifth loan from KADET Ltd to enable her to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and chemicals and also to pay labor expenses.

Mary's desire and hope is to continue farming and to be able to raise her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and chemicals.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Rubina is a 29 years old house wife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband owns a vegetable shop in the market which is the only source of income for their family. He sells a variety of fresh vegetables in his shop, which he purchases from the field. Presently he is interested to offer more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to the lack of expenses, he finds this difficult. Therefore his wife Rubina has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of vegetables including peas, tomatoes, carrots, onions, potatoes and chillies from the field and then resell them in the market at a profitable price. With the profits, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Rubina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables including peas, tomatoes, carrots, onions, potatoes and chillies to sell.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao is a 41-year-old married woman with two school-aged children. She owns a few plots of farmland, which she inherited from her parents, for growing rice. She is also a rice merchant, purchasing stocks of rice in the harvest season from local farmers and selling at a profitable price. 

Due to a lack of capital, Mao is requesting a loan to supplement her existing capital to buy rice for future sale. With this amount, she hopes to make a good profit and to provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy rice for future sale.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana es una persona muy trabajadora vive en Choluteca, en una comunidad al sur de Honduras, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. 
Doña Juana su negocio es la venta de mariscos desde hace 10 años, los cuales vende en su comunidad a las diferentes personas y negocios que los distribuyen en los caseríos cercanos a su comunidad. 
Doña Juana está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más producto como ser: babosa, pancha, corvina etc. que necesita para cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes, espera que el préstamo la ayude mucho ya que no cuenta con el producto necesario para satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes.
Doña Juana espera que sus ventas aumenten y con esto ganar más ingresos que beneficien y le permiten mejorar su estilo de vida y el de su familia. Desea seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Julio 2013
texts.en:
Juana is a hard-working person. She lives in Choluteca, a community in south Honduras, with her husband and two children. Juana has been selling seafood for 10 years. She sells it in her community to people and businesses who then distribute the product in hamlets near her community.
Juana is asking for a loan to purchase more products such as slugs, breams, sea bass, etc, which she needs to cover the orders from her customers. She hopes the loan will help her greatly because she doesn't have the products needed to satisfy her customers' demands. Juana hopes to increase her sales in order to generate more income that will allow her improve her quality of life and that of her family. She wants to keep supporting her children in their studies so they can have more opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – July 2013

loans.use: to buy different types of fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Panian

texts.en:
Panian has a motorcycle transport business in Kitengela town. He is 45 years of age and married with four children. His wife runs a grocery shop. He has been in this business for 13 years and currently makes a monthly income of 13,000 Kenyan Shillings.

This is his third loan term from KADET LTD and he plans to buy another motorcycle for transport business. He will also use part of the amount to service the one he is currently using. He will use the anticipated income to support his wife's grocery business.

He hopes to have a successful transport business and thereby be able to provide for the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian plants cash crops such as maize and vegetables to sell. She also has a retail shop in Nairobi town. She is 28 years old and married with 1 child. Her husband, who also works, provides additional income to support the family.

This is her second loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting. She also plans to buy more goods to sell in her retail shop. These include rice, sugar and flour. She will use the generated income to provide for the basic need of her family.

Lilian hopes to grow her retail shop business and make more income which will enable her to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting and purchase additional goods to sell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is a 45 year old married woman. She is the mother of four children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a clothing shop where he sells a variety of shawls. This is the only source of income for the family.

Presently she needs additional capital for the growth of the business. For that Jameela is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of shawls to sell, so he can respond quickly to customer needs. 

With the profit he will put aside some savings to pay the electricity and gas bills. Jameela hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of shawls to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a carpenter in Oloitoktok town, where he makes sofa sets, beds, wall units, wooden tables and also chairs. He is 33 years old, married and has 3 children. This will be his second loan term and he plans to use the amount to buy more timber for making beds and tables. He also plans to buy other materials, such as paint and nails for use in his carpentry business. He will use the generated profits to buy more carpentry machines for use in his workshop. Francis hopes to expand his business and makes more varieties of carpentry items, generate more income and to be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy more timber and other materials such as paint and nails for use in carpentry.

loans.name: Njara Blessed Group

texts.en: Mary is a hardworking lady with 5 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is poultry but she also has other income sources such as rental houses, banana plantations and zero grazing. She faces the challenges of price fluctuationa and high cost of feeds; however her dream is to increase her production and supply to a vast market including the city. Mary intends to use this loan to buy chicks for rearing. She is a member of the above mentioned group,where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en: Arnulfo is a 42-years-old married man and a father of three children, aged 16, 12 and 8 respectively. Arnulfo lives with his family in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. Arnulfo has been in this business for more than three years now. He sells various kinds of goods and items. Arnulfo is asking for a loan to buy soda and beverages, rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients and seasonings. With this, he will be able to improve the variety of his stocks so that he can attract more buyers, thus augmenting his sales and income. In the future, Arnulfo hopes to expand his business and make it a stable source of his income.

loans.use: to buy soda and beverages, rice, canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, cooking ingredients and seasonings

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 43-years old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her husband. Her husband owns a snooker club, in which he has placed 3 to 4 snooker tables, to offer for his customers to play. One of those tables has been depreciating for a long time and now it is fully damaged. Its cloth has been torn and the balls have lost their colors. This loss affects his daily income. He wants to buy a new snooker table but does not have the capacity to purchase it. Abida has requested a loan so that her husband could buy a new snooker table and could run his club smoothly. Abida is very happy after taking this loan and very thankful to Kiva and its field partner.

loans.use: to buy a snooker table for snooker club.

loans.name: Kibii

texts.en: Kibii lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has 1 child and has been doing this work for the past 10 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops. He has stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is 'Getting profits.', while his biggest challenge is the 'Transpotation of farm inputs.' The animals on his farm have been given the names of 'Murgut'  and 'Chenwach.' Kibii was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'They give a 2 months grace period.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: Juhudi Kilimo assists smallholder farmers.' Kibii's highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Kibii replied 'It will assist in paying school fees.' As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Kibii owns the following: 'cow and poultry' but does not own 'a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power and TV' but does not have 'electricity, running water, sewing machine or DVD'.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos tiene 63 años,  tiene dos hijos ya mayores de edad,   el se dedica a la agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de La Primavera,  este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Carlos va a utilizar  este préstamo para la compra de semillas para siembra de Maíz  y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, el Sr. Carlos enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios para mejorar la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia ya que el corre con todos los gastos del hogar, es una persona  responsable y trabajador se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindad, una vez que cosecha sus productos los comercializa en el mercado de la comunidad directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en: Carlos is 63,  and has two grown-up children. He works  in agriculture, growing a variety of vegetables including potatoes, manioc and maize on his plot of land located in the town of La Primavera. This is Carlos' first loan with the organisation, and he is going to use it to buy seeds to grow maize,  after first preparing the ground. His reason for requesting the loan is to obtain the resources he needs to grow his crops and make a living. Carlos faces challenges in his business such as bad weather, which often ruins his crops. He will use the profits from his venture to improve his and his family's quality of life, since he is responsible for household expenses. He is a responsible and hard-working individual who is grateful to the organisation for the support it provides. After he harvests his crops, he sells them in the community market directly from the producer to the consumer.

loans.use: to buy seeds to sow maize.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah, 49, is married with two children between the ages of two and four. She has been a farmer for the past 23 years. 

She has applied for her third loan from KADET Ltd. to buy farm inputs, like seeds, chemicals and fertilizers to use on her farm. She hopes to continue farming and become a large scale farmer.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, chemicals and fertilizers

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en:
Zviad, 37, is married and lives with spouse in the Bolnisi district of Georgia. A car mechanic, Zviad owns an auto repair shop and serves local drivers. His wife works as a teacher at the local school and gets a small monthly salary.  

Because their existing income is hardly enough for a young couple, Zviad has decided to further develop his business. He has requested a loan to purchase engine oil to sell at his repair shop. He will offer his clients oil-changing services as well.
 
Zviad is very enthusiastic and hard working with a great desire to get ahead. This loan will be a great support for the family. 

He is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase engine oil for selling

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah, 36, has two children. She has been poultry farming in Kangundo town for the past four years. She supplies chickens and eggs to hotels and restaurants. Besides poultry farming, she runs a beauty shop.

This is Monicah’s fourth loan from KADET. She plans to use the loan to buy more chicks for rearing. She will also buy more chicken feed and improve the breeding place for the poultry by building a better poultry shed. She also plans to buy beauty products to sell in her beauty shop.
