John has requested for a first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase bales of flour, a sack of sugar and rice, detergents and tea leaves for selling.  The profit he earns will aid him in expanding this business as well as to repay his loan.  He hopes to see his business grow.

loans.use: To purchase bales of flour, a sack of sugar and rice, detergents and tea leaves.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana, 26, is a vigorous lady; she is involved in the business of sewing clothes to contribute to the family income. She is a very talented lady and makes enough income to meet her household expenses. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she is now requesting a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads and packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. Rukhsana hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads and packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Zareena is a 29-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Zareena makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for Rs. 30,000 which she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Jeofi

texts.en:
Jeofi is 33 years old and married with six children, five of whom are in school. For the past six years, she has been running a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from farming vegetables and peanuts. Jeofi works hard to provide for her family. 

Jeofi is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy stocks to sell such as soap, sugar, rice, and other groceries. She has borrowed and repaid 13 previous loans from NWTF. Jeofi aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, rice, and other groceries

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 34 years old married woman.  She is a vigorous lady and for the past four years has been running a business of fabric sales.  She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community.  She makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.  She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Sajida is requesting a loan of RS. 20,000 from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Eider Arbey

texts.es: Eider es un hombre de 32 años de edad, es casado y padre de dos hijos de 11 y 4 años. Debido al desempleo y la falta de oportunidades laborales, su familia ha pasado por una situación económica muy difícil, pero con su actitud emprendedora y con ganas de salir adelante siguió buscando opciones que le permitieran salir adelante y hace 6 meses se le presentó la oportunidad de alquilar un espacio que tiene una cancha sintética de fútbol la cual alquila por horas, además cuenta con una tienda al lado de la cancha donde ofrece mecato, bebidas hidratantes, gaseosas, y licor, con esto ha logrado recibir ingresos para continuar con el sustento de su hogar. El prestatario solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (mesas y sillas) y surtido al por mayor (mecato, cerveza, gaseosa, bebidas hidratantes, confitería); con esto podrá mejorar la imagen de su negocio para que sus clientes estén cómodos y puedan disfrutar del espacio y ofrecerá mayor variedad de productos para satisfacer los diferentes gustos de las personas que visitan su negocio; esto aumentará sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Eider sueña con tener su cancha sintética propia para poder mejorar su economía, de esta forma podrá ofrecer mejor educación a sus hijos y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda la familia.
texts.en: Eider is a 32-year-old man. He is married and the father of two children who are 11 and four years old. Due to unemployment and lack of work opportunities, his family has gone through very difficult financial times. But with an entrepreneurial attitude and dreams of moving ahead, he continued looking for options that would allow him to get ahead. Six months ago, an opportunity presented itself to rent some space that has synthetic soccer field turf, which he rents out by the hour. He also has a store next to the field where he sells cakes, hydrating drinks, sodas, and liquor. With this, he has generated income to continue supporting his household. The borrower is requesting the loan to purchase fixed assets (tables and chairs) and stock up on wholesale items (cakes, beer, sodas, hydrating drinks, and candies). With this he will be able to improve his business' image so his customers will be more comfortable and be able to enjoy the space, as well as so he can offer a better variety of products to satisfy the different tastes of the people who patronize his business. The will augment his sales, and, ultimately, his revenues. Eider dreams of having his own soccer field to be able to improve his finances so he will be able to offer his children a better education and improve his entire family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fixed assets (tables and chairs) and stock up on wholesale items (cakes, beer, sodas, hydrating drinks, and candies).

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 41-year-old widow; she is successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house to support the needs of her family members. She offers good quality products for daily use and counts on a good client list.  Being a single parent of two children, she is motivated to provide them with good quality food, clothing and health.  

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of RS. 25,000 to buy packs of grains, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store.  She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of grains, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 43-year-old, married woman and a mother of two.  She has been running a business of fabric sales for many years.  She purchases a variety of cloths and fabric from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity.  She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community. 

Naseem requested a loan of RS. 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.  In this way, she would be able to earn more income through greater sales.  She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.  She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Doña lidia tiene 32 años de edad es agricultora y ama de casa, madre de 2 hijos los cuales son menores de edad con un grado de educación primario no completado cursado hasta el 4 grado. En compañía de su esposo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra y cultivo de café fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra ya que en su familia es una tradición. La tierra que ellos en familia trabajan es propia gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres la cual está ubicada a 20 minutos de camino desde su casa de habitación y en pocas ocasiones se trasladan en carro. Sus clientes son los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona, vecinos y bodegas.

Ella ha solicitado a COMIXMUL un financiamiento para la compra de abono, foliares, formula cafetalera, etc. con lo cual ella podrá proteger y dar un mejor follaje a su cultivos café. 

Su meta es lograr mejorar y la calidad del café que actualmente tiene cultivado en su tierra ya que de esta forma ella podrá atraer más clientes y con las ganancias poder re-invertir comprando nueva chapola y una mejor variedad y más competitiva para el mercado.
texts.en: Lidia is a 32-year-old farmer and mother of 2 minor children.  She did not complete primary school beyond the fourth grade.  Together with her husband she works at farming and growing coffee.  She learned to farm from her parents, as it is a tradition in her family.  Her family owns the land that they farm, thanks to an inheritance from her parents.  It is located 20 minutes from their house on foot, although they sometimes go there by car.  Her customers are different buyers who come from the area, neighbors and stores.   She has requested a loan from COMIXMUL to buy manure, foliar fertilizer and coffee fertilizer, etc., with which she will be able to protect and create better foliage in her coffee crop.  Her goal is to improve the quality of the coffee that she is growing.  In this way she can can attract more customers, and with the income will be able to reinvest in buying more coffee seedlings and a greater variety of coffee so as to be more competitive in the market.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to protect her coffee crop.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 25 years old, married to Peter and blessed with two children aged one year and another seven months respectively.  She runs a shop she opened three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 29,600.  She has requested for a first loan of KES 10,000 to purchase more cloth materials, belts, shoes, buckets and utensils for sale.  The profit she earns will be ploughed back to her business. 

Joyce's dream is to see this business expand and have a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth and fabric materials, belts, shoes, buckets and utensils for sale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick lives in Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya, a very fertile area for agriculture production.  He has been a mixed farmer for over fifteen years.  His source of income is cash crops, horticultural crops and milk.  Besides farming, he has a retail business.\

He wants to construct a zero grazing unit for his dairy cattle and therefore has requested for a loan of KES. 50,000 from Juhudi Kilimo for undertaking that project.  He says that this loan will help him take care of his animals well and thus increase milk production and his income base will therefore increase.  This will improve his living standards.  The challenge he faces is insufficient funds.  In five years he wants to be the leading milk producer in that region.
He is happy with Juhudi Kilimo for funding him.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Makariyo

texts.en: Makariyo is a 46 year old hardworking man with 6 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  His main business is farming alongside running a bar to boost his income.  He faces challenges of limited capital, however, he has a vision of constructing a rental house on the plot he is going to buy. Makariyo is requesting for a loan to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce used her previous loan to buy synthetic hair and other cosmetics for her salon. She is still running the salon business alongside selling shoes to boost her income. Her main hardships are unpredictable price changes; however, she has a vision of constructing a good house on her plot and owning a modern salon. Joyce is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics and weaves for use in her salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and weaves for use in her salon.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 50-year-old married woman. For the past two years, she has run a beauty parlor and she offers many services to her customers including makeup, hair styling, and facials. Over time, Nasreen has attained a regular list of customers and she makes enough to contribute in the family income. 

Nasreen is requesting a 30,000 PKR loan to purchase hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities to expand her customer base. She will use her loan to serve more customers at a time. Nasreen is very experienced in her business and confident it will move forward as a result of her loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 50 year old married woman and the mother of four children. To support her husband financially in meeting their household expenses she started her business of stitching clothes.  She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family.  However, due to the lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers.  

For this reason she requested a loan of RS 20,000 to Kashf Foundation.  It will allow her to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons.  In this way she will be able to stitch up more dresses on time.  She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend the part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 34 year old married woman.  She has been running her beauty parlor for the past 8 years.  She offers many facilities to her customers such as make up, hair styling and facials.  By providing her best services she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more varieties of cosmetics products for the parlor.  But because of having low cash in hand she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan.  She needs a loan of RS. 20,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.  She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time.  She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en: Nazeeran, age 44, is a married woman and a mother of nine children. She has been successfully running a small bookstore with her husband at the corner of her house. She offers various items such as books, copies, pencils, etc. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy stationery items, packing material, books and school copies to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stationery items, packing material, books and school copies.

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en:
Hameeda is a 25-year-old married woman. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of her family. Hameeda started a business sewing clothes to contribute to the family income. She is very familiar with many stitching techniques and enjoys a great client list. 

Hameeda is requesting 20,000 PKR loan to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packets of needles, laces, and ribbons to meet customer demand. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to threads in different colors along with packets of needles, laces, and ribbons

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 52-year-old married woman. She and her husband have been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market where has maintained many contacts over the years. Shahida is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. 

Shahida is requesting a 30,000 PKR loan to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy of rice, sugar, and flour

loans.name: Azhran

texts.en: Azhran, age 33, is a married woman. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so that she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Suryia

texts.en: Suryia is a 51-year-old married woman; she has been in the business of milk sales for the past three years.  By this time, she has become famous for providing good, quality milk in her town. She also sells butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to provide her a decent life. She is a mother of seven children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of it. Now, she requested for a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en: Rabia is 22 years old and a married woman; she has been stitching clothes for the past three years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and laces in various colors to meet up with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is 32 years old. She is married and lives in the small town of Goriwith her husband, retired parents-in-law and two children (5 and 13 years old). Nana’s husband is a soldier and her father-in-law works as a food distributor. Both of the family members get monthly salaries. Nana’s economic activity is a newly started store in a rented commercial place, selling different types of groceries. Her grocery store is not well-stocked, and it needs support to further develop. Several times she has asked for loans from local financial institutions to develop her business, but without success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of her low income. However, Nana’s loan request was approved as part of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-ups and re-startups with credit with soft conditions to the vulnerable poor who do not have access to credit products, since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With this loan, Nana will cover the costs of purchasing the necessary stock of basic groceries that customers often request. She plans to increase the turnover in her trade business gradually. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of her family. Nana will work hard, and she will be able to improve her family's living conditions. With this loan, her family will generate enough income to access regular available credit products in the country’s capital market, in the event that they need it.

loans.use: to purchase basic groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 40-year-old married woman with 5 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is selling bed sheets, but she also has rental houses to boost her income. She faces the challenges of business seasonality and inadequate capital. However, she dreams of diversifying her businesses to include farming. Nadia intends to use the loan to buy bed sheets to sell.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes, who used her previous loan to buy sugar, soap, and rice to sell, has continued with the same business alongside farming in order to boost her income. Limited capital is her major hindrance to business growth, but she has a vision of expanding her enterprise into new areas. Agnes intends to use this loan to buy maize flour, rice and cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina is a 58-year-old married woman; she is running a business of milk sales with the support of her husband. She has three buffalo; she looks after the buffalo and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on daily basis. She also deals in the business of animal sales to generate an extra amount of revenue. She is a mother of four children; she needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make huge profits, she requested for a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to inflate her sales of milk. She hopes to get an increase in earnings and wishes to spend part of revenue on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Pedro Nel

texts.es: Pedro, a sus 44 años de edad es soltero y no tiene hijos. Gran parte de su vida productiva la dedicó a trabajar en la agricultura, desempeñándose como jornalero, lo contrataban por horas o por cosechas, por lo que su economía era bastante inestable. Debido a esto, decidió buscar otras opciones que le permitieran generar ingresos constantes, y desde hace 5 meses se dedicó a vender de manera ambulante productos como mecato, confitería, cigarrillos y galletería en una pequeña chaza que adquirió, de esta manera ha obtenido ingresos para su sustento diario y el de su mamá. Pedro es un hombre trabajador, emprendedor y tiene muchas ganas de progresar. Se motiva a solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de surtido (mecato, galletería, confitería, chocolates, cigarrillos, agua y gaseosas) y además comprará una nevera portátil de icopor para enfriar las bebidas, esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes, satisfaciendo sus gustos y necesidades, lo que incrementará sus ventas y tendrá ingresos más estables. Pedro sueña con acreditar bien su negocio, ser muy reconocido en el sector, aumentar su clientela y tener la oportunidad de brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su madre.
texts.en:
Pedro, 44, is single and has no children.  He has spent a large part of his work life as an agricultural day laborer.  He was contracted by hour or by harvest, which caused his finances to be fairly unstable.  Because of this he decided to look for other options so he could generate a more stable income.

Five months ago he started selling pastry, candy, cigarettes, and cookies as a street vendor and in a small stall he acquired.  This way he has earned income to support himself and his mother on a daily basis.

Pedro's a hardworking and enterprising man who very much wants to move forward.  He's motivated to request a loan to invest in buying stock (pastry, cookies, candy, chocolate, cigarettes, water, and soda) and a portable polystyrene cooler to chill beverages.  This will allow him to offer his customers a wider variety of products to satisfy their tastes and needs.  His sales will increase and he'll have a more stable income.

Pedro dreams of getting recognition for his business, being very well known in the area, increasing his clientele, and having the opportunity to give his mother a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock and a cooler

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en: Herbert, a 34-year-old married father of three living in Fort Portal Uganda, operates a wholesale shop but also grows crops to earn a living. His main challenge is limited capital, but  he has dreams of constructing a permanent house for residence and expanding his business into new areas. Herbert intends to use this loan to  buy soap, sugar, salt, soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: To buy more soap, sugar, salt, sodas, and beer for resale.

loans.name: Jose Irene

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia que está comprendida por su esposa y su hijo de crianza de doce años de edad. El se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra como: Hierro, bronce y cobre; él aprendió este negocio cuando era empleado hace doce años el se independizo y ahora el trabaja propio, los horarios en los que el desempeña su trabajo son de 7:00 am – 5:00 pm o más.
Don José, invertirá el crédito en compra de chatarra como: Hierro, aluminio, cobre, bronce y baterías de carro y de esa manera incrementar su inventario y poder vender más y poder cancelar el crédito y algunos gastos del hogar.
El mayor sueño de José es, poder trabajar sin financiamiento y poder crecer  y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José lives with his family, made up of his wife and his son, 12.  He earns a living buying and selling scrap such as iron, bronze, and copper.  He learned this business when he was employed.  Twelve years ago he became independent and now he works on his own.  He works from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. or longer.

José will invest the loan in buying scrap such as iron, aluminum, copper, bronze, and car batteries.  This way he'll increase his inventory and be able to sell more and pay back the loan and some household expenses.

José's biggest dream is to be able to work without financing, to grow, and to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal and car batteries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing to open a business

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali, 51 years old, lives in the village of Baghdadi with her husband, two grown sons, daughter-in-law and a grandchild. The family runs an agricultural business and cultivates nuts and maize. They also own a greenhouse where tomatoes, cucumbers and peppers are grown. Additionally, Dali is involved in an animal husbandry business with a milk cow and two calves. Her agricultural products are always of high quality and are sold at the local open market. Her husband owns a truck and rents it out to earn a monthly income.

With this start-up loan Dali plans to purchase a van and start trading with the support of her spouse. They will purchase a variety of fruits and vegetables in the neighboring town and make deliveries with the van. Dali will also sell the products from the small stall located at the open market. She thinks that the business will be profitable and the family will have a stable income, enabling them to cover everyday costs as well as expand their business in future.

With the support of the start-up program, Dali will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle their financial difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase a van to use in her fruit and vegetable business.

loans.name: Ambrocia

texts.es:
Ambrocia nació en la Provincia de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en la provincia antes mencionada, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cinco hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la venta de desayunos por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo maca, quinua, azúcar, pan y otras cosas más, ella agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

Ella pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en:
Ambrocia was born in the province of Paucartambo and still lives there with her family. She is married, and has five children. Ambrocia is a hardworking and enterprising mother who is able to move her family forward through the effort of her work. She has a business of selling breakfasts, so she is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy supplies such as maca root, quinoa, sugar, bread, and other items. She is grateful to those who have helped her fulfill her dream in this manner.

Ambrocia values this loan and promises to complete her monthly payments with great responsibility. She is a member of the Communal Bank “San Martincito”, which is affiliated with Asociación Arariwa in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy maca root, quinoa, sugar, bread, and other items.

loans.name: Lina María

texts.es: Lina, a sus 25 años de edad, es casada y madre de un bebé de 3 meses. Durante 3 años laboró en un negocio de comidas rápidas como empleada, pero en vista de que las condiciones de su embarazo eran de alto riesgo tuvo que retirarse. Actualmente se encuentra desempleada y debido a las necesidades económicas por las que atraviesa su familia y los gastos que genera su bebé, ella desea iniciar su propio negocio, aprovechando que se le presentó la oportunidad de adquirir un carrito de perros ubicado en un punto reconocido del sector donde reside, allí ofrecerá hamburguesas, perros calientes, salchipapas, chuzos de carne, entre otros. Desempeñará esta labor gracias a la experiencia y al conocimiento adquirido en su anterior empleo, con esto podrá obtener los recursos necesarios para aportar a la economía y al sostenimiento de su hogar. Lina es una mujer emprendedora, luchadora, activa y juiciosa, con ganas de salir adelante. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra del carrito de perros, mesas, sillas y surtido (carnes frías, pan, papas, aceite) con el fin de poder dar inicio a su labor y avanzar un paso más hacia el cumplimiento de sus metas, hacer crecer su negocio y lograr que sea reconocido en el sector y perdurable en el tiempo para poder generar buenos ingresos y tener una estabilidad económica que le permita tener mejor calidad de vida en compañía de su esposo y su bebé.
texts.en:
Lina, at 25 years old, is married and the mother of a baby who is three months old. For three years, she worked at a fast food business as an employee, but in light of her pregnancy being so high risk, she had to resign. Now she finds herself unemployed and, due to financial needs that her family has as well as the expenses that came along with her baby, she wants to start her own business and take advantage of the opportunity that presented itself to acquire a hot dog stand located at a well-known spot in the area where she lives. There, she will sell hamburgers, hot dogs, salchipapas (hot dogs and fries), meat kabobs, and other items. She will do this work thanks to the experience and know-how she gained at her last job. With this, she will be able to earn the income needed to support her household. 

Lina is an enterprising, fighting, active, and sensible woman with hopes of getting ahead. She is requesting the loan to purchase the hot dog stand, tables, seats, and stock (cold meats, bread, potatoes, oil) with the goal of being able to start her work and get just a little closer to reaching her goals, which are to grow her business, become well known in the area, and survive the time to be able to generate good revenues and have financial stability that will allow her to have a better quality of life with her husband and baby.

loans.use: purchase a hot dog stand, tables, chairs, and stock (cold meats, bread, potatoes, oil).

loans.name: Ruth Damaris

texts.es: Ruth, con 43 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos. Por falta de oportunidades laborales, se vio en la necesidad de obtener recursos por cuenta propia, por lo que decidió iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas y fritos hace varios meses, con esto ha podido ayudar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar, pues con el salario que él gana no es suficiente para sobrevivir y han pasado por situaciones muy precarias. Ruth es una señora pujante, enérgica, activa y su principal motivación para seguir luchando son sus hijos. Por esta razón solicita el apoyo del crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de insumos (verduras, aceite, carne, frutas, harina, gaseosas) con el fin de tener materia prima disponible para elaborar sus productos y poder aumentar su nivel de ventas y sus ingresos. Esto ayudará a darle continuidad a su actividad y hacer que su negocio crezca y sea reconocido en el sector, que le permita aumentar sus ingresos y poder ofrecer una mejor educación a sus hijos para que tengan un futuro próspero y exitoso, además de mejorar la calidad de vida de todo el núcleo familiar.
texts.en: Ruth, 43 years old, is married and the mother of two children. Due to the lack of work opportunities, she saw the need to generate income on her own, which is why she decided a few months ago to start her own business selling meals and fried foods. With this, she has been able to help her husband with the household finances because the salary he earns is not enough to survive, and they have gone through very precarious situations. Ruth is a thriving, energetic, active woman, and her main motivation is to continue fighting for her children. For this reason she is requesting the support of a loan to purchase supplies (vegetables, oil, meat, fruit, flour, sodas) with the goal of having basic materials on hand to make her products and be able to increase her sales level and her income. This will help her continue her work, make her business grow, and become well-known in the area, which will allow her to increase her revenues and be able to give her children a better education so they can have a prosperous and successful future. It will also help her improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase supplies (vegetables, oil, meat, fruit, flour, sodas)

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 46 year old woman from the Migori region in the Western part of Kenya. She supports 3 people in her family; she is a widow, and was left with 2 children who are 13 and 15 years old respectively. She sells second hand clothes, which she has been doing for the last 5 years, and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. Rose has applied for her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to increase the volume of her stock. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business. Her dream is to become a successful business lady in the region and have a good life for her family.

loans.use: to increase the volume of her stock

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana is 34 years old, married, and the mother of two kids. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives with her husband and two daughters in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a very active and passionate woman. She started her livestock business seven years ago and since that time, she's become a well-experienced and skilled woman; many people in her village are coming to ask her advice about keeping livestock. 

Tarana resells cattle. Her primary income per month is 160 AZN. Tarana, together with her husband, looks after animals and once every five to six months, they sell them at the livestock bazaar. Tarana would like to expand her activity in this field. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN. She will use this loan to purchase six cattle.

loans.use: to purchase six cattle for her livestock business

loans.name: Cyros

texts.en: Cyros is 30 years of age, married to Vivian, and blessed with three children aged nine, six and three years respectively. He has been in the transport business for three years and has seen this business expand. His monthly income has steadily increased over the three years to KES 8,000 from the previous KES 3,000. Cyros wants to purchase a new motorbike and has requested a third loan of KES 80,000. The profit he earns will help him cater to his family’s basic needs. His dream is to lead a comfortable and successful life.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike

loans.name: Anali

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “APU KAMER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Anali tiene 29 años,tiene 2 hijos y es conviviente,la socia se dedica al negocio de restaurant y libreria,la socia prepara diferentes pplatos como arroz con pollo,pollo al horno y sopas,la socia tambien vende cuadernos,libros,borradores entre otros,la socia por medio de sus negocios sca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar sus negocios de libreria y restaurant.La socia solicita el credito apra comprar insumos para el restaurnat como pollo,carne y verduras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Anali is a member of the Communal Bank “Apu Kamer” which is located in the District of Coya, Calca Province, Department of Cusco. She is 29 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children.

Anali’s businesses include a restaurant and a bookstore. She prepares different dishes such as chicken with rice, roasted chicken, and soups. Anali also sells notebooks, books, erasers, and other items. Through these businesses, she is able to help her children get ahead. Her dream is to expand both her bookstore and restaurant businesses.

Anali is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for her restaurant such as chicken, meat, and vegetables. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a man of thirty-nine years who is married to Christine, and a father of three children. He operates a taxi business and also has a bakery in Kangemi. He has been in this business for thirteen years now and earns a monthly income of fifty thousand shillings. This will be Charles' first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy cooking oil, flour, charcoal, etc. in bulk. In the future he wants to own a big bakery, and start a car hire business.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, flour, charcoal, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en: Lydiah is 26 years old, married to Johnstone, and blessed with two children. She owns a phone accessories shop – a business she started three years ago – and earns a monthly income of KES 40,000. She has requested her first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase more phone accessories. The profit she earns will help her to pay back her loan and expand her business. Her dream is to see this business expand and earn her more profits.

loans.use: To purchase phone accessories.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 33 years old, single, and lives in Gbarnga in Liberia. Gbarnga is located in the centre of Liberia in Bong County. The majority of people are employed as farmers, cultivating crops such as rice, palm oil, and cassava. 
 
Nelly has been running a food-selling business for the past seven years, selling oil, pepper, salt, vita, etc. She works 10 hours a day at her business. She takes a taxi most of the time to buy her goods. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is that she has small capital on-hand. She stopped her education in the fifth grade. She has three children between four to thirteen years old; they all live at home and go to school. 
 
With the proceeds from the loan, Nelly wants to buy more oil, pepper, salt, vita, etc. for her business. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.  She started her business with money from her mother. In the future, she wants to own a house. Nelly is proud of her business because she gets money every day for her home expenses.  

She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy oil, pepper, salt, vita, etc. for her business

loans.name: Emzar

texts.en:
Emzar is 42 years old, married, and lives in the town of Kutaisi with his wife, his retired mother, and his two children who go to the local school. Emzar’s wife has chronic health problems and gets small monthly assistance from the local government.

Emzar is a bread distributor and works hard all day long, but his wage is modest and is not enough for his family of five. That’s why he decided to start his own business. Emzar plans to purchase a van and make bread deliveries himself. He will leave his current job and start a distribution business in his town, but he needs financial support for implementing his plan.

The asking amount will be added to Emzar’s savings and he will be able to purchase a secondhand van. After the van is purchased, Emzar will buy bread at wholesale prices from the bakery and distribute them to local groceries. The new business initiative will be a great support for his family, as they will generate income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a van and start a bread distribution business

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and has been blessed with six children. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. 

For the past six years, she has operated a food stall business, selling household consumables to local customers. She faces the major challenge of high costs of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, Mwanamisi wants to purchase sacks of maize and beans for her business. She will also use the rest of the money to renovate her house. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize and beans for her business and to use the rest of the money to renovate her house

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman who has one child who is underage. Saumu lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is purchasing food for her family.

For the past two years, Saumu has operated a secondhand shoe-selling business, selling only ladies' shoes from her home to her neighbours and passersby. She cites delayed payments as a challenge in the business.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase twenty pairs of shoes for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase twenty pairs of shoes to sell through her business

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a lady of forty years who is married to Edward and a mother of two children. She is a tailor and also runs a dressmaking school in Kinoo, in the outskirts of Kangemi, Kenya. She has been in this business for fourteen years and earns a monthly income of KES 60,000. This will be Faith's first loan with KADET LTD and she plans to use the entire loan to buy materials for dress making. In future Faith wants to open more dress-making schools to impact members of her community as well as to sustain her finances and better her family's life.

loans.use: to buy materials for dress making.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is grateful for all the previous loans she got from Yehu, which have enabled her to gain profits in her clothing-selling business. She used those profits to pay the school fees for her two children.

She is now requesting for another loan of KES 50,000 to add more bales of clothes in her clothing business. Mwanakombo joined Yehu to access the loan funds and to boost her business.

loans.use: to add more bales of clothes to her clothing business

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is very grateful to Yehu and Kiva for their loan services, which have enabled her to make profits and take care of her family. Her vision is to open a boutique shop and sell more clothes.

She is requesting another loan of KES 40,000 to purchase more bales of clothes for her business. Saumu is grateful to Yehu since it has helped her boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes for her business

loans.name: Razmik

texts.en:
Razmik, a father of three children (two of whom are in the photo), is from Basen village in the Shirak region. He has been involved in agriculture for many years, owning a farm which is his only source of income. Razmik breeds cattle (15 sheep, 3 cows and calves) and cultivates wheat. His wife makes dairy products which Razmik sells in the local market.

The farming business is crucial to Razmik's ability to earn income and sustain his children's living standards. Unfortunately the barn where Razmik keeps the livestock is very old and needs to be renovated, so he is requesting a loan for that purpose and to purchase forage for feeding the livestock.

Razmik will be very grateful to Kiva lenders, as the loan will give him an opportunity to continue running his farm and making his family's life better.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the barn and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a 36 year old lady from a place known as Riosil in Migori County, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Noah, who is a businessman from the same location and provides an additional income. She supports 4 people in her family and has four children who are 16, 14, 8 and 2 years old.
 
Millicent has been operating a cereals stall for the last 7 years and makes a monthly income of KES 5,000. She has applied for her sixth loan which she will use to purchase more cereals for sale. She will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business. Millicent's dream is to have a stable source of income and take good care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more cereals for sale

loans.name: Marko

texts.en:
Marko is a 27-year-old married male from Kosovo, currently living in a minority community. He has one daughter, who is three years old, and his wife is a housewife and stay-at-home mom. They are expecting another baby soon. Marko has been the owner of a small restaurant for one year now. He makes breakfasts, lunches, and dinners, which includes kebabs and soups. He usually works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm everyday. His customers belong to all nationalities that live in his community in Kosovo. 

Marko really enjoys his business of selling food to people. For the first time, he is requesting a loan so that he can purchase a fridge, some meat, beverages, and other inventory for his small restaurant. These purchases will help him to better meet the needs of the customers from all communities and he hopes that the loan will help him increase the size of his restaurant, thereby increasing his income and then improving his living conditions. 

Marko’s goals are to gather enough money to expand his small restaurant into a big one in the future. He is very happy for the financial support from Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to purchase a fridge, meat, beverages, and other inventory for his restaurant

loans.name: Maritha

texts.en: Maritha is a 54 year old from Nyandarua South, Kenya, and is married with three children who are aged between 20 and 14 years. She is a farmer and has applied for her fourth loan from KADET Ltd to enable her buy a dairy cow, which she will use to boost her dairy business. She is optimistic that her business will do better after the loan. Maritha hopes to build her own house in the future to curb the rent-paying bills, as well as to successfully educate her children.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is 22, single, and lives in the western part of Kosovo. She has worked as part of her family's business for the last five years. The family business includes producing and selling dairy products to markets in the area and within the city. Sara’s family comes from a region where producing and selling dairy products are a tradition in order to generate income.  

In the beginning, her family started with very simple equipment and they have managed to buy more equipment and have seen their business develop more. Now, for the first time, Sara is asking for a loan to a buy cistern 2000 l to constantly maintain the temperature of milk. This loan will help in the preservation of raw milk. She hopes to develop and expand the types and amounts of milk products she distributes. Her goal is to have more advanced technology in order to increase her client base and to satisfy their demands and requests. She wants to thank all of the lenders for this help!

loans.use: to buy a cistern to constantly maintain the temperature of milk for her family's dairy business

loans.name: Sofya

texts.en:
Sofya is a devoted mother from Azatan village. She lives with his son, Misak, and with him, is involved in agriculture. They own a plot of land where wheat, barley, and greens are cultivated. Misak is very young; he is 19, but already very skilled in farming, of course with the help of his mother, who helps him very much.

Sofya takes care of her farm with great love and pleasure, and also feels very responsible to take care of her son's living conditions. So, in order to tackle financial difficulties, Sofya has requested this loan. With the help of it, she will pay for watering of the land, cultivation of the harvest, and to purchase fertilizer, which is very important for successful cultivation.

Sofya will be very grateful to Kiva lenders, as this loan is a great support for her farm and is a good chance to improve her life.

loans.use: to pay for watering the land, cultivation of the harvest, and to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en: Teresiah is a 78 year old from Nyahururu. She is a widow and does not have any children. Teresiah is a farmer, and she has been in this occupation for the past 40 years. She has applied for a loan of KES 24,167 from KADET LTD which is her first loan, and she intends to use it to buy a water tank. Her hope and dream is to have a comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has a grocery business in Makueni town, Kenya. She sells vegetables, potatoes, pumpkins and tomatoes, among other foodstuffs. She is 48 years old and married with 7 children. She has been in this business for 13 years and she currently makes a monthly income of 8,000 Kenyan Shillings.

This being her first loan term, she plans to use the money to buy more stock of oranges, onions, tomatoes, potatoes and vegetables for selling. She anticipates making more profits, which she will use to provide for the needs of her family. Mary hopes to have a stable grocery business and make more income and be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy oranges, onions, tomatoes, potatoes and vegetables

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a widowed woman of 52 years. She has two children. She sells African printed materials such as hand bags, walking them from door to door. She has been in this business for thirteen years and gets a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings.

This will be Grace's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire amount to buy more African printed materials and new hand bags for resale. In the future Grace wants to open a shop where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to buy more African printed materials and new hand bags for resale

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 34 years old. He is married to Julia and they have two children aged ten and three years old. He has been in the business of selling tea leaves for the past three years and has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him add more stock of tea leaves to his business. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children. He hopes to buy land and build a home in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more stock of tea leaves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Peluce

texts.en: Peluce is a thirty-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling food for two years and also farms to earn extra income. She started her business to have a source of income to support her family. She hopes to expand her business to new areas; however, lack of enough capital is her challenge. Peluce is requesting a loan to buy tomatoes, onions, bananas, and sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, bananas, and sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Daniel

texts.es: Oscar, a sus 22 años de edad, vive con su mamá y su abuela, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Después de haber terminado sus estudios secundarios, se dedicó a trabajar como ayudante de construcción, convirtiéndose luego en maestro de obra, gracias a la experiencia y los conocimientos que obtuvo. Esto le permitió ir consiguiendo sus propios contratos y así ha logrado generar ingresos para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Desde hace 3 meses comenzó a laborar en la empresa productora de huevos, desempeñando el cargo de operario, actividad que alterna con los contratos de construcción. Oscar es un joven enérgico, activo, pujante y con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su familia, por esta razón solicita el crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de una moto con la cual facilitará su desplazamiento para cumplir con los contratos de forma oportuna, pues sus labores implican desplazarse largos trayectos hasta otros municipios. Esto le permitirá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal objetivo, que es tener un negocio rentable, que le permita tener una estabilidad económica para brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su madre y a su abuela y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar is 22 years old and lives with his mother and grandmother. He is single and has no children. After finishing his high school education, he decided to work as a construction assistant. He eventually went on to become a master builder, thanks to the experience and knowledge that he gained. This has allowed him to secure his own contracts so that he can generate income to provide for his daily household needs. Three months ago, Oscar began a job as a cargo operator for a company that produces eggs. He divides his time between this job and his construction contracts.

Oscar is an energetic, active, and thriving young man who has the drive to succeed on behalf of his family. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the purchase of a motorcycle. This will help him with transportation so that he can complete his contracts in a timely manner since these jobs require him to travel long distances to other towns. As a result, he can achieve his main goal of having a profitable business that provides financial stability, better living conditions, and a better quality of life for his mother and grandmother.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle so that he can travel to his construction jobs.

loans.name: Goran

texts.en:
Goran is 34 years old and divorced. Currently he lives in a minority community of Kosovo with his parents. For quite some time, he has been working in an agricultural business growing wheat and corn on his land, and then selling the products in his area in order to make a living. Up until now he has always had to pay others to rent a tractor when he needed to plow and harvest his land. Now he is asking for a loan to purchase his own tractor so that he can cut unnecessary expenses for his business and therefore earn extra income for his family. 

Since he is able to support his family through his business, he hopes that this will help them to live with an even a better lifestyle and quality of life. He hopes to keep on making his own living and not having to ask others for money or rely on others for assistance. Goran is very grateful to all of the Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy a tractor to farm his land.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam and her husband (in the photo) are young farmers who are already highly skilled in animal breeding. Currently they keep 15 chickens, 14 sheep, and three cows, whose milk they use in the production of dairy products. Mariam, her husband and their 3-year-old daughter live in small village called Amasia, which is in Shirak region.  

Mariam and her husband do their best to increase their income and provide better living conditions for their family. Now, this young and hardworking couple needs a loan for the organization of their farming activities. Specifically, the loan form Kiva will help them to renovate their old barn and purchase forage for feeding the livestock.

Mariam and her husband hope that Kiva lenders will help them to improve both their farm and their family income.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the barn and to buy forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Eneyda Solans

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “APU KAMER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Coya, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Eneyda Solans tiene 23 años es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo,la socia se dedica al negocio de crianza de cuyes,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de crianza de cuyes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eneyda Solans is a member of the Communal Bank “Apu Kamer” which is located in the District of Coya, Calca Province, Department of Cusco. She is 23 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has one child.

Eneyda Solans has a business of raising guinea pigs. She fattens the animals and then sells them at different fairs. Eneyda works from 8:00 A.M. to 3:00 P.M. She has been in this business for five years and has done very well. Her dream is to expand her guinea pig business.

Eneyda Solans is requesting a loan in order to buy guinea pigs. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Ángel Mauricio

texts.es: Ángel, a sus 53 años de edad, es casado y padre de un hijo. Toda su vida productiva la ha dedicado a realizar las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su familia. Actualmente se dedica a criar cerdos y posee un cultivo de tomate, con esto ha logrado obtener dinero para llevar el sustento a su hogar. El cliente es un hombre activo, trabajador, pujante y se esfuerza día a día para salir adelante. Solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de cerdos para engorde (lechones) y el concentrado de los animales al por mayor, esto le permitirá aprovechar los descuentos por pago de contado y podrá continuar con el cuidado, cría y engorde de los cerdos para venderlos a mejor precio en la temporada de Diciembre, así podrá incrementar sus ingresos y avanzará un paso más hacia el cumplimento de sus principal meta, que es hacer de su negocio, una actividad rentable y sostenible en el tiempo, que le permita tener una estabilidad económica para darle a su hijo una mejor educación y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Ángel, at his 53 years of age, is married and the father of one son.  He has dedicated all of his productive life to farming thanks to the teachings of his family.  Now he is engaged in raising pigs and has a tomato crop.  With this he has managed to obtain money to provide the household expenses.  The client is an active man, a worker, is vigorous, and strives every day to get ahead.

He seeks this loan with the goal of investing it in the purchase of pigs to fatten (piglets) and their food and upkeep.  This will allow him to take advantage of discounts for cash payment, and to continue with the care, raising, and fattening of the pigs to sell them at a better price in the December season.  In this way he will be able to increase his revenue and advance one step closer toward reaching his primary goal, which is to make his business a profitable and sustainable activity over time.  This will allow him to have the economic stability to give his son a better education and improve the quality of life of his whole family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to fatten (piglets), their food and upkeep.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu appreciates the loan services she has received from Kiva and Yehu that have enabled her to add more stock of fish to her retail business, which enabled her to to earn more profits to take care of her family. In addition she sells lessos (women's wrap clothes) and charcoal.

She is requesting a loan of 45,000 KES to buy five sacks of charcoal and thirty pieces of lessos for her business. This will help her boost her business and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of charcoal and thirty pieces of lessos (women's wrap clothes) for her business.

loans.name: Nabweru Development Group

texts.en:
Patrick is 28 years old. He is a member of Nabweru Nansana Development group. He is single, however he has a lot of responsibilities taking care of his siblings and the children of his late brother, who passed away three years ago.

At the tender age of 16, Patrick started his business of brick laying in order to earn income to be able to pay his own school fees. Due to insufficient funds, Patrick did not go far in his studies; however, he never lost hope but continued to work hard to see to it that his siblings and dependents succeed in their education.

Patrick wants a loan to boost his bricklaying business so as to be able to continue paying school fees for his dependents, and also to cater to life’s basic needs. He is grateful that he has somewhere to turn for financial assistance when the going gets tough. Thank you, Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To supply his bricklaying business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for cooking oil, water, sodas and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Rocina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal APU KCAMER, el banco se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Huarqui en el distrito de Coya, provincia de Calca, departamento de Cusco.

La socia Rocina tiene 32 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia vende chompas, polos, guantes, chalinas entre otros a sus clientes que le solicitan como turistas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como chompas entre otros.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Rocina is a member of the Communal Bank “Apu Kamer” which is located in the community of Huarqui in the District of Coya, Calca Province, Department of Cusco. She is 32 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has one child.

Rocina divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling handicrafts. She sells sweaters, pullovers, gloves, scarves, and other items that her customers offer to tourists. Rocina has been in this business for some time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. This enables her to move her family forward.

Rocina is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise, such as sweaters and other items. She is appreciative of the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and other merchandise.

loans.name: Tawa

texts.en:
Tawa is 23 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is unmarried, and her fiancée has his own business. They have two children, aged 7 and 3 months. The oldest one is attending school. 

Since 2006, Tawa has been selling soap, toothpaste, charcoal and other small things. She started selling for her mother and then started for herself. Sometimes the business is very slow and she has to go to her customers and try to sell.  About having her own business, she likes to contribute to keep her children in school. 

Tawa is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise (soap, toothpaste, coal, etc.) for her business. For the future, she would like to be an international business woman and wants to send her children to university. 

She would like to thank the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (soap, toothpaste, coal, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Garmei

texts.en:
Garmei is 30 years old, is married, and lives in Gbarnga. Gbarnga is located in the center of Liberia in Bong County. The majority of people are employed as farmers cultivating crops such as rice, palm oil, and cassava. 

She has run a table business for the past four years now from which she sells rice, oil, pepper, etc. She works at her business for 10 hours a day. She transports her goods to her business by taxi. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is less goods on her table. She went to school and stopped in 9th grade. She has a one-year-old child at home.  

With the proceeds from the loan she wants to buy more rice, oil, and pepper to resell. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She started her business with money from her mother. In the future, she wants to own a house. She is proud of her business because she gets money to cover her expenses.  

She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more rice, oil, and pepper to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 43 years old and lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County which is rich in natural resources. The living conditions there are much better than the capital city, and it is the second largest county in Liberia by population. 

Edith stopped her education at grade six. As is traditional, she is married. Her husband is a farmer, and they both have six children. She does not know their ages, she said, and none of her children are in school. 

By selling her husband farm products, she was able to establish her business. Since 2010, she has been running a shop where she sells rice and soup. She spends nine hours on her business. One of the problems she faces is a small income. 

Edith is requesting a loan to purchase more dry meat, fish, pepper, onions, rice, cassava and other ingredients for her business. Her plans are to one day own a house and build a modern restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase more dry meat, fish, pepper, onions, rice, cassava and other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Qnarik

texts.en:
Qnarik has a small and beautiful farm that she takes care of with love and care. She has two bulls, 4 cows, 8 heifers, 4 pigs, and 2 chickens. She also cultivates barley and potatoes and grows pear- and appletrees. Qnarik's two sons are now serving in the army and her husband helps her very much with the farming activities. They live in a small nice village, Hoghmik, in the Shirak region.

Qnarik completed higher education and has been working at a local school as a teacher for many years. Unfortunately, a teacher's salary is hardly enough for making ends meet, so for improving her farm and covering its costs, Qnarik has requested this loan. With the loan's help she will purchase forage for feeding the livestock and seeds for cultivation. 

Qnarik and her family hope very much that Kiva lenders will give her an opportunity to enrich both her farm and her family income.

loans.use: to buy forage for feeding the livestock as well as seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Ndugu Group

texts.en: Eve is a 40-year-old hardworking woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is selling cow ghee and rearing cattle, a business she started with a vision of supporting her family. She faces challenges of bad debts and inadequate capital, however, she has a vision of starting a ghee packing company and expanding her farm by buying more cattle. Eve is requesting a loan to buy cow ghee to sell. She is a member of the Ndugu group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy cow ghee to sell.

loans.name: Nason

texts.en:
Nason is a twenty-nine-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the retail business for five years, and also does farming as an additional income source. 

He started the business to help him in cases of emergencies, since he is the sole breadwinner. He hopes to buy a car in the future; however, debtors and thieves are his challenges. 

Nason intends to use the loan to buy soap, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: Rogelio, a sus 52 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Durante muchos años se dedicó a ser mensajero independiente, hacía favores, vueltas y mandados en el centro de la ciudad, con lo que obtuvo ingresos para su sustento diario y además pudo ahorrar para montar su propio negocio, una chaza donde vende mecato, confites, chocolatinas, gaseosas, agua, cigarrillos y minutos a celular. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de utensilios de trabajo (termos térmicos para bebidas calientes) y surtido (mecato, confitería, café, gaseosas) ya que quiere implementar la venta de tinto y café con leche, para aprovechar que sus clientes (transeúntes y empleados de empresas cercanas) le piden mucho este producto y así tendrá la posibilidad de incrementar las ventas y sus ingresos diarios. Rogelio sueña con ampliar su negocio, lograr que sea reconocido en el sector y perdurable en el tiempo, para tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y sus finanzas.
texts.en:
Rogelio is 52 years old, single and has no children. For many years he worked as an independent messenger doing favors, going around and running errands in the center of the ciy. In this way he earned an income for his daily sustenance. Additionally, he was able to save enough to arrange a business of his own, a food stall where he sells pastries, candies, chocolate bars, carbonated drinks, water, cigarettes and cell phone minutes.

At present, he requests a loan in order to invest in the purchase of work utensils like thermos containers for hot drinks and stock such as pastries, candies, coffee and carbonated drinks. This because he wants to start selling black coffee and coffee with milk to take advantage of the fact that his clients (pedestrians and employees of neaby businesses) have been asking a lot for these products. He hopes to increase his daily sales and profits in this way.

Rogelio dreams of expanding his business, making it long lasting and recognized in this niche. He hopes he will have the opportunity to improve his quality of life and finances.

loans.use: to purchase utensils for work like thermos containers for hot drinks and stock such as pastries, candies, coffee and carbonated drinks

loans.name: Chuimekena Group

texts.en:
Chuisuc is a rural community located in the busy town of Totonicapan Guatemala. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, Chuimekena, is located here and consists of eight women who are involved in various businesses including fruit sales, firewood sales, weaving and animal husbandry.

Maria, a 48-year-old widowed mother of three, did not attend school due to the precarious situation of her family. She is proud to be supporting her children, one of whom will finish middle high this year. Maria sells fruit both at the wholesale and retail level in two different markets: the southern coast of Guatemala and the western area where she lives. Maria transports the products from her region to sell on the southern coast and then returns to sell in her area. She also creates a small amount of the beautiful traditional textiles of Totonicopan.

It has taken a few years for Maria to create this business and she is noticing that she is acquiring additional customers. Because of this expanded demand, Maria has decided to secure a loan from Friendship Bridge so she can purchase more seasonal produce such as apples, bananas, cantaloupe, papaya, peaches and pineapple.

Maria enjoys the monthly training which is a valuable component of the Friendship Bridge program. The ladies discuss topics like women's health, children's rights, business administration and financial administration (over-indebtedness, savings) and self-esteem.

The Trust Bank, Chuimekena, is very appreciative of Kiva investors, and the members send their greetings to all who are supporting them with these micro-loans for their business endeavors. With more education, support and empowerment, they face a brighter future for themselves, their families and their communities!

loans.use: To purchase more seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Celestial Group

texts.en:
Kiva partners with Friendship Bridge in Guatemala to offer microloans and a little education to impoverished women so that with their own efforts, the women can lift themselves, their families, and communities out of poverty. The ladies are organized into Trust Banks and meet with a Trust Bank Loan Officer from Friendship Bridge once a month. It is a win-win situation and there are numerous success stories.

One year ago, the Celestial Trust Bank, located in Pasach First Village in Cantel Quetzaltenango, received its first loan, funded by Kiva investors. The loans were of great value to the nine members and their businesses benefitted. Currently, the women are applying for an additional loan and are requesting the support of Kiva investors throughout the world who can help them with this request. The Trust Bank has grown to 14 members whose average age is 32 years. The women are engaged in various types of businesses including retail sales (items for daily consumption, bakery items, livestock, and meat) as well as embroidery and textile production.

Cristina is a 25-year-old married woman who is a new member of the Trust Bank. She has two young children and one is already attending primary school. Her other child is still too young. Cristina’s husband is a hard-working mason who lacks work at the present time. Cristina began her business of selling pork one year ago. The business is doing quite well, but she would like to expand. She joined the Celestial Trust Bank in order to secure a loan with Friendship Bridge which she will use to purchase four pigs to meet current demand. As the construction business is quite slow in the current economic climate in Guatemala, Christina holds the vision that her business will grow and she will become the main breadwinner of the family.

The Celestrial Trust Bank expresses gratitude to all Kiva investors. They are so pleased to be able to secure these loans, expand their businesses, and provide additional income for their families. They value the supportive relationships that they have with their fellow Trust Bank members. They all look forward to a brighter future, one in which they have the necessary tools for success!

loans.use: to purchase pigs for her pork selling business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a t-shirt printing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy materials for her t-shirt printing business.

Nancy has been in this business for 22 years. Nancy earns additional income from rice retailing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her t-shirt printing business.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира, 31 год, замужем, имеет 3 детей. С 2005 года стала заниматься животноводством. Бизнес начала с 6,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Гулмира достигла небольших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 6,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Гулмиры имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 15 овец, 1 лошадь. По хозяйству помогают супруг и дети. Супруг также работает чабаном в селе. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулмира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Гулмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве.
texts.en: Gulmira is 31 years old, married, and has three children. She has been practicing animal husbandry since 2005. The business began with 6,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her incredibly hard and productive work Gulmira has achieved some successes in development of her business. She now earns a monthly profit of 6,000 som (KGS), and today owns three dairy cows, 15 sheep, and a horse. Her husband and children help with the business. Her husband also works as a shepherd. In order to further develop her business, Gulmira came to the microfinance group Bai Tushum and Partners for a 20,000 som (KGS) loan to buy sheep. She plans to use the profit from use of the loan to invest into further expanding her livestock herd.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Melchorita

texts.en:
Melchorita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy dried fish for her business.

Melchorita has been in this business for 3 years. Melchorita earns additional income from raising pigs.

Melchorita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 43 years old and lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions there are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second largest county in population in Liberia. 

Martha completed 12 grades, and she has three children between 22 and 7 years old; only two are presently attending school and live at home.
