Over the past seven years, Martha has been selling rice, oil, peppers, etc. in the local market. She started her business by selling for her mother. She spends 10 hours on her business, One problem she faces is small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, peppers, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build a modern restaurant in the near future. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, peppers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Myroslava

texts.en: Myroslava is a small business owner. She sells curtains at the central market in Vinogradovo, Ukraine. Myroslava has been in this business long enough to gain repeat clients. Large variety and high quality allow Myroslava to have good sales and make money to support her family. This business is the only source of income for Myroslava and her family. She is requesting a loan of 24,000 UAH to purchase more inventory. She hopes to have good sales and make additional income during the coming fall season.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory and make better sales.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en: Claire is a thirty-six-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the restaurant business for six years and also deals in charcoal for additional income. She started the business to support her family and her dream is to educate her children to university level, however, high competition and limited capital are her challenges. Claire is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 42 years old and lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions there are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second-largest populated county in Liberia. 

Fortunately, Rose completed 12th grade before joining a business, and she is good at managing her business. She is married, and her husband is a driver. They both have seven children between the ages of 26 and 2, only three of whom are presently attending school and live at home.

She started her business with a little money from her husband, and she managed the money to establish her business. For seven years now, she has been running this table business where she sells oil and rice in the local market. She spends 9 hours a day on her business. A problem she faces is a small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil and rice for her business. 

Her dream is to one day open a shop and see her children out of high school.

loans.use: to purchase more oil and rice for her business.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Pilar works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Pilar is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her buy and sell fish business.

Pilar has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emelda is 39 years old and has three children who are in school.

Emelda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Emelda requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Emelda has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Emelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa works hard to support her family. Ma. Luisa is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Ma. Luisa requested a PHP 22500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, etc. for her business.

Ma. Luisa has been in this business for 21 years.

Ma. Luisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, etc. for her business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes works hard to support her family. Mercedes is married and has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Mercedes requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more ready to wear items to sell.

Mercedes has been in this business for 15 years.

Mercedes would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more ready to wear items to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 45 years old and lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in nature resources. The living condition is much better than the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second largest populated county in Liberia. She described herself as a hard-working woman. She completed 9th grade, and traditionally she is married, but her husband is a not working for now. They have four children between 18 to 12. She said all four of her children are in school, and they all live at home. 

With a little money from her older sister, she was able to established her table business where she sells rubber dishes such as plates, bowls, cups, etc. in the local market. She spends 10 hours per day at her business, from Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is fewer goods on her table. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes such as plates, bowls, cups, etc for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes such as plates, bowls, cups, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Lila Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, Lila, is located in a neighborhood of the second largest city in Guatemala called Quetzaltenango, in the western highlands. The Trust Bank is composed of eight women who average 43 years of age. Each has an average of four children. These women work in various businesses like animal husbandry, production and sales of tiles, manufacture and sale of shoes, as well as textile sales.

One of the members is Cecilia, better known as Doña Ceci, who is a cheerful, enthusiastic and collaborative lady who is the secretary for the Lila Trust Bank. She enjoys this job very much. She has taken out several loans with Friendship Bridge.

 Doña Ceci is a 46-year-old married woman with ten children who range in age from 5 to 27. Five of the children are in school. Doña Ceci is committed to seeing each of them complete their education and start their careers. With this goal in mind, she created a business from her first loan with Friendship Bridge and began raising animals such as chickens and ducks. 

Currently, Doña Ceci wants to add more animals to her business, so she is requesting a loan to purchase six turkeys, several chickens and two pigs. In addition, she has budgeted some funds from her loan to buy food for the animals in order to fatten them for market. Doña Ceci’s dream is to enlarge her business and have as many animals as possible. She is aware that some take a longer time to fatten and sell. In the future, she hopes to sell eggs as well.

The earnings that Doña Ceci has generated have allowed her to move forward, and she feels empowered! In her own words: “My group and I appreciate the financial support through Friendship Bridge. It is incredible to know that people from around the world (Kiva investors) are helping us through the Internet.” She giggles about the Internet and adds, “I'm not sure how that works.” She adds, “God bless them and all their generosity because it really is so important to us to have this opportunity.”

loans.use: to purchase turkeys, pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marlene works hard to support her family.

She has a ambulant vending spices business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Marlene is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy additional spices to sell via her ambulant vending spices business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her ambulant vending of vegetables.

Marlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spices to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan's income depends entirely on what he produces on his farm. As a result, he's always looking for ways to reduce costs in order to take home more. With his 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, he will be able to reduce his energy and fertilizer costs using the renewable methane-rich biogas and potent biofertilizer generated by his system to offset expensive LP gas and petroleum-based agrochemical fertilizers. This loan represents 52% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 52 years old and married with four children.

Corazon works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, can goods, noodles, etc.

Corazon has borrowed and paid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from farming and selling vegetables.

Corazon aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, can goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Pablita is 49 years old and one of her children is in school.

Pablita has a raising livestock business in the Philippines. Pablita requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Pablita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Pablita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell at her general store like canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, sugar, soap and other groceries.

Emelita has been in this business for four years. Emelita earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Emelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, sugar, soap and other groceries

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa is 35 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Maria Theresa is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy insecticides, pesticides and other farm supplies for her business.

Maria Theresa has been farming rice for three years, and she earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, pesticides and other farm supplies for her business

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 25 years old and married with three children, one of whom in school.

Christine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Christine has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 5 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Christine aspires to save enough money so she could send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 48 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalinda has been pig fattening for 8 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Khairulo

texts.ru: Хайруло житель района Вахш. Ему 42 года. Он женат и имеет одну дочь и сына. Его жена домохозяйка, дочь учится в школе, а сын уже окончил школу. Хайрулло обеспечивает свою семью за счет услуги такси. Он занимается этой деятельность уже 11 лет и работает в маршрутной линии своего района. Сына Хайрулло зовут Иброхим. Он недавно окончил школу и теперь готовится поступить в Университет. Он уже выбрал себе специализацию. Иброхим очень интересуется технологией и хочет учиться в этой сфере. Отец, чтобы помочь сыну обратился за кредитом. За счет суммы кредита Хайруло хочет оплатить контракт за учебу сына в Государственном Университете города Кургантюбе в факультете Технологии. Он верит, что из его сына выйдет хороший специалист и с нетерпением ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Khairulo lives in the Vakhsh district. He is 42 years old, married, and has a son and a daughter. His wife is a homemaker, his daughter is in school, and his son has already finished high school. Khairulo supports his family by providing taxi services. He has been working in that arena for 11 years already, and drives a route in the district he lives in. Khairulo's son is Ibrohim. He recently finished school and is preparing to apply to university. He has chosen his major already. Ibrohim is very interested in technology and wants to study in that area. His father is requesting a loan in order to help him. Khairulo wants to use the loan to pay his son's tuition for the technology department at the state university in Kurgantyube. He believes that his son will make an excellent professional, and looks forward to your support!

loans.use: To pay his son's university tuition

loans.name: Lidia Lizeth

texts.es: La Sra. Lidia  sigue con la misma actividad de la elaboración y Venta de pan, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de insumos como harina y azúcar para la elaboración de pan,    en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de harina por quintales ya que se incrementaron sus pedidos  y también que esta época se incrementa el precio de la harina, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Lidia continues to make and sell bread and says that things went well with her previous loan, which she used to buy ingredients such as flour and sugar.  Today she is asking for a loan to buy flour in bulk, as the price of flour has gone up.  She is happy and grateful for the opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 58 years old and married with one child.

Evelyn earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase a new variety of rice seed and to pay for the laborer's salary in land preparation.

Evelyn has been farming rice for nine years. She earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of rice seed and to pay for the laborer's salary in land preparation

loans.name: Noneta

texts.en:
Noneta is 33 years old and married with one child.

Noneta earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Noneta has been raising pigs for two years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda is 36 years old and married with three children.

Chanda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like snack foods, juice, sugar, soap, shampoo, etc.

Chanda has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from a buy and sell charcoal business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and buy and sell charcoal businesses.

Chanda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like snack foods, juice, sugar, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela operates a fishing business. She earns an additional income from raising pigs. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and works hard to support her family. She and her husband have two children.  

Shiela has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fishing business. She hopes to receive a loan in the amount of PhP 18,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy fishing net and other materials for her fishing business.

She is confident that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other materials for her business

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell.

Socorro has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Socorro has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

Victoria is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more household goods to sell in her general store like snack foods, breads, coffee, milk, sugar, soap and other groceries.

Victoria has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income selling dried fish and farming vegetables.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure her future.

loans.use: to purchase more household goods to sell like snack foods, breads, coffee, milk, sugar, soap and other groceries

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Teresa works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Teresa is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy a new variety of rice to plant and to pay for the laborers' salaries for land preparation for her business farming rice.

Teresa has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses farming rice and raising pigs.

Teresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of rice to plant and to pay for the laborers' salaries for land preparation

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 55 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rowena is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer, insecticides and other farm supplies.

Rowena has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
Ana, se le  presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo prestamo, el cual le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos; esta inversion le permitirá comprar mercadería necesaria para la elaboración de comida, tales como: maíz, pollo, carnes, verduras, sodas, jugos, entre otros; esta inversión le será de mucha ayuda para mejorar sus ventas y por ende sus ganancias se optimizaran.
Su sueño principalmente es ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia  y optimizar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana needs a new loan, which will help her improve her income.  This investment will allow her to buy ingredients, such as corn, chicken, meats, vegetables, sodas, juices, and other things that she needs to make food.  This investment will be of great help to improve her sales and also optimizing her income.

Her main goal is to provide her family with a better quality of live and optimize her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Lorpu

texts.en:
Lorpu is a 40 year old business woman from Liberia. She is unmarried and has three children aged between six and twelve. All of her children are currently attending school and they all live at home.  She completed the 9th grade of schooling before starting her business. Lorpu describes herself as hard working.

She lives and works in Gbarnga, the capital of Bong County. Bong is located in the centre of the country and it is an agricultural hub.  The majority of residents are farmers growing rice, palm oil and cassava.

Lorpu has a business selling oil, pepper, onion, Vita, salt and other products. She started her business with money from her fiancé and has been doing it for the past five years. She works from 7am to 5pm every day, and her greatest challenge is the rainy season. She intends to use the loan to buy more oil, pepper, onion, Vita, salt and other products for her business.

Lorpu likes her business because it gives her money for personal use. She hopes to one day own a house. She would like to thank Kiva lenders in advance for helping.

loans.use: to buy more oil, pepper, onion, Vita, salt and other products for her business.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel was inspired by a chiropractor during his high school years when he was a student athlete. He ended up at the chiropractor’s office after suffering from a neck injury while playing football, attempting to tackle his opponent head-on which caused a mild sprain or strain injury. After  the visit, Manuel decided that he wanted to become a chiropractor  to work with athletes.

Manuel went to Ball State University where he was a scholarship student athlete who participated in two sports. He started as a true freshmen on the football team as a wide receiver and also competed in Track & Field. During his career at Ball State, he won the Mid American Conference Championship and played in the Las Vegas Bowl. He graduated from Ball State with a degree in Exercise Science & Wellness. He then attended New York Chiropractic College where he obtained a doctorate in chiropractic.

In late 2010 he moved from New York to Virginia, decided to establish his own practice. On January 2011 he opened "DBA Capitol Rehab of Annandale". Manuel is requesting $10,000 to support his business expansion towards the Hispanic market. Loan proceeds will be invested in advertising (Spanish media), developing a website in Spanish, preparing printed material in Spanish and hiring a part-time person to do community outreach. To know more about his practice, please visit www.capitolrehabofAnnandale.com.

loans.use: to invest in advertising (Spanish media), developing a website in Spanish, preparing printed material in Spanish and hiring a part-time person to do community outreach.

loans.name: Jorge Alfredo

texts.es: Jorge, tiene 38 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive con su esposa en el municipio de Tela. El tiene 1 año y 8 meses de tener su propio taller de mecánica automotriz y el especializado en pintura y enderezamiento de algún objeto como carrocerías, tono, y otros. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 5,000 Lempiras y lo va a utilizar en la compra de materiales como ser electrodo, lijas, y bases, también para mejorar su taller de mecánica en mejorar la galera y el piso. Su objetivo es llegar a tener su casa, mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y ofrecer más servicios en el negocio.
texts.en: Jorge is 38 years old, has two children, and lives with his wife in the town of Tela.  He has had his own automotive repair shop for a year and eight months and specializes in paint and body work.  He will use the 5,000 Lempiras from this loan to buy supplies such as electrodes, sandpaper, bases, and to make improvements to his workshop showroom and floor.  His goal is to have a home, improve his and his family’s quality of life, and offer more services in his business.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to upgrade his electrical wiring.

loans.name: Yevgeniya

texts.ru:
Евгения постоянно пользуется кредитами KIVA. Предыдущий кредит помог ей расширить ассортимент товара. Она пополнила его электротоварами, и соответственно стало больше покупателей. 

В этот раз Евгения просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 21000 гривен на закупку канцтоваров к первому сентября. На этот товар всегда есть спрос перед началом учебного года. 

Евгения хочет  помимо торговли развивать альтернативное направление в бизнесе - сельское хозяйство.  На приусадебном участке они вместе с мужем построили большую теплицу и начали занимаются выращиванием помидор. Евгения хочет увеличить доход семьи, т.к. в данный момент два ее сына учатся в колледже и Евгения помогает им с оплатой учебы.
texts.en:
Yevgeniya constantly uses loans from Kiva. The previous loan helped her expand her business's inventory. She added electronic goods, and has definitely attracted more customers. 

This time Yevgeniya is asking for a 21,000 hryvnia loan to buy school supplies prior to the first day of school. There is always demand for these goods before the start of the school year. 

Yevgeniya would like to concurrently expand into business in a different area - agriculture. She and her husband are building a greenhouse on their property and are beginning to grow tomatoes. Yevgeniya wants to increase the family's income, since she has two sons in college right now and she is helping pay their tuition.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies for school sales

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en:
Myagmarsuren, age 58 and widowed, lives alone in an apartment in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her children are all grown and married, living with their own families. She is a welcoming and friendly woman who makes friends easily with other people. 

Myagmarsuren used to work at state-owned companies, but she eventually started her own organic dairy products retail business in 2000. She produces organic dairy products and also purchases additional dairy products from herders in the countryside. She sells these to her many regular customers at the local market. 

She has a good previous loan record at XacBank and is one of their highly reliable clients. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 MNT in order to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products to sell to her customers at market. 

Myagmarsuren intends to expand her business further in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase a  large amount of organic dairy products to sell to her local customers at market

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 23 years old and he lives in Sevan city. He is not married and he lives with his parents and retired grandfather; his sister is already married and she lives separately with her family. Armen’s father works as a driver; his mother is a saleswoman at a shop. Armen himself simultaneously works and studies. He is taking a correspondence course at the Crisis Management Academy and he will become rescuer. At the same time he works at a taxi service as a driver. 

Armen has taken out a loan from Nor Horizon already three times and he has never had any delays in repayment. This time he has decided to cooperate with Kiva and he asks for a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a car of his own which he will use for his family’s needs and also  as a taxi and thus he will work independently from the taxi service and earn more money for his family.

loans.use: to buy a car of his own which he will use for his family’s needs and as a taxi

loans.name: Jaina

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, two of whom in school, Jaina works hard to support her family.

Jaina has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She also earns income from selling fruits. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell.

Jaina has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Trinidad works hard to support her family.

Trinidad has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell.

Trinidad has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 49 years old and married with five children, two of whom in school.

Sylvia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional charcoal to sell.

Sylvia has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 3 years and also earns an income from a general store.

Sylvia aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Merlyn has been in this business for nine years. She earns more income from buying and selling charcoal and a general store.

Merlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, requiere de un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para surtir su negocio; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar un camionada de leña y concentrado para gallinas.
El crédito anterior fue favorable, ya que logro aumentar sus ventas y con ello los ingresos, pagar la deuda y aportar en los gastos del hogar. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado, se siente una persona útil en la familia con 65 años de edad, gracias al apoyo que se le brinda con los préstamos.
texts.en:
Maria needs a new loan because she needs more working capital to supply her business.  This investment will help her buy a truckload of firewood and chicken feed.

The previous loan went well for her because she was able to increase her sales and pay off the debt and cover her household expenses with her profits.  Her financial conditions and family circumstances have improved and, at age 65, she feels useful in the family, thanks to help from her loans.

loans.use: to buy firewood and chicken feed.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra,  es madre de familia y vive con sus cuatro hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 10, 12, 15 y 17 años, todos le ayudan con el negocio. Ella, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas, oficio que lo aprendió por si sola y lo desempeña desde hace 15 años, gracias a esta actividad ha logrado salir adelante; ventaja que posee es que su puesto lo tiene frente a la parada de buses y por ello sus ventas son mayores.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar diversidad de mercadería, tales como: maíz, frijoles, sal, quesillo, loroco, chicharrón, condimentos, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara al fortalecimiento del negocio y obtener mayores ganancias para su hogar.
Su sueño es tener un negocio más estable y apoyar  a sus hijos hasta el final para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Sandra is a mother and lives with her four children, ages 10, 12, 15, and 17, all whom help her with her business.  She makes and sells pupusas, a skill she learned on her own and has been doing for 15 years.  Thanks to this, she has been able to get ahead.  She has the advantage of having her stall in front of a bus stop, so her sales are better.

The loan she is requesting will allow her to buy different ingredients, such as corn, beans, salt, cheese, loroco, pork rinds, condiments, and other things.  This investment will help her strengthen her business and increase her household income.

Her dream is to have a more stable business and to support her children to so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos,  necesita de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su tienda, por lo que requiere de un préstamo que le ayude al fortalecimiento de esta; la inversión le permitirá comprar  granos básicos, tales como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, asimismo verduras y frutas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo en gran manera a mejorar las ganancias y logro crecer en su negocio, también brindo satisfacción a los clientes. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Carlos needs more working capital so that he can continue investing in his store to help strengthen it.  This investment will allow him to buy basic grains such as rice, beans, sugar, salt, fruits, and vegetables.

The previous loan helped him to improve his profit and he was able to grow his business and satisfy his customers.  His financial situation and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has been in business since 2010 in El Paso, Texas, offering residents the highest quality in motorcycle repairs.  Daniel and his team at Lektrik MX Shop are the best suspension technicians, trained and endorsed by Race Tech, the number one suspension shop and developers of the world famous Race Tech Gold valves.  

Lektrik specializes in custom modifications and repairs for Motocross, Supercross, Enduro, road and street bikes.  Daniel’s number one priority in business is his customers.  He aims to give each customer the best service and complete satisfaction.  

The shop also carries apparel, motorcycle parts, lubricants, and aftermarket parts for all kinds of riding bikes.  

Daniel visited El Paso’s Small Business Administration to inquire about available programs or services to help him obtain a loan for his business.  He was referred to Accion Texas Inc. and applied for a microloan.  Once approved, he used his Accion loan to purchase additional mechanical parts and inventory for his store and pay for the upgrade of his website.  

To learn more about how his services can help you, visit his website: http://www.lektrikshop.com/.

loans.use: to purchase additional mechanical parts and inventory for his store and pay for an upgrade of his website.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр женат. У него двое взрослых детей.  Александр работает трактористом на заводе.

Александр в месте со своей семьей живет в трехкомнатном доме.  Он трудолюбивый, простой и открытый человек. Александр хочет сделать лучшие условия проживания для своих родных.

Александр просит предоставить кредит в сумме 10000 гривен. Он хочет заменить старые деревянные окна в доме на современные, чтобы улучшить теплоизоляцию.
texts.en: Alexander is married and has two grown children. He works as a tractor operator at a factory. He lives with his family in a three bedroom home. He is a hardworking, simple, and open man, and would like to provide his family with better living conditions. Alexander is asking for a 10,000 hryvnia loan. He wants to replace the house's old wood window frames with modern ones to improve insulation.

loans.use: to put new  windows in his house

loans.name: Aybaniz

texts.en:
Aybaniz  is  46  years old, a married woman. She   is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband   in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a Jabrayili refugee.

 Aybaniz   has been raising cattle for the past 16 years. Taking care of animals requires continuous effort, but her husband helps her to raise the cattle, and she also sells cheese, yogurt, butter and milk at the market. This is the only source of income for the family. From this business her monthly profit is 150 Azn. She plans to expand the business in order to bring more funds into the family. 

She has applied for a loan of   2000 AZN from Aqroinvest in order to buy more calves. She has plans of expanding the business to meet the high potential for milk in the market. This is her third   credit. She has a good loan history. Aybeniz   appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more calves

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en:
Teymur  is a 30-year-old man who has been engaged in cattle breeding and milk product sales for the last five years. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and two children in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. His wife helps him to look after cattle, and she makes homemade yogurt. Teymur`s profit from the business is 230 AZN. 

Milk is a very popular drink among local people. They prepare different products from it, such as yogurt and cheese. Dairy products are in high demand because of their health benefits. Regardless of difficulties in raising cattle, Teymur is a very positive man and is doing this business by heart. 

Teymur has applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN from Aqroinvest in order to buy more calves. He has plans of expanding the business to meet the high potential of milk in the market. This is his third extension of credit. He has a good loan history. Teymur appreciates your support .

loans.use: to buy more calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables to offer for sale, such as string beans, squash, tomatoes, radishes, carrots, and garlic

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a hard-working entrepreneur who raises pigs to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for the past seven years. She earns an additional income by running a general store. 

Riza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans she has received from NWTF. She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her pig raising and general store businesses. She is currently requesting PhP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.
 
She dreams of saving enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mamikon

texts.en:
Mamikon lives in Sevan city in Gegharkunik region. He is married and has a son. His son is a weightlifter and a European Championship silver medalist. Mamikon and his wife are very proud of their son, and how could they not be since he is such a strong, masculine, kind and modest person? Mamikon’s wife does not work, but she takes care of her family and their house. 

Mamikon has the qualification of a hairdresser. For ten years he has run his business, a beauty salon of his own. He has a lot of loyal customers and his salon is very famous in their city with its high quality service and low prices.

Mamikon asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams (AMD) because he wants to change the water supply system and make improvements to the interior of his salon.

loans.use: to change the water supply system and make  improvements to the interior of his salon

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена – предприниматель из Мелитополя. Она торгует на одном из крупных местных рынков детской одеждой и обувью. Ее торговое место – собственное. Опыт работы – 14 лет. 
Елена обратилась к КИВА за суммой в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить товар к осеннему сезону, а именно приобрести оптом платья, кофты, головные уборы и обувь, чтобы пополнить ассортимент и расширить торговлю.
texts.en: Yelena is a business woman from Melitopol. She sells children's clothing and footwear at one of the largest local markets. She owns her market stall and has 14 years of experience in this business. Yelena has come to Kiva for a 15,000 hryvnia loan to buy goods for the fall season, and in particular to buy dresses, sweaters, headwear, and shoes wholesale to fill out her inventory and increase sales.

loans.use: to purchase dresses, sweaters, headwear  and footwear

loans.name: Vuqar

texts.en:
Vuqar is 40 years old, married and the father of two daughters. Vuqar is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and daughters in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Jabrayili refugee. 

Vuqar has been engaged in the cattle breeding business and milk sales. He has more than 13 years of experience in this field. His wife actively helps him run the business. His monthly income is 250 AZN. 

Vuqar is successful because the product he sells is very popular and in high demand. People in Azerbaijan use milk and meat in everyday cuisine. He would like to expand his business, and for this purpose he has applied for a 1800 AZN loan. He will use the loan to purchase two milking cows and one calf.

loans.use: to purchase two milking cows and one calf

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en:
Bahar is a 55-year-old woman who has been involved in farming and raising cattle for the past 12 years. Bahar is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and two daughters in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. 

Bahar buys animals (calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She has a good approach towards business expansion and saving for the future. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income, but she needs to improve her business to meet the needs of her children.

For the improvement of her business, Bahar applied for a loan of 1,800 AZN to purchase more cows. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and increase her income level. She has a good loan history, and this is her fourth loan.

loans.use: to purchase more cows

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a 53-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two grown children. She engages in retail business. She buys and at the same time makes native hats made of buli (palm). She has been making hats for more than five years.

Due to lack of capital to continue her livelihood, Adelaida requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more materials like buli (palm) and to buy more hats to cater the needs of the customers. 

In the future, Adelaida hopes to improve her hat making business so that she can pay her weekly dues and set aside savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy more materials like buli (palm) and to buy more hats

loans.name: Lowella

texts.en:
Lowella runs a restaurant business to earn a living, She earns an additional income from selling pre-paid mobile phone minutes. Lowella has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and works hard to support her family. She and her husband have six children.
 
Lowella is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 18,000 through NWTF in order to purchase such items as meat, vegetables, spices, and shrimp for her restaurant business.
 
She is confident that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase such items as meat, vegetables, spices, and shrimp for her restaurant business

loans.name: Fatimata

texts.en:
Please meet 37-year-old Fatimata from Gbarnga in Liberia. Gbarnga is located in the centre of Liberia in Bong County. The majority of people are employed as farmers cultivating crops such as rice, palm oil and cassava.  

Fatimata completed 7 grades and is married.  Her husband is selling foodstuffs.  She has six children between the ages of 18 and 4.  The two oldest ones are in school and they all live at home. 

Fatimata has a table business selling rice and cassava.  She has been in business for three years and works from Monday to Saturday 10 hours each day.  With this loan, she will buy rice and cassava.  One of the greatest challenges that she faces is small capital.  She transports her goods by taxi.  She started her business with money from her savings.  She is proud of her business because she makes a profit. Her plan is to own a house.  She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy rice and cassava.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда живет и работает в Мелитополе. Она не замужем. Надежда торгует на местном рынке хозтоварами и посудой. Торговое место уже успела выкупить, опыт работы составляет 17 лет.
Надежда планирует закупить партию товара по договору с поставщиками на сумму в 21 000 гривен. За счет приобретенного товара она надеется развивать свой бизнес и улучшать быт.
texts.en: Nadezhda works and lives in Melitopol. She is not married. Nadezhda sells household goods and dishes at a local market. She has already been able to purchase her market stall, and she has 17 years of experience. Nadezhda plans to buy goods through an agreement with a wholesale dealer for 21,000 hryvnia. She hopes the new merchandise will allow her business to expand and improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise wholesale

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun, age 32, buys and sells vegetables to earn an income. She lives with her husband and their three children about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, across the Mekong River. Yun's husband works as a construction worker and also earns an income as a fisherman. They help each other to support the family.
 
Yun is requesting a loan in order to buy a boat and fishing material for her husband's fishing business.

loans.use: to buy a boat and fishing materials for her husband's fishing business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 35 years old and married with four children.

Teresita earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

Teresita has been fattening pigs for two years and earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

Grace is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Grace has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to  send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle business

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир – из Хуста. Он занимается продажей овощей и фруктов уже 13 лет. Владимир покупает овощи на оптовом рынке и потом развозит их по маленьким магазинчикам. Более того, он сам торгует из дома, а также на рынке, в спальном районе города. Для работы в этой части города он арендует склад для товара. Основной ходовой товар у Владимира – это картошка и капуста, особенно перед наступлением осенне-зимнего сезона.  
Сумму в 21 000 гривен Владимир планирует вложить в закупку товара на заготовку для консервирования, а также для того, чтобы приобрести арбузы на реализацию. Часть полученной прибыли надеется вложить в перестройку дома, чтобы расширить жилплощадь для семьи сына, когда тот женится.
texts.en:
Vladimir is from Khoost. He has been selling fruits and vegetables for 13 years. Vladimir buys produce on the wholesale market and then transports it to small stores. In addition, he sells from his home, and also at the market in a residential neighborhood. He rents a storage facility in that part of the city.  
Vladimir's primary sales are of potatoes and cabbage, especially just before the onset of winter. He is planning to invest 21,000 hryvnia in buying produce for food preservation and also watermelons to sell. He hopes to invest part of the income earned into rebuilding his house to expand the living space for his son's family when the son marries.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and watermelons

loans.name: Badamsereejid

texts.en:
Badamsereejid, age 47, and his wife Altantsetseg run a small organic farm business to earn a living. They live with their four sons in a "ger" (a traditional Mongolian family tent dwelling) in the Uvs province. They are known as hard-working and diligent people.

The two eldest sons are also involved in the family business. They are currently helping their father to build a wooden fence for the plot of land where they plant their organic vegetables so that their neighbors' cows or other animals cannot invade the area and ruin their crops. 

The two younger sons attend local schools. 

Badamsereejid has been operating his organic vegetable business since 2008. He has built up a good deal of experience and has gained many regular customers over the years. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 MNT in order to purchase materials to finish fencing the plot of land where he plants his organic vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase materials to finish fencing the plot of land where he plants his organic vegetables

loans.name: Yusupjon

texts.ru: Юсупчон житель района Дж.Руми. Ему 46 лет. Он женат и является многодетным отцом. У него восемь детей. Так как дети растут, расходы его семьи тоже увеличиваются. Сейчас в их семье единственным источником дохода являются те деньги, которые высылает ему старший сын, находящийся на заработках за пределами страны. Однако эти деньги не покрывают семейные расходы. Юсупчон решил заняться прибыльным семейным бизнесом и выбрал животноводство. Он намерен заняться куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Ему будут помогать жена и дети. Юсупчон знает как выращивать скот, так как в их хозяйстве имеется одна корова для нужд семьи. Стартовый капитал Юсупчона составляет 125 долларов США, а также при дворе его дома имеется коровник размером 10x4 метра и 100 вязок сена. С целью начать бизнес, Юсупчон запрашивает кредит для закупа 4-х голов бычков и корма. С полученной прибыли Юсупчон хочет провести свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Yusupjon lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 46 years old, married and has eight children. As the children grow, so do the family's expenses. Right now the family's only source of income is what the oldest son sends home from his work abroad. Those funds don't cover the family's expenses though. Yusupjon decided to start an income generating family business, and he chose animal husbandry. He intends to buy and sell cattle. His wife and children will help. Yusupjon knows how to raise livestock because they already have a family milk cow. Yusupjon's starting capital will be 125 USD, and they also have a 10x4 meter shed in the yard and 100 bundles of hay. With the goal of beginning the business, Yusupjon is asking for a loan to buy 4 bull calves and their feed. He wants to use the income earned to pay for his son's wedding.

loans.use: To buy four calves and feed to start a business, and with the income earned pay for his son's wedding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of items to sell in her store, such as condiments, baked breads, noodles, eggs, and canned goods

loans.name: Bibihanifa

texts.ru: Земледелие является основным видом бизнеса в Таджикистане. Многие люди в примере  Бибиханифы занимаются земледелием и получают доход для проживания. Бибиханифа занимается выращиванием сельхоз продукции как зерновые культуры, но основной  ее работой является педагогическая деятельность.   Более 17  лет она работает в школе. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Детям  13, 15 и 17 лет и они еще не имеют источника дохода. Она является основной кормилицей в семье, так как ее муж трудовой мигрант. Бибиханифа живет бедно в старом и маленьком домике. В течение многих лет она не может сделать ремонт. Кроме того, скоро начнется новый учебный год школы. Бибиханифа должна купить школьные формы и школьные принадлежности своим детям. Однако она не имеет денег. Бибиханифа запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов для покупки школьных форм для 3 детей и школьные принадлежности, как сумка, тетрадь, книги и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Agriculture is the primary form of business in Tajikistan. Many people, including Bibihanifa farm to support themselves. Bibihanifa grows products such as grains, but she is also a teacher. She has worked in the school for oer 17 years. She is married and has three children who are 13, 15, and 17, and do not yet earn income. She is the family's sole provider, since her husband is a migrant worker. Bibihanifa lives in poor conditions in a small, old house. She has not done any remodeling for many years. In addition, the new school year is beginning soon. Bibihanifa need to buy uniforms and school supplies for her children, but she doesn't have the money. Bibihanifa is asking for a $1500 loan to buy school uniforms for the three children and school supplies such as backpacks, notebooks, books, etc. She is awaiting your kindness and counting on your charity.

loans.use: To buy school uniform, bag, note-book etc. for her children

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma buys and sells rice to earn an income. She is a hard-working entrepreneur and has been in this business for the past 17 years. She earns an additional income from food vending. Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans she has received from NWTF.
 
Elma is presently requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 25,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy more sacks of rice to offer for sale.

She dreams of saving enough money to expand and improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Nyamgalya

texts.en:
Nyamgalya, age 54, provides transportation services to earn an income. He lives with his wife Oyun and their two daughters in a "ger" (a traditional Mongolian family tent dwelling) in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Oyun is retired and stays home, focusing on taking care of the family. Their daughters, Chagtsalmaa and Badamsumber, are university students. 

Nyamgalya runs his inter-city transportation service from Uvs to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He transports organic salt (made from Uvs lake in Uvs province) to Ulaanbatar, where he offers it for sale. He then brings a variety of goods for other local customers back to Uvs province. He is known as a hard-working, modest, and courteous person. 

Since both his daughters attend university, Nyamgalya needs to increase the family income so that he can cover their educational expenses. He is therefore requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 MNT, which he will use to purchase a large amount of organic salt produced from Uvs lake, which he will transport to the capital city to offer for sale.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic salt (produced from Uvs lake) to transport to the capital city to offer for sale

loans.name: Carly

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, three of whom are in school, Carly works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Carly is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Carly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Phanna

texts.en:
Phanna, age 40, lives on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She and her husband have two sons and one daughter. Two of the children are in school and another is learning a technical skill. 
 
Phanna maintains the home and assists with her husband’s business. Her husband is a wooden house constructor. They also offer motorcycle transportation services.

She is asking for a loan in order to replace the motorcycle and to buy construction materials for her husband's business.

loans.use: to replace the motorcycle vehicle and to buy construction materials for her husnand's business

loans.name: Lucilyn

texts.en:
Lucilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling used clothes in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy used clothes for her business.

Lucilyn has been in this business for 17 years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Lucilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy used clothes for her business

loans.name: Lizet

texts.es: Lizet, a sus 22 años de edad estudia octavo semestre de contaduría. Gran parte de su familia trabaja como independiente, pues tienen diversidad de negocios como distribuidoras, legumbrerías, entre otros. Ella es una joven activa, enérgica, emprendedora y con proyección hacia el futuro; además quiere seguir con esa tradición de ser independiente y, aprovechando los conocimientos adquiridos en su carrera universitaria, ella desea iniciar una distribuidora de productos para comidas rápidas, por lo cual solicita el apoyo del crédito, que será invertido en la compra de activos fijos (computador) y surtido al por mayor (panes, carnes frías, quesos, salsas, productos desechables) con el fin de dar inicio a su actividad y comenzar a generar recursos para aportar a la economía de su hogar. Esto le permitirá a Lizet, cumplir el sueño de culminar su carrera profesional y tener su propia empresa con la cual pueda generar oportunidades de empleo, mejorando no sólo su calidad de vida, sino también la de otras familias.
texts.en:
Lizet at 22 years old is studying in her eighth semester of accounting. Most of her family work independently. They have a variety of businesses like being distributors, vegetable sellers, etc. She is an enterprising, active, energetic youth looking to the future. Moreover she wants to follow the tradition of being independent and take advantage of what she learned in university. 

She wants to start a fast food distribution company. which is why she is asking for this loan. She will use it to buy a fixed asset (computer) and a variety of items wholesale (breads, cold cuts, cheese, sauces, and disposable products)  She can then start her business and generate the resources to help support her family's expenses. 

This would allow Lizet to fulfill her dream of finishing her professional training and have her own business with which she can generate employment opportunities and improve her own as well as other family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (a computer) and a variety of things wholesale (breads,cold cuts, cheese, and disposable items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vitamins, vaccines, and feed for the sustenance and proper growth of his pigs

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Marlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Marlyn is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her business.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Sal

texts.en:
Sal, photographed here, is a farmer and her husband is a construction contractor. She lives in a village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. She has five children, two sons and three daughters. Two are married and live outside the family home and other three are in school.
Sal is in the process of building a new house to live in. But, the house is not finished yet, hence she decided to apply for a loan in order to be able to complete it.

loans.use: to finish constructing her house.

loans.name: Saranchimeg

texts.en:
Saranchimeg, 52, lives with her son in a small house in the Tolgoit area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her son Enhbayar is 22 and works as an assistant on a construction site. 

Saranchimeg has been running her tailoring business for 18 years. She started it from scratch and, with no help from others, she supported her three children until they were married and living with their families.

She has a small workplace and produces high-quality products. She sells to a small Russian town near the Russia and Mongolian border. She is hardworking, enthusiastic and optimistic. She says "I want to expand my business and employ other people and help them to create their own business." 

She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks to purchase a large inventory of supplies to produce slippers, boots and shoes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a large inventory of supplies to produce slippers, boots and shoes to sell to her customers

loans.name: José Alfonso

texts.es: José, a sus 41 años de edad es casado y padre de 3 hijos. Su vida productiva la ha dedicado a la actividad comercial, pues ha tenido negocios propios como una legumbrería y una licorera, pero por varios factores externos tuvo que cerrarlos. Actualmente se dedica a ser conductor de un taxi de servicio público, del cual tiene que pagar un porcentaje del dinero producido al dueño del vehículo, lo cual le genera una inestabilidad en  la economía de su hogar. Pero José, con su actitud emprendedora, con su empeño, dedicación y esfuerzo, toma la iniciativa de vender productos Amway, para complementar sus ingresos. Esta actividad la alterna mientras labora en el taxi, pues gran parte de sus pasajeros se convierten en clientes potenciales de dichos productos, aumentando así sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. El cliente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (shampoo, suplementos dietarios, productos naturales, productos de aseo personal) para aprovechar el descuento que le realizan por compras de contado y así tener disponibilidad y variedad de productos para ofrecer, que satisfagan las necesidades y gustos de sus clientes. Esto le permitirá a José poder seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, trabajar de manera independiente y tener buena solvencia en la economía de su hogar, para brindarle una mejor educación a sus hijos y mejorar la calidad de vida de todo el núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Jose, 41 years old, is married and has three children. He works in the commercial sector, and he has had his own businesses such as a vegetable shop and a distillery. However, due to various external factors, he had to close them. Currently, he works as a public service taxi driver. He has to pay a percentage of the money he earns to the owner of the vehicle, which causes economic instability in his home. But Jose, with his enterprising attitude, drive, determination, and effort, took the initiative to sell Amway products to complement his income. He alternates this work as he works in the taxi, and a number of his passengers become potential customers of his products, increasing his sales and, in turn, his income. 

Jose is requesting a loan to invest in buying wholesale merchandise (shampoo, dietary supplements, natural products, personal hygiene products) to take advantage of the discounts for buying in quantity and to have a variety of products to offer that satisfy his customers' needs and preferences. This will allow Jose to continue growing his business, working independently to have solvency in his household's economy. This will allow for a better education for his children and improve the quality of life for his whole family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (shampoo, dietary supplements, natural products, personal hygiene products)

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en: As parent to three children, Jenifer works hard to support and meet their needs. She has had her general store business for five years and earns about PHP300 each day from retailing common goods. She is borrowing PHP18,000 to purchase stocks of canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, condiments and more products to sell in her general store. She hopes that her hard work together with this loan will greatly help attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, condiments and more products to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 43 years old, married with 5 children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Chona has a tailoring shop business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like cloth, fabric, thread, needles, etc.

Chona has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Chona would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like cloth, fabric, thread, needles, etc

loans.name: Oscar Mauricio

texts.es: Oscar, a sus 28 años de edad es casado y padre de 2 hijos de 5 y 7 años. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a las labores del campo, actividad que aprendió de su padre cuando era joven. Actualmente se dedica a trabajar como mayordomo de una finca, y alterna su trabajo con la actividad agrícola, pues posee un pequeño cultivo de mora, ubicado en un terreno prestado de la finca donde trabaja. Oscar es un hombre responsable, trabajador y humilde, vive en una constante lucha para progresar al lado de su familia; por esta razón solicita el apoyo del crédito, que invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, fungicidas, insecticidas y colinos de mora) y utensilios de trabajo (alambre) con esto podrá ampliar su cultivo, ya que desea sembrar 50 matas de mora más, para incrementar su producción y así tener mejores ingresos  cuando la cosecha sea vendida. Oscar sueña con seguir trabajando arduamente para llegar a ser independiente completamente, además se proyecta teniendo su terreno propio a mediano plazo, con lo que podrá brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos y mejorar el bienestar y la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is 28 years old, married and father to two children aged 5 and 7. He has worked the land for the last 15 years, having learnt from his own father when he was young. He works as a supervisor of a farm and alternates this job with his work in agriculture. He has a small crop of blackberries on a plot of land which he rents from the farm where he works. 

Oscar is a responsible, hardworking and humble man who lives in a constant battle to make progress with his family by his side. This is the reason why he is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies (fertilisers, fungicides, insecticides and blackberry plots) and tools for work (wire) which he can use to extend his crop. He would like to plant fifty more bunches of blackberries to increase his output and receive a higher profit when the harvest is sold.

Oscar dreams of working hard to get to a point where he can work independently and have his own land in the medium term future. With this he hopes to give his children a better education and improve his family's well being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (fertilisers, fungicides, insecticides and blackberry plots) and tools for work (wire)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fixed assets (computers) and supplies (parts and accessories for computers).

loans.name: Mahmadkodir

texts.ru: Махмадкодыр стоматолог, проживающий и работающий в городе Душанбе, в столице Таджикистана. Ему 43 года. Он женат и имеет одного сына в возрасте 12 лет. У Махмадкодыра высшее стоматологическое образование. Он в течение 6 лет предоставляет услуги зубного врача. Он занимается лечением и пломбированием зубов. Махмадкодыр является профессиональным стоматологом и выполняет свою работу качественно. Сейчас он хочет расширить свой бизнес и поэтому обратился за кредитом. На сумму кредита он планирует провести ремонт в клинике и закупить современные оборудования. Он будет выплачивать кредит за счет дохода с деятельности.
texts.en: Mahmadkodir is a dentist living and working in the city of Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. He is 43 years old, married, and has a twelve year old son. Mahmadkodir is a university trained dentist. For six years he has been a practicing dentist, treating teeth and doing fillings. He is a professional and does high quality work. He now wants to expand his business, so he is asking for a loan. He plans to use the loan to remodel the clinic and buy up-to-date equipment. He is going to repay the loan with income from his business.

loans.use: to do remodeling of the dental clinic and to buy modern instruments.

loans.name: Muborakoy

texts.ru: Муборак добросовестная и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Детям 21, 19, 16 и 14 лет. Ее старший сын студент, а младшие учатся в средней школе. Муборак является основной кормилицей в семье.  Она начала свою деятельность в производственном кооперативе 10 лет назад. Муборак живет бедно, но старается для образования своих детей. Она считает, что образование стоит на первом месте. Муборак данное время не имеет денег для того, чтобы купить книги, тетради, сумки, школьные формы и т.п. для нового учебного года. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Muborak is a conscientious and purposeful woman. She is 45 years old, married, and has four children. The children are 21, 19, 16, and 14 years old. Her oldest son is a university student, and the youngest is in middle school. Muborak is the sole provider for the family. She began her work in a producer's cooperative 10 years ago. She lives simply, but wants her children to be educated. She considers education to be of primary importance. Muborak doesn't currently have the money to buy books, notebooks, backpacks, and other supplies for the school year. She hopes for your kindness and charity.

loans.use: To buy books, notebooks, and school uniforms for her children

loans.name: Sino

texts.ru: Сино 18 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Сино в этом году успешно окончил среднюю школу. Сино с детства мечтал стать фармацевтом. Сино в школе любил такие предметы как математика, информатика и английский язык. Он начитанный молодой человек. Сино успешно поступил в Национальный университет Таджикистана по специальности фармацевта.  Сино должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. В будущем он мечтает стать хорошим специалистом и служить своей родине.
texts.en: Sino is 18 years old. He is not married and lives with his parents. He successfully completed high school this year. Since childhood Sino has dreamed of being a pharmacist. In school her loved subjects like math, informatics, and English. He is a well-read young man. Sino was accepted to Tajikistan's national university's pharmacy department. He needs to pay the tuition, but doesn't have the money. He is asking for a loan to pay it. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity. In the future he dreams of being a great specialist and serving his country.

loans.use: To pay for university tuition

loans.name: Deng

texts.en:
Deng (in the photo) is 27 years old. He and his wife are garment workers. They have been married since 2007 and have two young daughters.  The family lives in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Deng wants a motorbike to drive to work; hence he decided to apply for a loan to buy one. With a motorbike that he will buy with money from the loan, Deng will have his own transportation and be able to save some expense for traveling costs.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Leang (in the photo), age 31, is a garment worker. Her husband is a construction worker. Leang lives in a village about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has three children: one son and two daughters.  

Leang is asking for a loan of $1,500. She will repair the house (roof) where she lives and buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: to repair the house (roof) where she lives and buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Diana Jane

texts.en: Diana Jane is a 22-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three young children, ages 4 years old, 3 years old and 9 months old. She works in the fishing industry. She sells fish and crab to earn a living. She has been selling fish for almost four years now. Her husband works as a laborer and his income cannot meet the family's daily needs. Diana Jane requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fishing materials, such as crab nets, and additional capital to purchase more fish for resale, in order to attract more customers. Diana Jane would like to improve her fish vending business to be able to support her children with good food and a quality education in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials, such as crab nets, and additional capital to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma has been a member of PMPC for five years. Gemma is 50 years old and married with five children. She lives in Mialen, Clarin, Philippines, where she does farming and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this work for seven years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional feed and other agrivet supplies.

In the future, Gemma hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and other agrivet supplies.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Amalia is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like fish, noodles, meat, spices, etc. for her restaurant business.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like fish, noodles, meat, spices, etc.

loans.name: Bellie

texts.en:
Bellie is 49 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school.  Bellie works very hard to provide for them.

Bellie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as rice, charcoal, eggs, canned oil, noodles and groceries to sell.

Bellie has been in this business for 15 years and earns additional income from raising goats.

In the future, Bellie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as rice, charcoal, eggs, canned oil, noodles and groceries to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 34 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like bread, sugar, coffee, shampoo, groceries, etc., for resale.

Erlinda has been in this business for two years and earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like bread, sugar, coffee, shampoo, groceries, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Sor Celina

texts.es: Celina, con 69 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos. Luego de casarse, cuando tenía 21 años de edad, decidió emprender su propio negocio para generar recursos y aportar a la economía de su hogar, por eso se capacitó en el área de confección y, con los conocimientos adquiridos montó su propio taller en su casa. Inicialmente confeccionaba a terceros, pero tres años más tarde se encaminó por una línea propia de artículos para el hogar, como sábanas, tendidos, acolchados, toallas, almohadas, entre otros. Con esta actividad ha logrado aportar para el sustento diario en su hogar y ha sacado adelante a sus hijos, pues gracias a trabajar como independiente, puede tener un horario flexible y manejar su propio tiempo. Celina es una señora emprendedora, activa y dedicada a su familia y a su labor, esto la motiva para solicitar otro ciclo de crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (tela, hilos, agujas, algodón sintético) y cancelará el saldo del crédito que tiene vigente, con esto podrá darle continuidad a su negocio, tener disponibilidad de materia prima para elaborar sus productos y ofrecer variedad de telas y colores a sus clientes, así aumentará sus ventas y los ingresos. Celina sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y poder brindar oportunidades de empleo a madres cabezas de hogar, con lo que podrá mejorar no sólo la calidad de vida de su familia, sino la de muchas otras personas.
texts.en:
Celina is 69 years old, married and the mother of two.
