After getting married at the age of 21, she decided to start her own business, in order to generate income and contribute to the household expenses. So she learned the art of dressmaking and with that knowledge opened her own shop in her home. Initially she sewed for third parties, but three years later started with her own line of articles for the home like sheets, bed clothing, quilts, towels, pillow-cases, etc. Doing this she was able to pay the household expenses and get her children ahead. Working independently she could be flexible and choose her own hours. 

Celina is an enterprising and active woman, dedicated to her family and to her work. For these reasons she is requesting this loan in order to buy supplies at wholesale prices (fabric, thread, needles and synthetic cotton) and pay off an existing loan. By doing this she can continue with her business, having the raw materials at hand to make her products. And offer a variety of colors and fabrics to her clients, increasing her sales and revenue. 

Celina dreams of expanding her business and offering employment to mothers who are also the head of their family. Thus raising the living standard of not only her family, but of many other people too.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (fabric, thread, needles and synthetic cotton) and pay off an existing loan.

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en: Direct selling is the primary business of Lovelyn. She is from the village of Calaocan. She 26 years old and is married with three lovely children. She sells Sundance products and she usually receives a net income of 2,500 PHP per month from this direct selling. She needed additional capital to further the chosen business and in this regard, she is asking for a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP to buy shoes, blouses, sandals and slippers to offer and sell in her village. Lovelyn hopes that she can maintain or eventually develop her business to give her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy shoes, blouses, sandals and slippers to offer and sell in her village.

loans.name: Maguette's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 femmes qui habitent le même village,elles font toutes du commerce et ont une bonne cohésion sociale. Maguette est la représentante du groupe et a levé sa main sur la photo. Elle est veuve et mère de 04 enfants tous des garçons. son ainé a 35 ans et son cadet 20 ans.Elle fait du commerce de céréale et d'huile, et avec son prêt elle compte acheter 15 sac de mil à 187500f, 4 sacs de haricot à 100000f, 1 baril d'huile à 112500f;Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine et ses clients lui son très fidèle a cause de leur bonne entente . Ses bénéfices lui permette de payer mensuellement les dépenses alimentaires de le famille.
texts.en: This group is composed of five women who live in the same village. They all work in commerce and have good social cohesion. Maguette is the group's representative, with her hand raised in the photo. She is a widow and the mother of four children, all boys, of whom the oldest is 35 years old, and the youngest is 20. Maguette does commerce in grains and oil. With her loan, she intends to purchase 15 sacks of millet at 187,500 francs, 4 sacks of beans at 100,00 francs, and a barrel of oil at 112,500 francs. She has good experience in this domain, and her customers are very loyal to her since they get along well. Her profits enable her to pay the family's monthly food expenses.

loans.use: to purchase millet, beans, and oil

loans.name: Jose Rudys

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia, su esposa de 22 años de edad y su hija de 2 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora. El, posee una tienda  desde hace 4 años y dicha actividad la realiza todos los días, asimismo trabaja en un taller de carpintería de 6:00am a 3:00pm y por la tarde atiende su negocio.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar variedad de productos de la canasta básica, tales como: golosinas, azúcar, frijoles, arroz, jugos, sodas, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar sus ganancias y salir adelante.
Su sueño es que su tienda crezca y siempre ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his family, his 22 year old wife and two year old daughter.  He is a hardworking person and has had a store for the past four years.  He works there every day and also in a carpentry shop from 6:00 am to 3:00 pm.  He tends to his business in the evenings.

This loan will allow him to buy a variety of basic products such as snacks, sugar, beans, rice, juices, sodas, and other things.  This will help him increase his profits and get ahead.

His dream is to have a house of his own and offer his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock his store

loans.name: Cesar Alberto

texts.es:
Cesar,  se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de mas capital de trabajo, el cual le servirá para comprar repuestos para arreglar su pick up y su para su equipo de trabajo, transporte de electrodomésticos.
El efecto del crédito anterior fue  favorable, ya que las condiciones económicas han mejorado, por lo que ha generado utilidades y ha logrado pagar sus deudas
texts.en:
Cesar needs a new loan because he needs more working capital, which will allow him to buy spare parts to fix up his pickup truck, which is his work equipment for transporting household appliances.

The previous loan was helpful and his financial conditions have improved and he has been able to pay his debts.

loans.use: to make vehicle repairs..

loans.name: Gelivieve

texts.en:
Gelivieve is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gelivieve is 22 years old and has one child who is in school.

Gelivieve has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Gelivieve has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Gelivieve would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace his roof.

loans.name: Rene Francisco

texts.es:
René,  habita con su familia, su esposa de 21 años de edad y su hijo de 2 años de edad. El, se dedica a la venta de plátanos por mayor y lo realiza  todos los días de forma ambulante y lo desempeña en un pick up en los lugares aledaños a los mercados, este oficio lo lleva a cabo asociado con sus suegros. 
El préstamo le permitirá comprar mercadería, tales como: plátanos, bolsas, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a mantener sus negocio  día con día y con ello obtener mayores ingresos.
Su sueño es crecer en su negocio para comprar un carro propio y así independizarse de sus suegros.
texts.en:
Rene lives with his family, his 21 year old wife and two year old son.  He sells bananas in bulk and does this every day with a pickup truck in the surrounding areas and markets.  He is partners with his in-laws in this business.

This loan will allow him to buy merchandise such as bananas, bags, and other things and will allow him to maintain his business day to day and obtain greater earnings.  His dream is to grow his business so he can buy a personal car and become independent from his in-laws.

loans.use: to buy bananas and bags.

loans.name: Olvin Leonel

texts.es: Olvin, tiene 26 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. El anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de verduras de forma ambulante, pero tuvo la oportunidad hace un año de prestar servicio de transporte a personas con una mototaxi, transporta personas de su comunidad a sus alrededores. El préstamo que ha solicitado de 10,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en la reparación y mantenimiento de su mototaxi para poder brindar un mejor servicio al cliente. Su meta es lograr tener otra mototaxi y ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en: Olvin is 26 years old and lives in a common law marriage with his wife and two children.  He lives in the town of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara and used to sell vegetables, but he had the opportunity to provide personal transportation with a moto-taxi and takes people from his community to the surrounding area.  He is asking for this loan of 10,000 Lempiras to repair and maintain his moto-taxi, so that he can provide better customer service.  His goal is to have another moto-taxi and help his children with their educations.

loans.use: to maintain his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Don Manuel, tiene 65 años de edad, esta casado, tiene tres hijos y vive con su familia en el municipio de Victoria, Yoro. El desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos como ser frijoles, maíz y arroz, esto los cultiva en el terreno que alquila. Esta producción de las cosechas la vende en el mercado local. El préstamo solicitado es por  12,000 Lempiras el cual los utilizara para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo  de maíz y arroz, va poder comprar fertilizantes, abonos y pago de mano de obra y poder sacar mejor producción. Su sueño es tener siempre esta fuente de ingresos y que sus hijos aprendan a trabajar.
texts.en: Manuel is 65 years old, married, and has three children.  He lives with his family in the town of Victoria, Yoro.  He has been a farmer of basic grains (beans, corn, and rice) since he was very young.  He raises these on land that he leases and sells his harvest at the local market.  He is asking for this loan of 12,000 Lempiras, which he will use to maintain his corn and rice crop.  He will buy fertilizer, compost, and pay for labor in order to have better production.  His dream is to always have this source of income and for his children to learn how to work.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es: Nery, tiene 40 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura y a la construcción. Hace un año decidió por establecer su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios  como ser granos básicos, azúcar, pan, café refrescos, churros, productos de abarrotes etc. El préstamo que solicita es por 6,000 Lempiras para surtir la pulpería de productos alimenticios como granos básicos, sal, azúcar, embutidos, refrescos y de abarrotes, con el propósito de ofrecer variedad de productos y aumentar sus ingresos. Su plan es hacer autosostenible su negocio.
texts.en: Nery is 40 year old and married.  He has two children and lives in a village that is part of the town of Santa Cruz de Yojoa Cortes.  He used to be a farmer and work in construction, but he decided to set up his own grocery store a year ago, where he sells food products such as basic grains, sugar, bread, coffee, soft drinks, churros, grocery items, etc.  He will use the 6,000 Lempiras from this loan to stock his store with food items such as basic grains, salt, sugar, sausages, soft drinks, and groceries, so that he can offer a variety of products and increase his income.  His plan is to make his business self-sustaining.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Martha Liney

texts.es: Martha, a sus 26 años de edad es madre de una hija de 11 años y actualmente es separada. Por falta de oportunidades laborales y las dificultades económicas por las que atravesó luego de ser abandonada por su pareja, ella decidió iniciar su negocio y obtener recursos por cuenta propia, pues toda la carga económica recayó sobre ella, al ser madre cabeza de hogar. Montó un puesto de venta de comidas, gaseosas y mecato, ubicado en el barrio donde reside, y desde que lo inició le ha ido muy bien, debido a la gran afluencia de personas que transitan por el lugar. Cuenta con el apoyo de un empleado directo y esto le permite seguir al frente de la educación de su hija. Martha es una mujer emprendedora, juiciosa, activa y siempre va en busca de opciones que le permitan salir adelante, por eso solicita el segundo ciclo de crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (un enfriador/congelador) y surtido al por mayor (mecato, galletería, confitería, helados, gaseosas, cervezas) para poder ofrecer más variedad de productos y ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio, que satisfaga sus gustos y necesidades, así podrá incrementar su clientela y por ende sus ingresos, para seguir avanzando hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es montar un restaurante, que sea grande y cómodo para sus clientes, esto le permitirá tener una estabilidad económica favorable para darle una mejor educación a su hija y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en: Martha, at her 26 years, is the single mother of an 11-year old daughter.  She is currently separated.  Due to a lack of work opportunities and the financial difficulties she went through after her partner left her, Martha decided to start her own business to get the resources she needed on her own.  All of the financial responsibility fell to her, as the head of her household.  She opened a sales stall selling food, sodas and pastries in the neighborhood she lives in.  Since she started the business, it has been going well as there are a lot of people who pass through the area.  Martha has the help of one direct employee, which allows her to stay on top of her daughter's education.  Martha is an enterprising, sensible and active woman, and she is constantly looking for ways to get ahead.  That is why she is requesting a second loan cycle.  She plans to invest it in the purchase of fixed assets (a refrigerator/freezer) and wholesale stock (pastries, cookies, candies, ice cream, sodas, beer) to offer a greater variety of products and a better service to her customers to satisfy their wants and needs.  Then she will be able to increase her clientele and consequently her income.  And she will be able to keep moving toward making her dream come true- to open a large and comfortable restaurant for her customers.  That would allow Martha to have a favorable financial stability and to give her daughter a better education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fixed assets (a refrigerator/freezer) and wholesale stock (pastries, cookies, candies, sodas and beer).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es: María, tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. Hace más de 3 años de realizar su propia actividad económica para el sostenimiento de su familia. Ella elabora y vende tortillas de maíz en su casa con los vecinos quienes son sus clientes. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 7,000 Lempiras y es el segundo ciclo en ODEF. Con el cual va a comprar maíz y leña para el fuego y poder hacer las tortillas  para vender, su plan es que el negocio crezca para mejorar la condición de la vida familiar.
texts.en: Maria is 35 years old, is a single mother, and has two children with whom she lives in the town of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes.  She started her own business three years ago so she could support her family and makes corn tortillas in her home with her neighbors, who are her customers.  This loan of 7,000 Lempiras is her second cycle through ODEF, with which she will buy corn and firewood to be able to make tortillas to sell.  Her plan is to grow this business so she can improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Gladys Estella

texts.es: Gladys,  a sus 42 años de edad es madre soltera de una hija. Se dedica a laborar en un cultivo de flores desempeñando el cargo de supervisora y, alterna su trabajo con la actividad de la ganadería, pues posee varias cabezas de ganado de levante, con lo cual complementa sus ingresos para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar, ella cuenta con el apoyo de un hermano para cuidar el ganado, que se encuentra ubicado en una finca donde residen sus padres. Gladys es una mujer luchadora, activa, pujante y siempre va en busca de oportunidades que le permitan salir adelante al lado de su hija, por eso se anima a solicitar el crédito  con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de ganado (ternera de levante) para continuar con su negocio y poder aumentar sus recursos, pues desea poder brindarle una excelente educación universitaria a su hija  y verla realizada profesionalmente, además podrá tener la posibilidad de ahorrar para comprar su casa propia a mediano plazo y disfrutar de un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida en compañía de su hija.
texts.en: Gladys is 42 years old and the single mother of one daughter.  She raises flowers and works as a supervisor and also raises livestock; she has various heads of livestock with which she complements her income to support the household.  Her brother helps her care for the livestock, which is located on a farm where her parents live.  Gladys is a hardworking, active, woman who pushes herself and is always looking for opportunities that allow her to get ahead with her daughter.  She was motivated to request a loan in order to invest in livestock (steers) so she can continue with her business and be able to increase her resources.  She wants to be able to provide her daughter with an excellent university education and watch her develop a professional career.  She will also have the chance to save up to buy a home of her own in the interim and enjoy a better quality of life and wellbeing with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Natalí

texts.es: Natalí es una mujer de 27 años de edad, casada y madre de un bebé de 2 años. Por falta de oportunidades de empleo, ella decidió comenzar su propio negocio para conseguir los recursos por su cuenta, por lo que en el año 2008 comenzó a vender mercancía y productos por catálogo, actividad que aprendió luego de capacitarse en un curso de Mercadeo y Ventas en el Sena, desde entonces trabaja largas jornadas diariamente, para conseguir los ingresos con los que apoya al sostenimiento de su hogar. Natalí es una mujer juiciosa, pujante, emprendedora, dedicada a su familia y a su negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor (suplementos dietarios, cremas corporales, productos naturales, galletería, confitería, chocolates, entre otros), para aprovechar los descuentos que recibe por compras de contado y poder aumentar su margen de ganancia por cada venta, así tendrá más variedad de productos disponibles para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorará sus ingresos, de esta forma podrá ir avanzando poco a poco para hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Natalí is a 27 year old woman.  She is married and has a two year old baby.  Due to a lack of employment opportunities, she decided to start her own business in order to generate an income of her own and began selling merchandise and catalog products in 2008.  She learned this after taking a training course in sales and marketing at SENA.  Since then she works long shifts every day in order to generate the income with which she supports her household.  Natalí is a judicious, enterprising woman who pushes herself and who is dedicated to her family and to her business.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise in quantity (dietary supplements, body creams, natural products, cookies, candies, chocolates, and other things) so that she can take advantage of discounts she gets for paying in cash and be able to increase her profit margin with each sale.  This way she will have more products available to offer her customers, increase her income, and be able to get ahead little by little so she can grow her business and improver her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy inventory in quantity.

loans.name: Norma Constanza

texts.es: Norma, a sus 45 años de edad es madre soltera de un hijo de 15 años. Desde hace aproximadamente 15 años comenzó su propio negocio en el área de confección, montó su propio taller con el fin de generar ingresos para solventar las necesidades de su hogar, pues toda la carga económica recayó sobre ella luego del abandono del padre de su hijo. Actualmente confecciona para terceros y además tiene su línea propia de artículos para el hogar, como tendidos y sets para el baño. Cuenta con el apoyo de una empleada directa y trabaja de lunes a sábado. Pensando en el progreso de su hijo adolescente y con el ánimo de hacer crecer su negocio, Norma solicita el segundo ciclo de crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de una máquina recubridora, que requiere para poder obtener más contratos semanales, pues las empresas para las que confecciona le están demandando nuevos lotes de confección, así podrá cumplir con la entrega oportuna de los productos con un excelente acabado y  aumentará sus ingresos, para brindar una mejor educación a su hijo. Además, Norma sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, para generar más oportunidades de empleo y mejorar sus finanzas, con el fin de ahorrar para adquirir su casa propia, esto mejorará notablemente el bienestar y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Norma, who is 45 years old, is a single mother with one 15 year old son. About 15 years ago, she started her own sewing business. She started her own workshop with the goal of generating income to meet the necessities of her household because all of the economic pressure fell to her when the father of her son abandoned her. She now sews for other people and she also has her own line of household items, such as bedcovers and bath sets. She has the help of one employee and she works Monday through Saturday. Thinking of her son’s future and with the desire to grow her business, Norma is requesting a second loan, to invest in a coverstitch sewing machine, which she needs in order to get more weekly contracts because the companies that she sews for are demanding new sewing batches. In this way, she could turn in the products on time and with high quality finishing so that she could increase her income and provide a good education to her son. Norma also dreams of growing her business, so that she could generate more job opportunities and improve her finances. Her goal is to save so she can buy her own house. This would notably improve her family’s wellbeing and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a coverstitch sewing machine.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es: Carlos, a sus 19 años de edad, vive con sus padres en una finca prestada. Desde pequeño comenzó a conocer las actividades agrícolas, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre que toda la vida ha sido agricultor. Actualmente se dedica a laborar como empleado en un cultivo de flores, actividad que alterna con la agricultura de manera independiente, pues posee cultivos de papa y fríjol y recibe el apoyo de su padre; los productos que cosechan son vendidos en la plaza de mercado del pueblo donde reside y es así como ha logrado obtener recursos para aportar a la economía de su hogar. Carlos es un joven dinámico, activo, entusiasta y con mucha proyección, siempre va buscando oportunidades que le permitan avanzar, por eso se decide a solicitar el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, riegos, fungicidas), aprovechando los descuentos que recibe por pago de contado para continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos y sacar una cosecha de buena calidad que permita vender a un mejor precio sus productos y así mejorar el margen de ganancias, con lo que podrá seguir aportando a la economía de su hogar y seguir invirtiendo capital a su negocio, pues de esta forma lo podrá hacer crecer y tendrá la posibilidad de brindar oportunidades de empleo a otros campesinos de su sector, así mejorará no sólo la calidad de vida de su familia, sino la de muchas otras personas.
texts.en: Carlos is 19 years old and lives with his parents on a loaned farm.  He began learning agriculture when he was young and thanks to his father’s teachings he has been a farmer all his life.  He is currently working as an employee, raising flowers, and also raises his own potatoes and beans and receives his father’s support.  He sells his harvest in the plaza market where he lives and he has been able to obtain resources to support the finances in his home.  Carlos is a dynamic, active, enthusiastic young man with many plans.  He is always searching for opportunities that will allow him to get ahead, but he decided to ask for this loan so he can buy farming supplies in quantity (fertilizers, irrigation, fungicide) so he can take advantage of the discounts he gets for paying in cash, allowing him to continue caring for his crops and have a good quality harvest that he can sell at a better price.  This way he can increase his profit margin, continue supporting his household finances, and continue investing in his business.  He will be able to grow his business and have the chance to provide employment to other farm workers in his sector, so he can not only improve his own family’s quality of life, but also others’.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia se dedica como Secretaria Administrativa de una importadora hace 2 años. Actualmente está cursando el tercer año de la Carrera de Ciencias Contable. Ella es una joven muy luchadora, que además de trabajar también estudia, todo esto por ser una gran profesional.
Su aspiración es seguir enriqueciendo sus conocimientos profesionales y dedicarse a su profesión.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, con lo que podrá seguir estudiando y mejorando su vida. Agradece por la oportunidad de seguir estudiando que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Lucia has been an administrative assistant for an importer for two years.  She is currently in the third year of her accountant studies.  She is a hardworking woman who attends school as well as works so she can become a great professional.

Her aspiration is to continue enriching her professional knowledge and dedicate herself to her profession.

She is asking for this loan so she can pay university tuition and continue studying and improving her life.  She is grateful to be able to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Gildardo De Los Milagros

texts.es: Gildardo es un hombre de 45 años de edad, padre de 3 hijos y convive en unión libre con su pareja. Toda su vida productiva la dedicó a trabajar como oficial de construcción, pero en vista de que es una actividad muy inestable e incierta, decidió buscar otras opciones para recibir más ingresos, por lo que decidió montar su propio negocio, un puesto de venta de comidas rápidas, actividad que alterna con su empleo en construcción. Inicialmente comenzó vendiendo en una esquina, productos como perros calientes, hamburguesas, papas a la francesa, entre otros, y en vista de que cada día tenía más clientela, decidió alquilar un local, donde sus clientes pueden estar más cómodos. Es así como ha logrado obtener los recursos suficientes para sacar adelante a su familia. Gildardo es un señor emprendedor, pujante y muy trabajador. Abre su negocio de Miércoles a Domingo desde las 5:00 pm, pues a esta hora termina su jornada laboral en la obra. Solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de surtido (panes, papas, carnes frías, gaseosas, salsas) y realizar adecuaciones en el local, pues está un poco deteriorado. Esto le ayudará a mejorar la imagen de su negocio, para atraer más clientes y tener materia prima disponible para cumplir con la demanda y satisfacer los gustos de sus comensales. Gildardo sueña con poder ahorrar y comprar el local, para así tener mejor solvencia económica y brindar un mejor bienestar, educación y calidad de vida a sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Gildardo is a 45-year-old man. He is the father of 3 children and is in a common-law marriage with his spouse. 

His working life is spent as a construction worker, but seeing as that is a very unstable and uncertain field, he decided to start his own business, a fast food stall. This is an activity that he alternates with his work in construction.

 He initially started out selling products like hot dogs, hamburgers, and French fries, among others, from a street corner. As every day he had more customers, he decided to rent a small shop where his customers would be more comfortable. In this way, he has been able to obtain enough resources to get his family ahead.  

Gildardo is an enterprising, vigorous, and very hardworking man. His business opens from Wednesday to Sunday at 5 p.m., as this is when he finishes his daily work at his job. 

He is requesting support from the loan in order to invest in the purchase of supplies (bread, potatoes, cold meat, soft drinks, sauces) and make improvements to his business, as it’s somewhat deteriorated. This will help him to improve his business’s image in order to attract more customers, and to have basic supplies available to fill demand and satisfy his guests’ wishes. 

Gildardo hopes to be able to save some money and purchase his building in order to improve his creditworthiness and offer better general welfare, education, and quality of life to his children and his spouse.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (bread, potatoes, cold meat, soft drinks, sauces) and to renovate his place of business.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en: Gregorio is a 43-year-old married man from Getafe, Bohol. He has five children. He engages in fishing. He earns a livelihood by selling fish. He has operated a fishing business for almost five years now.To sustain his livelihood activity, Gregorio requested a loan of 5000 PHP to buy fishing materials like fish netting to improve his daily catch. He dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat which would be very helpful in his daily activity and could gain more yield to provide his family with good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fish netting

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gina works hard to support her family.

Gina has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: Luis, a sus 20 años de edad se dedica a la actividad de reparación de autos, pues luego de culminar sus estudios secundarios, decidió capacitarse en el Sena y realizó un curso técnico de eléctrica automotriz. Con esto ha logrado obtener recursos para aportar con el sostenimiento de su hogar. Luis es un joven emprendedor, juicioso, activo y dinámico, siempre va en busca de opciones que le permitan salir adelante al lado de sus padres. Solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos, repuestos y accesorios (bombillos, agua para baterías, soldador, borners, copas y llaves) con lo que podrá prestar un mejor servicio y tener disponibilidad de inventarios para satisfacer las necesidades inmediatas de sus clientes, esto le ayudará a mejorar sus ventas y por ende los ingresos que recibe. Luis sueña con fortalecer su negocio, generar oportunidades de empleo y tener una mejor solvencia económica para seguir ayudando a sus padres y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luis, who is 20 years old, repairs cars. After finishing his secondary studies, he decided to train at SENA [National Apprenticeship Service] and took technical courses about car electrical systems. Because of that, he has made money to contribute to his household. Luis is an entrepreneurial young person, level-headed, active, and dynamic. He is always looking for options that will help him advance in life, along with his parents. He is requesting the loan with the goal of investing it in car parts and accessories (light bulbs, water for batteries, solder, battery terminals, wheel covers, and keys), so that he will be able to provide better service and have enough inventory to satisfy the immediate needs of his clients. This will help him improve his sales, and thereby the income he receives. Luis dreams of growing his business, generating opportunities for employment, and having better economic solvency so he can continue helping his parents and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy car parts and accessories (light bulbs, water for batteries, solder, battery terminals, wheel covers, and keys)

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
This is Esperanza. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Esperanza hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a close relationship with her whole family. Every week she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 45 years old and married with three children.

Helen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, soft drinks, distilled water shampoo, groceries, noodles, etc. to sell.

Helen has been in this business for nine years and earns additional income from raising pigs and chickens and buying and selling charcoal.
 
Helen aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, soft drinks, distilled water shampoo, groceries, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acquire more dry goods to sell like blouses, T-shirts, skirts, underwear, belts, bags and more

loans.name: Altantuul

texts.en: Mrs. Altantuul is 23 years old and lives with her newly wedded husband in a ger, traditional nomadic tent, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband Mendjargal runs a taxi service in town. Altantuul has been working as saleswoman in the clothing retail business since 2011. She has a lot of experience and is now starting her own business. She is importing clothing from Erlian, China and sells them to local customers. She has good taste and has regular customers. She is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory from Erlian, China, and sell to local customers. She is a hardworking, neat and well-experienced woman.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory from Erlian, China, and sell to local customers.

loans.name: Juliemar

texts.en: Juliemar, 47 years of age, is married and blessed with six children. She has been in the hog raising business for almost three years. In this business she earns a net income of PHP 20,000 for every three full grown hogs that she sells. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase hog feed for her six hogs. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she will be able to improve her business more to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed for her six hogs

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Don Pedro es una persona muy trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos. Su negocio es la venta  de mariscos desde hace 15 años, los cuales vende en su comunidad.
Don Pedro sus clientes le prefieren por su buena atención es muy reconocido y muy visitado. El necesita  préstamo para la compra de más materia prima como ser buche de babosa, curvina, bagre, etc. que necesita para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
Don Pedro espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que gracias a el contara con el producto suficiente para satisfacer las necesidades y pedidos de sus clientes y espera que sus ventas aumenten y con esto ganar más ingresos que contribuyan a mejorar un poco su estilo de vida y el de su de su familia en el hogar. 
Don Pedro su sueño es seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Julio 2013
texts.en:
Pedro is a hardworking person who lives in a community in south of Honduras together with his wife and four children. He has worked selling seafood in his community since he was 15 years old.

Pedro is very well known among his customers, who visit him often and prefer him for the attention he pays them. He needs a loan in order to purchase more primary material such as slugs, sea bass, catfish, etc. that he needs to meet the demands of his customers. Pedro believes the loan will do him a great deal of good as thanks to it he will have enough goods to meet the needs of his customers and their orders. He hopes that his sales will increase and this will allow allow him to improve his lifestyle and that of his family and his household. 

His goal is to continue supporting his children in their studies so that they have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – July 2013

loans.use: purchase slugs, sea bass, catfish, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es de la ciudad de Ybycui, está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Agroindustrial, el comenta que proviene de una familia numerosa, y de descendencia muy humilde.
Además de eso también dice que quiere capacitarse y por medio de sus conocimientos y lo que aprendió poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, lo que le permitirá seguir estudiando y mejorando su vida y la de su familia. Agradece esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Lourdes is from the city of Ybycui.  She's studying agroindustrial engineering.  She says she comes from a large family and a modest background.  She also says she wants training, and through her knowledge and what she learned be able to give her family everything they needs. 

She's requesting this loan to pay her university fees so she can continue studying and improving her life and that of her family.

She's grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es estudiante de Enfermería, está cursando el último año, vive en casa propia, ella es madre soltera de tres niños. Es una señora muy responsable, trabajadora y muy dedicada al estudio.
Su meta es de tener su titulo y poder trabajar de forma independiente para una mejor calidad de vida de su familia y de esa forma también da un ejemplo a sus hijos.
Ella comenta que sus hijos son su mayor inspiración, y que esta luchando por ellos, para que el dia de mañana se sientan orgullosos de ella.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de los gastos de titulación, ya que es un poco costoso y quiere poder pagarlo.
texts.en:
Lucia is a nursing student in her final year. She lives in her own house and is the single mother of three children. She is a very responsible, hard-working woman, and very dedicated to her studies.

Her goal is to obtain her degree and be able to work independently. This way she can give her family a better quality of life, and also provide a example to her children. She says that her children are her greatest inspiration and that she is striving for their sake, so that tomorrow they will feel proud of her. 

She is requesting this loan in order to to pay the cost of having her degree officially registered; as it is somewhat costly, and she wants to be able to pay for it.

loans.use: To pay the cost of officially registering her degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for the maintenance of her hogs

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is an entrepreneur who raises her family by vending vegetables and also cooking food for snacks. In this way, she manages to generate a net income of about PHP 5,000 each month. The majority of this was used as revolving capital in the business and some amount for the sustenance of her family daily meals.

Edna would like to improve her sales. This is the reason why she is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy rice, cabbages, tomatoes and eggplant to sell. This will help increase her sales and someday, she aims to develop a more profitable business.

loans.use: to buy rice to retail, cabbages, tomatoes and eggplant to sell.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is a 55 year old married woman from Getafe, Bohol and is a mother of an 18-year-old son. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items ranging from noodles, seasonings, coffee, sugar, canned goods, shampoo, soap and eggs. Herminia requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more stock like soft drinks, pollard (pig feed) and soaps to attract more customers and to avoid stock shortage. 

In the future, Herminia dreams of expanding her store to continue to send her child to college and improve their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more stock like soft drinks, pollard (pig feed) and soaps.

loans.name: Lyra

texts.en:
Lyra is very thankful for the loans lent to her. She has been a variety store owner for more than five years now. Her income from her business is helping her sustain her children's education and their household expenditures. She also has a coffee vending machine and an electronic loading station. Her husband is helping her in providing for their family.

She would like to apply for another 42,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lyra dreams of being a wholesaler and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokhorn sells fruit and fish that her husband catches in the local market. Her husband is a fisherman. She lives in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 
Sokhorn is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is 30 years old, married and has children. His wife works abroad, he is taking care of his children while at the same time managing his store to earn daily. He is a patient father and wanted to increase his merchandise that is why he is applying for a loan of PHP 7,000 that will serve as additional capital to buy stocks of canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits and more products to sell. 

In the future, Allan would like to keep improving his sales to save funds for the education of his children and someday achieve progression in his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits and more products to sell.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Savoeun is a weaver, while her husband is a security guard. She has three children - one son and two daughters. She lives in a village across the Mekong River, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Savoeun is applying for a loan to buy a new motorbike for her husband because the old one is breaking.
Photo: Savoeun and her loom.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Densmaa

texts.en: Mrs.Densmaa is 51 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a Ger, traditional nomadic tent, in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband Tseveenjav runs a small retail store business. Her daughter Soyoloo is 22 and a university student. Densmaa worked at a local company until 2012 and then retired and stayed home since. She has started an organic dairy products retail business in the local market. Her relatives have livestock and produce organic dairy products and she purchases from them and sells to local customers. She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products to sell to local customers. She is a hardworking, communicative and friendly woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products to sell to local customers

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru:
Бахтиёр бизнесмен, проживающий в городе Душанбе. Ему 41 год. У него есть жена, 7-летняя дочь и годовалый сын. Его жена домохозяйка, а дочь учится в первом классе. Бахтиёр в семье один зарабатывает. Вот уже 15 лет как он занимается продажей мужской одежды. Бахтиёр на рынке города продает мужскую пижаму, шаровары, футболки, а также мужское нижнее белье. Он научился этому бизнесу у своего отца. 
Для продвижения бизнеса Бахтиёру необходимо увеличить ассортимент товара. Он просит кредит, чтобы закупить разнообразный ассортимент сезонной мужской одежды на продажу. Бахтиёр честный и пунктуальный человек. Он обещает выплачивать кредит в срок. В будущем он хочет открыть еще одну торговую точку.
texts.en:
Bakhtiyor is a businessman who lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 41 years old, married, and the father of a seven-year-old daughter and a one-year-old son.  His wife is a homemaker and his daughter is in first grade.  

Bakhtiyor is the only breadwinner in his family. For 15 years already he has been selling men's clothes at the local market:  pajamas, pants, T-shirts, as well as underwear.  He learned this type of work from his father.  

In order to promote his business,  Bakhtiyor needs to increase his inventory.  He is requesting a loan to buy a variety of seasonal clothes for men, for resale.   He is honest and punctual and promises to repay his loan on time.  In the future he would like to open an additional outlet.

loans.use: to buy men's seasonal clothes for resale in order to develop his business.

loans.name: Mit

texts.en:
Mit (in the photo) lives in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has four children--three sons and one daughter. One of the children is married and lives in a separate home, one is a garment worker, and the other two attend school.

Mit and her husband are farmers. They grow vegetables on their farmland in the village where they live. 

Mit is applying for a loan of $700 to repair the house (roof) where she lives and to buy seeds for her vegetable farm.

loans.use: To repair the house (roof) where she lives and to buy seeds for her vegetable farm

loans.name: Mareme's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 5 femmes qui habitent le même quartier, elles font toutes du commerce et ont une bonne cohésion sociale. Mareme est la représentante du groupe elle est mariée et mère d'un garçon de 8 ans et d'une fille de 10 ans. elle fait du commerce de tissu. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 3 pièces de tissu en  bazin 270000f,et 205000f de tissu en soie. Elle est très expérimentée dans ce domaine pour avoir fait cet activité depuis  5 ans. Elle s'en sort bien car est très célèbre dans la vente de tissu. Avec ses bénéfices elle gère ses besoins personnelles et augmente son stock de marchandise de plus en plus et pour ce qui est du reste son marie gère toute les dépenses de la maison.
texts.en:
This group comprises five women who live in the same neighborhood.  They are all involved in retail and are united by strong social ties.

Mareme is the group's representative.  She is married and the mother of an 8-year-old son and a 10-year-old daughter.  

Mareme sells fabrics.  She plans to use her loan to buy three pieces of damask fabric for a total of 270,000 francs, as well as some silk for 205,000 francs. She has been involved in this activity for five years and has a good experience in her field.  She is doing quite well and is well-known as a fabric seller.  

She uses her profits to take care of her own needs and to constantly increase her stock of merchandise.  Her husband is the one managing all the household's expenses.

loans.use: to buy three pieces of damask fabric and some silk.

loans.name: Blandine Thérèse

texts.fr: Blandine est une femme de 49 ans, marié et mère de 05 enfants. elle possède une petite usine où elle détaille et vend des détergents en sachet dans une quartier de la ville depuis 1 an.elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des détergents en sac pour renforcer son stock de marchandises afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et ses bénéfices. les profits générés vont être injecter dans son capital afin de l'augmenter d'une part et vont subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (éducation, santé, nutrition) d'autre part.
texts.en: Blandine is a woman of 49, married and the mother of five children. She has had a little factory where she packages and sells detergents by the envelope in a district of the town for one year. She is asking for this loan to buy detergents by the bag to expand her stock of merchandise so that she can expand her turnover and grow her profit. The profit generated by this will in part go into increasing her working capital, and in part will be used for family needs (education, healthcare and nutrition).

loans.use: to buy detergent wholesale.

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena owns a small business. She sells women's clothing at a local market. Summer is a high season for Olena since her town is a resort place (it is located on the Azov Sea) and many people visit it during summer. 

Olena would like to increase her assortment of women's summer clothing. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 UAH that will help her to increase her sales and make additional income. 

Olena has a hobby: a small garden where she grows vegetables and fruits. Her dream is to build a small summer house and be able to live there in summer.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of summer clothing

loans.name: Ndeye's Group

texts.fr: le banc villageois abritant ce groupe a été créé le 01/02/2000. Il est composé de 6 femmes qui habitent le même village et font toutes le commerce.Ndèye est la représentante du groupe elle est âgée de 58 ans ,marié et mère de 3 enfants don 2 garçons de 35 et 18 ans et une fille de 10 ans. Elle est placé a l’extrême droite de la photo et porte le boubou bleu blanc. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 20 sacs de mil à 250000f et 6 sacs de haricot à 150000f.Ses bénéfices réalisées lui permette de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaire de sa famille.et de renforcer ses épargnes dans le BV.
texts.en: The "banc villageois" that this group belongs to was created on the 1st of February,  2000. It is made up of 6 women who live in the same village and are all retailers. Ndèye is the group representative. She is 58 years old, married and the mother of 3 children, 2 boys who are 35 and 18 years old, and one 10-year-old girl. She is standing on the far right in the picture and wearing the blue and white boubou. She plans to use her loan to buy 20 bags of millet (at 250 000 per bag) and 6 bags of beans (at 150 000 francs per bag). The profits generated by her business allow her to take care of her family's food needs and to build her savings in the "banc villageois".

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of millet and 6 bags of beans.

loans.name: Ufalme Group

texts.fr: La cliente Sekera  est conseillère du collectif  d’affaire  « Ufalme», doyenne, entrepreneur dynamique expérimentée, âgée de 61 ans, veuve et mère de 8 enfants  dont 4 étudient tous et les autres ont déjà leurs propre foyers. La cliente est vendeuse Maïs. Elle installe ses produits à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de  son mari,  il y a environ 30 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 4 sacs de maïs. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et acheter une parcelle pour ses enfants. L’insuffisance du capital constitue un défi pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: Sekera, the customer, is an advisor to the "Ufalme" business group. A doyenne and experienced, dynamic entrepreneur, she is 61 years old, widowed and the mother of 8 children, 4 of whom go to school. The others already have their own households. Sekera sells maize. She displays her products at home. She started her business about 30 years ago with her own funds, received from her husband. This new loan will be used to buy 4 bags of maize. She would like to increase her business, feed and educate her children and buy them a plot of land. The lack of sufficient capital is a challenge to the growth of her business. Finally, she wishes to strongly thank Hekima for its support of small entrepreneurs in the form of microloans.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of maize.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 06 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 23 mai 2002. Les membres qui le composent vivent une parfaite solidarité et s’entraident. Elles font comme activité le commerce et l'embouche.
Amy, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont une fille.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle compte faire du commerce et l'embouche. Elle va acheter 6 moutons à 150 000f et un bœuf à 200 000f. Avec le reste de l'argent elle va mener son commerce: vente d'huile, de savon, du poison séché et autres produits. 
Les bénéfices lui servent à épargner et renforcer son embouche.
texts.en: This group of 6 women is part of the "banc villageois" which was created on the 23rd of May, 2002. Its members have a close-knit unity and help each other. They are retailers and also fatten livestock. Amy, standing on the right of the picture and raising her hand, is 55 years old. She is married and the mother of 6 children, one of whom is a girl. She plans to invest the loan she receives in her retail and livestock-fattening businesses. She will buy 6 sheep at 150 000 francs each and an oxen for 200 000 francs. She will use the rest of the money for her retail business, selling oil, soap, dried fish and other products. She uses her profits to build her savings and reinforce her livestock-fattening business.

loans.use: to buy various food products, 6 sheep and one oxen.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María, a sus 65 años de edad es madre cabeza de hogar, pues su esposo la abandonó hace muchos años. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a trabajar en el sector de confecciones, laboró en diferentes empresas como operaria y actualmente presta el servicio de bordado y terminación de prendas para algunos talleres de confección del sector donde reside. Durante todos los años que laboró, pudo ahorrar y adquirir propiedades, de las cuales hoy en día recibe una renta mensual, con lo que ha podido solventar los gastos de su hogar. María  es una señora pujante, organizada, emprendedora y muy dedicada a su familia y a su labor, ella manifiesta que “su edad no es impedimento para hacer lo que le gusta”. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de una máquina plana e insumos para continuar realizando su labor y poder obtener más contratos, lo que le ayudará a cumplir el sueño de comprar máquinas recubridoras para poder conseguir contratos con nuevas empresas y además desea capacitarse en el manejo de las mismas, esto le permitirá brindar oportunidades de empleo a madres cabeza de hogar y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: María is 65 years old and head of her household, for her husband left her many years ago. She has been a seamstress for twenty years, first in the employ of several clothing companies, and now for a few workshops in her area, where she does embroidery and puts the finishing touches on clothes. María was fortunate enough to save money and to buy houses, from which she now derives a monthly income, which she needs to pay for household expenses. She is very determined, organised, and full of enterprising spirit. She is also very devoted to both her family and her work, and proudly states that her age does not get in the way of her doing what she likes. María asks for a loan in order to buy a sewing machine and supplies, so as to keep working and get more orders to fulfill. This will enable her to make her dream of buying more sophisticated sewing machines come true. This way, she would be able to fulfill orders for more workshops. She also wants to learn how to use these machines so as to then give single mothers an employment opportunity and improve her standard of living as well as theirs.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (a sewing machine) and supplies.

loans.name: Ephata Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwambikwa est leader du collectif  d’affaire  « Ephata», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 36 ans et mère de 5 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un petit commerçant de divers. La cliente est vendeuse de friperie. Elle installe ses articles au marché, parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari, il y a environ 2 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter  1 ballon de friperie. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Mwambikwa is the leader of the Ephata business group. A young experienced entrepreneur, Mwambikwa is 36 years old and a mother of five children, who all go to school. Her husband sells various goods for a living. 

Mwambikwa sells second-hand clothing. She displays her goods in a market, and sometimes at home. She started her business about two years ago with funds from her husband.

This new loan will serve to buy one bale of second-hand clothing. 

Mwambikwa wishes to increase her business and to educate and feed her children.

Finally, Mwambikwa strongly thanks Hekima for their lending support to small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy one bale of second-hand clothing

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Elda

texts.es:
La señora Elda es estudiante universitaria de la carrera de enfermería, ella le ayuda su marido con los gastos, ya que están trabajando juntos y viven en casa propia.
Su meta es de tener su titulo y poder trabajar, para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella es muy sacrificada y está luchando por poder mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que quiere poder cubrir el costo de su titulación, ya que es un poco costoso. Esta agradecida por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Elda is a university student; she is studying to become a nurse. Her husband helps her with the expenses, since they work and live together. They live in a house of their own.

Her goal is to receive a degree in order to be able to work and help her family. She is a hardworking person who is fighting to improve her and her family’s life.

Elda is requesting a loan to pay for the high cost of officially registering her degree. She appreciates this opportunity.

loans.use: to officially register her degree.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is a 45-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of five children. Her husband owns a mobile shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of cell phones and mobile accessories, including hands-free, mobile chargers, etc., in his shop.

Presently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to a lack of capital, he finds this difficult. 

Therefore, his wife, Sughran, as a memeber of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. In this way, she can help her husband to purchase a variety of cell phones and sell them in the market at profitable prices. With the profits, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Sughran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cell phones and mobile accessories.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
Mahmud is 25 years old, not yet married. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his parents in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Mahmud  is a Fuzulu refugee. He is a worker who repairs cars. He has been in this field since his childhood, and he established his own business in 2009. He has good experience in this field and employs two people. He is well-known in the neighborhood, thanks to his affordable prices. He is a very talented person.

Now Mahmud wants to take a loan because he requires new equipment and machinery in his garage. With a good loan history, he has applied for his 5th  loan of 1,500 AZN. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and machinery in his garage.

loans.name: Jaguar Group

texts.en:
Ruth, who is in her mid-30s, is single with a son who is in school. For seven months now, Ruth has had a retail shop selling different products like baking flour, maize flour, sugar, airtime, sweets, etc. Previously, Ruth had been running a genge business selling fruits and vegetables, but she closed it due to low returns compared to her current business.  

Ruth starts working from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a small profit per month. This is her eighth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to restock more shop products like dry food items. With the previous loans, all of which were repaid successfully, she opened her previous business and the current one. With the business profit earned, she covered home expenses. She also used the profit to cover her son's school fees, which are now high compared to previously because she changed schools for her son from a government one to a private one (English-medium school). Ruth dreams that one day, she will be able to own a big wholesale business. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Jaguar," which consists of nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock more shop products like dry food items.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is married with two children who are infant and school-aged. Maricel is 31 years old and lives in Cantabon, Siquijor, Siquijor.

Maricel is engaged in a food-vending activity to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to be used for purchasing additional vegetables and fruits such as potatoes, carrots,  etc. 

Maricel has been a member of PMPC for two years and shows a good credit record. In the future, Maricel hopes to expand and improve her business with this institution.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy noodles, eggs, breads, canned goods and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Inda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, two of whom are in school, Inda works hard to support her family.

Inda has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a 30000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses.

Inda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent bills. 

For the past four years, she has operated a poultry business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of diseases. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 50,000 KES (Kenyan shillings), she wants to purchase 150 chickens and seven sacks of chicken feed for better production. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 150 chickens and seven sacks of chicken feed for better production.

loans.name: Michael

texts.ru:
Михаил женат. Он работает начальником охраны на железной дороге. Михаил молодой и ответственный. Сейчас он проживет в доме вместе с женой и родителями. Через полгода они ожидают пополнение в своей семье.

Михаил просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 6000 гривен на ремонт комнаты. В данный момент комната не пригодна для проживания. Он хочет положить на потолок гиптокартон, пошпаклевать и покрасить. Кредит поможет улучшить жилищные условия его семьи.
texts.en:
Michael is married. He works as a head of security of the railway. Michael is young and responsible. Right now he lives at home with his wife and parents. They are expecting a new member in the family in six months.

Michael is asking to provide him with a loan in the amount of 6,000 hryvnas to repair a room. At this time the room in his apartment is not suitable for living. He wants to put sheet rock on the ceiling, to plaster and to paint it. The loan will help him to improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to improve living conditions for his family.

loans.name: Erik

texts.en:
Erik has always dreamt of becoming a professional. Erik is currently attending the Universidad Católica Boliviana San Pablo, working towards his degree in business. He plans on graduating in October 2013, but without a loan from Vittana he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school. With this loan, Erik plans on using the funds to pay his graduation fees. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Tarija. With three younger brothers and one younger sister, Erik hopes to be a role model for his younger siblings by being the first in his family to graduate from university.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner Banco Fie.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en: Maritza dreams of becoming a professional but, without a degree, knows it may never be possible. Maritza is currently attending the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier, working towards her degree in business. She plans to graduate in December 2013 but without a loan from Vittana she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. Maritza plans on using her loan to buy her school books. Up until now, she has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, she feels she will be able to get better grades. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. Currently Maritza earns $8 a day. With a degree in business, she expects to earn $15 a day. With two older siblings attending college already, Maritza is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Maritza currently works 25 hours a week to help afford her school and living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for books

loans.name: Monica Flavia

texts.en: Monica has always dreamed of becoming a professional. Monica is currently attending the Universidad Mayor De San Andrés, working towards her degree in business. She plans to graduate in March 2014 but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. Monica plans to use the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in business before graduating. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Monica currently works 40 hours a week and earns $15 a day. With a degree in business, she expects to earn $25 a day. Unfortunately, Monica's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, her parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, finances have always been tight. With two older siblings attending college already, Monica is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. To help afford her school and living expenses, Monica currently works as a cashier.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman and has one child who is still underage and does not go to school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but not piped water. 

Mwanamisi has operated a tailoring business for the past two years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a sewing machine for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Blasina

texts.es:
Blasina es una joven estudiante de Odontología, ella está solicitando un prestamo para poder pagar sus estudios. Esta es su historia:
Mi nombre es Blasina, soy nativa y resido en municipio de Hato Viejo, Yamasa, Monte Plata en el Noreste de la Republica Dominicana, tengo 20 años de edad, soy una estudiante de escasos recursos y debido a la condición de mi familia, me es muy difícil costearme los estudios ya que los recursos económicos de mis padres son muy limitados y yo no cuento con un empleo.  Tengo una familia numerosa; de 8 hermanos y los ingresos de mi padre que es chofer de carro público;  apenas nos alcanza para comer cada día  porque somos once en total.
Tengo mis sueños de tener una carrera, en mi comunidad hace falta gente con voluntad para poder echar para adelante a Hato Viejo, mi deseo es poder llevar un granito de arena a esta gente que tanto lo necesita al igual que a mi familia. Actualmente soy  voluntaria en un programa de alfabetización para mi comunidad que se llama “Quisqueya Aprende contigo”  lo cual me llena de satisfacción. 
Actualmente estudio odontología  en UPHEC, universidad en la cual sus maestros son muy capacitados, pero para poder hacerlo necesito RD$251,000  que me permitirá  cubrir la matrícula de la   carrera,  pero tengo la limitante de que no puedo costearme los costos de la misma.
Este préstamo es necesario para mí, para poder lograr mi sueño y contribuir con mi comunidad, sin  la ayuda de este préstamo me sería  imposible seguir cursando mi carrera, ya que me abriría las  puertas que en este momento están cerradas para mí y para mi familia que necesita de mi apoyo por lo que   espero poder contar con una mano generosa o varias  que apuesten a mí para poder cumplir mi gran sueño de ser odontóloga y después yo pueda seguir apoyando  a otros cuando logre  ser profesional.
texts.en:
Blasina is a young woman who studies dentistry. She is requesting a loan to pay for her studies. This is her story:

My name is Blasina; I was born and raised in the municipality of Hato Viejo, Yamasa, Monte Plata, located in Northeastern Dominican Republic. I am 20 years old. I am a student with limited resources, and due to my family’s economic condition, it is difficult for me to pay for my studies. My parents do not make enough and I am unemployed. I have a large family: eight siblings supported by my father, who is a public-transport driver and makes barely enough to feed a family of eleven.

My dream is to become a professional. My community lacks people that are willing to help Hato Viejo to progress. I would like to give a small contribution to these people who have many needs, such as my family. I am currently working as a volunteer in a literacy program in my community, called “Quisqueya aprende contigo” [Quisqueya learns with you], which fills my heart with satisfaction.

I am studying dentistry in UPHEC, a university with well-prepared teachers. However, I need RD$251,000 [DOP] in order to pay for the tuition fee and I do not have them.

This loan is important for me, in order to make my dream come true and contribute to my community. Without it, it would be impossible for me to continue with my studies, which can open doors that would otherwise be closed for me and my family. They need my support and I hope to have one or several helping hands that believe in me and in my dream of becoming a dentist. When I become a professional, I will be able to support others as well.

loans.use: to pay for the university's tution fee.

loans.name: Nelson Marcelo

texts.en:
Nelson dreams of becoming a professional but without a degree, knows it may never be possible. To achieve his goal, Nelson has enrolled in the Universidad Autónoma Juan Misael Saracho. He plans to graduate in June 2014 but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. Nelson plans to use his loan to buy his school books. Up until now, he has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, he feels he will be able to get better grades. One of his biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. Unfortunately, Nelson's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, his parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, finances have always been tight. Nelson currently works 25 hours a week as a security guard to help afford his school and living expenses.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner BancoFie.

loans.use: to pay for books

loans.name: Mariela Claudia

texts.en:
Mariela has always dreamed of becoming a professional. Mariela was accepted into the Universidad Pública De El Alto and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording graduation fees. She expects to graduate in October 2013 but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Mariela shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

Mariela plans to use the loan funds to pay her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in El Alto. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With two other siblings, Mariela is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. Mariela currently works 30 hours a week as an architect to help afford her school and living expenses.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner BancoFie.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Jhosmar Natalio

texts.en: Jhosmar dreams of becoming a professional. He was accepted into the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier and now, with the chance to achieve his dream, is concerned about affording his books. He plans to graduate in December 2013 but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. With this loan, Jhosmar plans to buy his school books. Up until now, he has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, he feels he will be able to get better grades. In addition to his responsibilities at school, Jhosmar currently works 30 hours a week and earns $10 a day. With a career in business, he expects to earn $15 a day, a substantial increase from before. With one older sibling already attending college, Jhosmar is unsure how he will be able to afford his school supplies on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Jhosmar currently works as a consultant to help afford his school and living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for books

loans.name: Fidel Jhonatan

texts.en:
Fidel dreams of becoming a professional but without a degree, knows it may never be possible. Fidel is currently attending the Instituto Tecnológico Caranavi, working towards his degree in business. He expects to graduate in December 2014 but without a loan is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. Fidel shares that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With this loan, Fidel plans to buy his school books. Up until now, he has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, he feels he will be able to get better grades. One of his biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. Fidel's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For his family of six, finances have always been tight. With one older sibling already attending college, Fidel is unsure how he will be able to afford his tuition fees on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. To help afford his school and living expenses, Fidel currently works 40 hours a week as a cook.

This loan is administered by Vittana's partner BancoFie.

loans.use: to pay for books

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.es:
Vanesa es una joven de 17 años que va a estudiar Lic. en Educación, ella está solicitando un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de sostenimiento, transporte y libros. Esta es su historia: 
Mi nombre es Vanesa, nací en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, tengo 17 años, a la edad de 13 años mi padre murió y mi madre quedo sola y es quien me ha sostenido con sacrificio, mi madre trabaja como secretaria, su salario a penas nos alcanza para los gastos fijos y alimentarnos, quiero lograr mi sueño de ser profesional en Educación y ella no me puede pagar los estudios ya que no es suficiente con su salario.
