Con el beneficio de este préstamo podré costear los libros, materiales y transporte, ya que mi madre no lo puede pagar, y realizar el sueño de trabajar enseñando y ayudando a niños con problemas de aprendizaje y también ayudando personas a leer y escribir que nunca fueron a una escuela, como un aporte al desarrollo de mi país. 

Este préstamo representa mi esperanza de poder lograr mi sueño de ser profesional y de esta manera ayudar a mi madre y devolverle de cierta forma el esfuerzo que ella ha hecho por sacarme adelante a raíz de la muerte de mi padre.

Espero poder contar con una mano amiga para lograr este sueño.

Se despide


Vanesa.
texts.en:
Vanesa, 17, is a young woman who will be getting a Bachelor’s in Education.  She’s requesting a loan to be able to pay for sustenance, transportation and textbooks.  This is her story:

My name is Vanesa.  I was born in the city of Santo Domingo.  I’m 17-years-old.  My father died when I was 13 and my mother was left alone; she has sacrificed to support me.  My mother works as a secretary and her salary is barely enough to pay for fixed costs and food.  I want to reach my dream of becoming a professional educator but she’s unable to pay for my schooling because her salary is insufficient.

With the benefit of this loan, I’ll be able to pay for texts, supplies and transportation because my mother’s unable to pay for them and to reach my dream of working teaching and helping children with learning problems and also to contribute to my country by helping people who never went to school to learn to read and write.

This loan represents my hope of being able to reach my dream of becoming a professional to help my mother this way somehow repaying her for all the effort she’s made to move me ahead after my father’s death.

I hope to find a friendly hand to help me attain this dream.

Farewell,
Vanesa

loans.use: to pay for textbooks, transportation and sustenance while studying Education.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José es un estudiante que está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar sus estudios de Mercadeo. Esta es su historia: Mi nombre es José  y tengo 36 años, resido en Santo Domingo, actualmente vivo con mis padres y mi hermano mayor que no tiene trabajo por lo que mi sueldo a penas me da para sobrevivir, mi padre trabaja como seguridad de una empresa y mi madre esta desempleada. 
Tengo 2 niñas de 4 y 7 respectivamente, mi trabajo a penas me permite cubrir nuestras necesidades y no del todo, me gustaría estudiar para poder darles a mis hijas y mis padres una mejor calidad de vida pero nuestros recursos económicos me impiden entrar a la universidad, es por esto que el préstamo KIVA-FUNDAPEC es mi única esperanza para lograr mi sueño de estudiar Mercadeo y poder adquirir conocimientos y mejorar mi calidad de vida y la de mi familia, es mi manera de poder retribuirle a mis padres el esfuerzo que hicieron por criarme y darme dentro de sus posibilidades lo necesario para hacerme bachiller y poder ganarme la vida.
José
texts.en:
José's  a student who's requesting a loan to be able to pay for his studies in marketing.  This is his story:

My name is José and I'm 36 years old.  Currently I live in Santo Domingo with my parents and my older brother, who doesn't have a job, which is why my salary is barely enough for me to survive.  My father works in security for a business and my mother's unemployed.

I have two daughters, ages 4 and 7.  My job barely allows me to cover our needs, and not completely.  I would like to go to school to be able to give my daughters and my parents a better quality of life, but our economic resources don't allow me to attend college.

This is why the Kiva-FUNDAPEC loan is my only hope of achieving my dream of studying marketing and being able to learn and improve my family's quality of life.  It's my way of repaying my parents for the effort they made to raise me and give me what they could so I could graduate and be able to earn a living for myself.

José

loans.use: to pay for his studies in marketing

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es una persona joven, estudiante con ganas de salir adelante, para cumplir las metas y objetivos propuestos, tratar de ayudar a sus padres, tener un buen trabajo con buen ingreso el que pueda ayudar a solventar sus gastos de manera independiente.
Está estudiando la carrera de psicología forense, una carrera apasionante que le gusta mucho. Es muy sacrificada y quiere salir adelante por medio de su trabajo.
Solicita de esta ayuda para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de  su universidad, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Silvia is a young student who wants to get ahead and meet her goals and objectives. These include helping her parents and having a good job with a good income so she can pay her bills independently. 

She is doing a degree in forensic psychology - an exciting program that she really enjoys. She is very hard-working and wants to get ahead by working. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her university tuition. It would be a great help to her.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Safura

texts.en:
Safura is 58 years old and married with four children. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Safura is a Fuzulu refugee. For the past 10 years, she has been raising sheep because mutton is in high demand in this region. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, and other dishes. Safura earns 140 AZN each month which is very profitable. She works with her husband and they keep a flock of sheep in their yard to fatten. Safura takes the meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase from her. 

Safura is requesting a 2,000 AZN loan to buy 12 sheep in order to sell more meat in the summer. She is optimistic about her loan, because in the summer more people consume meat due to the holidays and increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to buy 12 sheep to sell more meat in the summer

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
This is Liberty. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy additional computer parts and supplies and have her computers maintained. Her income from the loan helped her in sending her children to school. She has been in this business for only two years, but her computer shop is continuously growing. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Liberty would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 30,000, to buy parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the family's daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Liberty dreams to have many branches and hopes to give her children a good life and education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to find strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Asma's Group

texts.en:
Asma is a 33-year-old married woman who is the mother of four children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Asma's husband is an electrician by profession. 

Asma is the leader of two-person loan group requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase switches, switch boards, wires, and electric instruments for her husband. Asma's husband will be able to offer more variety to his customers and she hopes that her loan will be helpful for his business. Asma is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase switches, switch boards, wires, and electric instruments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide to produce vegetables

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth is a 44-year-old married woman with one child, who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Janeth has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines. Janeth applied for a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothes to sell. Janeth has been in this business for a year. In the future, Janeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is married and has a restaurant in the Philippines. She has run her business for 36 years now and  she earns additional income from raising pigs. Lourdes works hard to support her family. 

Lourdes is requesting a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, spices, fish, and vegetables. She has successfully repaid her previous loan. In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, spices, fish, and vegetables

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
Luzvilla is 57 years old and married with three children, none of whom are in school. She is rice farmer and has been raising pigs for the last four years. Luzvilla has received eight previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Luzvilla is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to expand her business to secure the financial of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in the Nkubu area of eastern Kenya, situated along the slopes of Mt.Kenya. He is married and has four children, one of whom is in school. He has practiced farming for over fifteen years. His sources of income are cash crops, cereals, and milk.

James wants to purchase a chaff cutter for cutting napier grass for his dairy cows. He has requested a loan of KES 30,000 for purchasing it. This will increase his animal feed and, thus, increase production. This will increase his income base which will allow James to give better education to his child and also improve his family's living standards. The major challenges he faces are poor markets and poor transportation/infrastructure. 

In five years, James wants to have purchased a cooling plant for his milk production. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for making the loan available to him.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Sirac

texts.en: Sirac is 28 years old and married. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Sirac is a Fuzulu refugee. He has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than eight years. He is very hard-working and passionate about his work. He considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers and to plant fruit trees with his wife. He sells his crops in the central bazaar to make profits, in order to support his family. Sirac’s income from business is 130 AZN. In order to improve the living conditions of his family, he plans to expand his business. This will require a lot of dedication and effort. He believes that, in the near future, his sons will help him to grow the business. Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and fun, he wants the business to continue and prosper. He has applied to Aqroinvest for a loan of 2,000 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of buying new fertilizer and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to obtain more revenue in the coming summer, which will help him to meet his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizer and seeds for his fruit and vegetable farm.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is a 38-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has five children. The oldest is 20, while the youngest is eight months old. She engages in retail business. She produces nipa (palm thatch) to be used as roofing material for thatched houses and dwellings. She sells nipa to earn for a living. Her husband works as a carpenter. To continue her livelihood activity, Jennifer applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP buy more nipa and bamboo to meet customer demand. In the future, Jennifer would like to expand her nipa-making business to be able to send all her children for college educations.

loans.use: to buy more nipa palm and bamboo to make thatch to sell.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en: Jasmin is 60 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child in school. Jasmin is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Jasmin applied for a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bottles of pesticides to sell. Jasmin has been farming rice for six years, and she has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Jasmin would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bottles of pesticides to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy "malagkit"(glutinous rice), coconut, sugar and other ingredients needed in cooking rice cake and "puto pao" (meat buns) for sale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph lives in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya, a fertile area for agricultural production, located on the slopes of Mt. Kenya. He is married and has two children, all of whom are of schoolgoing age. He has practiced farming for over fifteen years. His income is mainly from cash crops and horticultural crops. He wants to purchase a water tank and water pipes for irrigation purposes, and he has applied for a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, of KES 40,000, to undertake the project. This loan will boost his production, because there will be continuous irrigation, thus making his crops do well. Profit from the increased production will help improve his family's living standard. The challenge he faces are insects, diseases, and poor transportation. In five years he wants to have acquired a pick-up truck. Joseph appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for its quick loan processing.

loans.use: to buy water pumps and pipes to irrigate his farm.

loans.name: Zavkiya

texts.en:
Zavkiya is a wonderful woman. She is married. As her husband has not a good source of income, she is the main bread-winner in her family. It is very difficult for her to provide her husband, son and her mother-in-law with all necessities. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than nine years. She works at this business with pleasure. She likes animals. 

Zaykiya was born and grew up in a village, so she has a great experience in this field. She buys animals at the local market and fattens them in her barn. After some months she resells the animals at the local market. Her husband helps her with the business.

Zaykiya wants to increase the number of cattle she presently has. Currently she is asking for a loan of 8000 somoni to buy cattle. This is her first loan from IMON. She is hardworking and an honest woman. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase her working capital

loans.name: Qardashxan

texts.en:
Qardashxan is a 58-year-old man who is married with three sons. He is an internally displaced person (IDP).  For the past 20 years, Qardashxan has been engaged in cattle breeding and he sells milk and dairy products to the local vendors. Milk and milk products are in high demand and provide a stable income. Qardashxan earns 230 AZN each month. 

Qardashxan is requesting a  2,000 AZN loan to purchase a milk cow and a calf to increase his sales. This is his third loan and he has a good loan history. Qardashxan awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and a calf to increase his sales

loans.name: Elxan

texts.en: Elxan is 48 years old, married, and the father of four kids. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one earning an income. Elxan started his business 20 years ago, repairing cars. Now he needs a loan of 1800 AZN to repair his workshop. He wants to use the profits he earns for his children’s future. In the future, Elxan wants to have a second business location and an employee. This will enable his business to be more profitable. This is Elxan's second loan. He is thankful to Aqroinvest and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to repair his workshop.

loans.name: Sumiya

texts.en:
Mr.Sumiya is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a Ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Udval, helps him to run their family business of organic vegetable and fruits on their plot of land and in their greenhouses. His two children are toddlers and go to a local kindergarten. 

Sumiya has been running an organic vegetable and fruit plantation and sales business on their plot of land since 2005. He also runs a taxi service during the winter when fruit and vegetable season ends and the family's income decreases. 

Sumiya is requesting a MNT 3,000,000 loan to purchase a large amount of seeds, seedlings, and fertilizer for his organic vegetable and fruit business. He is a hard-working and confident man.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of seeds, seedlings, and fertilizer for his organic vegetable and fruit business.

loans.name: Eleazar

texts.en:
Eleazar is 28 years old and single. He lives in Cantabon, Siquijor. For the past two years, Eleazar has been a farmer. He earns 1,500 PHP each month and is a new member of PMPC.

Eleazar is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, he hopes to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy household goods to sell in her store, including oil, rice, eggs, shampoo and other groceries. Jonalyn has been in this business for eight years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to further build her business. Jonalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy household goods to sell, such as oil, rice, eggs, shampoo,  and other groceries.

loans.name: Saraveya

texts.en:
Saraveya appreciates her previous loan that enabled her generate more profit by adding stock to her restaurant. She is grateful for the Kiva loan that has enabled her boost her restaurant business.

Saraveya is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase 50 kilograms of rice, a bale of wheat flour, chicken, and maize flour for her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat flour, chicken, and maize flour

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 33-year-old married man who lives with his wife, 9-year-old daughter, and parents.  The entire family is actively involved in agricultural activities.  In particular, they have 4 milking cows, whose milk is used in cheese products.  They also have a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land, where nut trees are grown.  David works hard to ensure a good harvest.  

He decided to start his own business because his current income is seasonal and not enough for the family.  All of the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, David applied for the credit to MFO Credo.  His request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative, start-up program with Kiva.  This program permits the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.  

A loan of $4,300 will help David to purchase all the needed raw materials to build a greenhouse.  Once the greenhouse is built, he will be able to grow tomatoes and greens and generate a more stable income.  This will help David to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en: Elijah is a married man and has been blessed with one child, who attends school. They live at their own house, which has electricity but no piped water. He has operated a cereal business for over six years. It operates at the market, where his neighbours are potential customers. He faces a major challenge of stiff competition in his business. With the KES 50,000 loan, he wants to purchase bags of beans for resale. He dreams of expanding his business by opening up a wholesale cereal shop.

loans.use: to purchase bags of beans for sale, in hope of expanding his business by opening up a wholesale cereal shop.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married mother of four school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Asha has operated a retail shop for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbors. She faces a challenge of delayed payments by creditors in her business. Asha dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase 10 crates of sodas, 20 kg of rice, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat/oil.

loans.use: to purchase 10 crates of sodas, 20 kg of rice, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat/oil

loans.name: Rafael Arcángel

texts.es: Rafael a sus 50 años de edad es padre soltero de 2 hijos. Desde hace muchos años inició su propio negocio, un taller donde fabrica calzado, esta actividad la aprendió cuando trabajaba en una empresa como operario. Luego de que la madre de sus hijos lo abandonara, Rafael pasó por muchas situaciones precarias, pues no tenía quien lo apoyara con el cuidado de sus hijos, por lo que decidió independizarse, para poderse encargar de sus hijos y además tener tiempo para trabajar y generar los ingresos que solventan sus necesidades. El titular es un hombre amable, pujante, activo, trabajador y dedicado a sus hijos, por los que lucha incansablemente, trabajando arduas jornadas de Lunes a Domingo, para sacarlos adelante. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (cordones, cuero, pintura, suelas, caucho) con el fin de tener materia prima disponible y variada para entregar los pedidos a tiempo y satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, con lo que obtendrá más ingresos por ventas y así podrá avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal meta que es fortalecer su negocio para poder generar oportunidades de empleo y así tener la posibilidad de brindar una mejor educación a sus hijos, para que tengan un futuro próspero y disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rafael, 50, is single and the father of two children. He started his own business many years ago: a shoemaker’s workshop. He learned this activity while he was working for a company. After the children’s mother abandoned them, Rafael had difficult times since he had no one to take care of the children. This is why he decided to become independent in order to take care of them and have time to focus on working and making a living.

Rafael is a kind, enthusiastic, energetic and hardworking man devoted to his children. He works hard for them, Monday to Sunday, fighting to help them to get ahead. He is requesting a loan to buy supplies in bulk (shoestrings, leather, paints, soles, rubber) in order to have the raw material he needs to deliver his customers’ orders on time and satisfy their demands. This will result in more profits from his sales and will help him to reach his goal, which is to strengthen the business and create job opportunities. He also wants to give his children a better education so that they can have a better future and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk (shoestrings, leather, paint, soles and rubber).

loans.name: Eduart

texts.en:
Eduart is a 37-year-old father of five children. The oldest is 13 and the youngest is one. 

“I got married very young and got the first child very soon after. I love the kids though; they are a real blessing to me. While they’re at school, I feel that the house is so empty and when they’re at home, is so much fun having them all around. 

"About ten years ago, just like almost any other villager who chose to do agriculture for living, I chose to do that, too. I might say that I secure the food for the entire family through it and this is very important because we are seven people relying on it. Also, I generate an income by selling the fresh produce to the local market that helps me cover some very basic expenses,” said Eduart.

Eduart now wants to add one more cow to the existing herd.

loans.use: to add one more cow to the existing herd.

loans.name: Andrey

texts.ru:
Андрей занимается фермерством. С 1998 года на своих 20-ти сотках он выращивает молодой помидор и перец.
В семье Андрея есть супруга двое детей, младшему 6 лет, старшему 15 лет, все они помогают справляться по хозяйству.
Деятельность Андрея началась с выращивания помидор в открытом грунте.
Андрей решил приобрести мотоблок для вспашки и культивации своего земельного участка, т.к нанимать рабочих очень дорого.
В будущем (не сейчас) Андрей с супругой планирует приобрести сеялку для мотоблока, а также в планах посадить огурцы и кабачки.
В семейных планах Андрея – дать хорошее образование своим детям, а также купить автомобиль для транспортировки товара на рынок сбыта.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования мотоблока.
texts.en:
Andrey earns his living as a farmer.  He has been growing young tomatoes and peppers on his 20 decares of land since 1998.  His family includes his wife and two children, of whom the youngest is 6 and the eldest 15. They all help manage the farm.    

Andrey started the business by growing tomatoes in an open field.  It's expensive to hire labor, so he has decided to get a walk-behind tractor to till and cultivate his plot. In the future (not right now), he and his wife plan to get a seed sowing machine for the tractor, plus they plan to plant cucumbers and squash.  

Andrey's plans for his family include providing his children with a good education and buying a car to take his produce to the market to sell.  He needs your help to finance the tractor.

loans.use: to purchase mechanized farming equipment.

loans.name: Jeton

texts.en:
Jeton is married and has two children eight months and five years old. He lives in Kosovo, in a small village. Jeton earns his living by working in a private company as a painter, but with a very low salary. Jeton's work is very important to him as he is the only one in the family who has a job and is able to generate income and provide for them.  

Now he is planning to start his own freelance painting business. For this reason he needs a business start up loan. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 2000 Euros so he can purchase a machine and other supplies. Jeton is hoping that because he has a lot of experience and a customer base from previous jobs that his business will be successful quickly and he will start with much business immediately. He is very optimistic that he will have much success and continue to increase his clientele and business demands. It is in this way that he can improve his living conditions and provide a decent life for his family. He wants to thank all lenders!

loans.use: To purchase a machine and other supplies for his work

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 51-year-old woman who lives in the small village of Khelvachauri district.  She lives with her mother-in-law, son, daughter-in-law, and two infant grandchildren.  Her mother-in-law receives a retirement pension.  

Marina is a very hardworking woman who is actively involved in agricultural activities.  She has 3 milking cows that she milks every day.  She produces cheese products to sell at the local markets.  In addition, she has a plot of agricultural land, where different kinds of fruits and vegetables are grown.  As the existing income is not enough for her family, Marina decided to request a loan for a new business.  All of the financial institutions rejected her loan due to unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  

After several unsuccessful attempts, Marina applied for credit to MFO Credo.  Her request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva.  This program permits the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.  A loan of $5,000 will help Marina to purchase a minibus.  Once purchased, her son will be able to work on the minibus line and receive a stable income.  This will guarantee to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus.

loans.name: Edvard

texts.en:
Edvard is a 37-year-old married man who lives in the small village of Kobuleti district with his wife, Gulnara, and parents.  Gulnara is a teacher at the local public school.  Edvard is actively involved in agricultural activities.  In particular, he has a plot of agricultural land where nut trees and mandarin trees are grown.  He sells the harvested products at the local markets. 

As the existing income is seasonal and not enough for a four-member family, Edvard decided to start his own business.  All of the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Edvard applied for the credit to MFO Credo.  His request was approved in the framework of a Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva.  This program enables the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.  

A loan of $3,000 will help him to purchase a minibus.  Once the minibus is purchased, he will work on the minibus line and increase the family income.  With the increased income, he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family members.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and work on the minibus line.

loans.name: Rojita

texts.en: Rojita is 28 years old and married. She has one child. She runs a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough capital. She feels better since she applied for her first loan, and now she is applying for her second loan, of $1,200. She will buy some additional supplies to stock her store, such as noodles, soft drinks (Coca Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko), beer, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, oil, body loosener and biscuits. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin), which offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy noodles, soft  drinks (Coca Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko), beer, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk and oils to stock her store.

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es:
Gisela es madre soltera y dispone de una habitación en la casa de su madre en la zona de San Martin de la ciudad de La Paz. Ella es chofer de microbus, trabajo que realiza por mas de diez horas al día. Requiere el crédito para realizar un mantenimiento completo de su vehículo.

El sueño de Gisela es poder salir de la casa de su Madre e independizarse en una casa propia.
texts.en: Gisela is a single mother and has a room in her mother's house in the San Martin area of the city of La Paz. She is microbus driver, work she does for more than ten hours a day. She needs the loan in order to carry out a complete maintenance of her vehicle. Gisela's dream is to be able to leave her mother's house and become independent in her own home.

loans.use: To maintain her microbus.

loans.name: Majallon

texts.en:
Majallon is 38 years old and married with three children who are in school. For the past year, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from buying and selling shoes. Majallon works hard to provide for her family and has borrowed and repaid 21 previous loans from NWTF.

Majallon is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as rice, salt, sugar, soap, shampoo, groceries, and other products to sell. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy rice, salt, sugar, soap, shampoo, groceries, and other products to sell

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en:
Saeeda is a 50-year-old married woman who is the mother of four children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Saeeda's husband owns a clothing boutique which is the only source of income for the family. He presently needs additional capital for the growth of his business. 

Saeeda is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to prepare dresses to sell. Her loan will help him to offer greater variety to his customers. He will use the profit from the loan to set aside some savings to pay the electricity and gas bill. Saeeda hopes that her loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old, married, and has nine children.  

Maria is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria has been business for 37 years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: John Smith

texts.es: John a sus 21 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Luego de terminar sus estudios secundarios, comenzó a laborar como ayudante de construcción, pero con el fin de generar unos ingresos más estables decidió montar su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes donde ofrece mecato, galletería, gaseosas, carnes frías, entre otros. Esta actividad la aprendió de un amigo, y para conseguir los ingresos suficientes para el sustento de su familia, trabaja de Lunes a Domingo. Cuenta con el apoyo de una persona que trabaja esporádicamente, especialmente en los días que él tiene contratos en construcción. John es un joven dinámico, entusiasta, pujante y emprendedor, su principal motivación para seguir adelante son sus padres. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de un enfriador, pues el que posee actualmente lo debe dividir para guardar las carnes y el pollo y las gaseosas, afectando la salubridad y la higiene de los productos, ya que se pueden contaminar y por lo tanto ocasionar pérdidas. Con esto podrá brindar una mejor imagen a su negocio y los productos no se contaminarán, con lo cual podrá aumentar su margen de ganancia por ventas, esto le permitirá fortalecer su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: John is 21 years old, single, and has no children.  After completing high school, he started working as a construction assistant, but since he wanted to have a more stable income, he decided to start his own business; a grocery store where he sells groceries, cookies, cold cuts, and other things.  He learned this business from a friend and works Monday through Sunday in order to earn enough income for his family.  He has help from another person who works sporadically, especially on days when he has construction contracts.  John is a young, dynamic, vigorous, enterprising man whose main motivation is to get ahead with his parents.  He is asking for this loan so that he can buy a cooler, because the one he has he must use to store the meats, chicken, and soft drinks, affecting the health and sanitation of the products and also risking contamination which will result in losses.  With this he can present a better image for his business, his products won’t get contaminated, and he will be able to increase his profit margin.  This will allow him to strengthen his business and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cooler.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, el vive con su familia que la componen su esposa y su hijo  de dos años, para los cuales el trabaja ya que no recibe ayuda de nadie más y es el único sostén de su casa.
Víctor, se dedica a la venta de pollos, el dice que este es un oficio de familia, para venderlos el sale muy temprano de su hogar lo cual, el manifiesta que lo hace con mucho agrado, ya que es el sostén de su familia.
El  solicita el crédito para invertir en compra de pollos de engorde y de esa manera poder agrandar su negocio, mejorar las ventas y poder incrementar sus ganancias; además  manifiesta que uno de sus mayores sueños es tener una granja con más de dos mil pollos y poder vender en el mercado,  así obtener mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Víctor lives with his family which consists of his wife and a two year old child. He works to support them as the sole breadwinner with no help from anyone else. Victor sells chickens, he says this is the family trade. He gets up very early to sell them. He explains that he does this with pleasure, as this is how he supports his family. 

Victor is asking for this loan in order to buy broilers (chickens), Doing this he can make his business bigger, increase his sales and his revenue. He states that one of his biggest dreams is to have a farm with over two thousand chickens and be able to sell in the market, thus increasing his profits.

loans.use: to buy broilers (chickens).
